title: Data Scientist, Sourcing Analytics

description:
b"

Position Description


you need to have
  • PhD in computer science or similar field with 3+ years of experience
  • Highly proficient in Python or Java
  • Extremely hands on in building Machine Learning products
  • Experience in building data products and crunching terabytes of data
  • A good portfolio of machine learning projects with a significant impact on the bottom line
  • Experience in working as a tech lead
  • Blog posts, papers or conference talks showing your involvement in the community

Minimum Qualifications


  • Familiarity with Deep Learning
  • Contributions to open source ML projects

Additional Preferred Qualifications


Company Summary


The Walmart eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. As the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest retailer, we are on a mission to help people save money and live better. With the help of some of the brightest minds in technology, merchandising, marketing, supply chain, talent and more, we are reimagining the intersection of digital and physical shopping to help achieve that mission.

Position Summary


The search algorithms team @WalmartLabs is dedicated to the mission of helping millions of customers every day in finding the right products. We are at the forefront of attacking one of the most complex problems of e-commerce. Whenever a user types in a query or browses through product categories on the web site, phone or the iPad, our service goes to work. We mine billions of search queries and tens of millions of products to find the most relevant products for our customers. Team members take end-end responsibility in analyzing large amounts of data, creating complex models, improving their accuracy and deploying these models to serve customers.

As part of this team, you'll solve some of the most fascinating and impactful problems in machine learning, information retrieval, NLP or computer vision problems. The algorithms you develop will champion customers need to express their intent and our goal to understand their preferences, implicitly or explicitly across devices and modalities (voice, text, image etc.). You will develop and deploy machine learned models, to engage and converse with our customers and to understand their goals and expectations to enable them to make the right purchase decision. Your work will be visible to millions of customers and you will have a direct impact on the goals of the Fortune #1 enterprise. If you speak and think machine learning then we want to talk to you. Come join our team and be part of this exciting journey.

In this role you will
  • Act as a thought leader to identify right problems to solve for our customers
  • Design and implement state of the art Machine Learning approaches
  • Work as a tech lead and define the roadmap for yourself and co-workers
  • Develop end-to-end ownership of major customer facing technologies
  • Stay up-to-date with the state of the art techniques of Machine Learning, Information Retrieval
  • Become an expert either in NLP, Search Ranking or Computer Vision
  • Push the boundaries of Machine Learning to benefit internal and external community
  • Be a brand ambassador for @WalmartLabs.
"
title: Senior Data Scientist (GEC11902)

description:
b'
Job Description

We have an outstanding career opportunity for an entry level Associate Data Scientist located in our new corporate headquarters in Tinton Falls, NJ. This position will work closely with members of the worldwide Data Services team to help enhance and expand our business intelligence and data-driven initiatives. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with a desire to jump into a fast-paced and rapidly growing organization.

Position Responsibilities Include:

  • Work with our Data Science team to understand the gaps and coordinate between multiple business teams to gather requirements.
  • Locate, gather, select, and cleanse datasets ideally suited to provide data insights related to the requirements.
  • Analyze, explore, and characterize data trends and characteristics that relate to the business domain.
  • Design, develop, test, and document predictive, classifier, and deep learning machine learning AI models.

Position Requirements Include:

  • A minimum of Bachelor degree in Computer Science / Math or a related field, Master degree is a plus
  • Previous professional experience in Data Science or similar analytical role
  • Strong SQL coding experience in terms of both data extraction and reporting
  • Previous professional experience using Salesforce, Marketo and SQL Server
  • Good professional experience using R and Python for data manipulation and model building and scoring
  • Some exposure to SQL server Machine Learning technics
  • Previous professional experience building dashboards in Power BI and in Qlik Sense
  • Good critical thinking abilities and analytical skills
  • Document own work in an organized manner and present regular reports on progress
  • Previous working experience using PwerPoint to summarize analysis results in a presentation
  • Must have reliable transportation to our Tinton Falls, NJ office

Qualifications

null

Additional Information

Recognized as a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Data Center Backup and Recovery Software, our industry's definitive independent ranking. For the seventh straight year, Commvault has been named a leader. And this year we're furthest on the "completeness of vision" and highest on the "ability to execute."

Commvault offers its products through a broad array of distribution partners globally, while building upon its strong portfolio of strategic partnerships with leading technology companies including Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Cisco, Oracle, SAP, Nutanix, Pure, HP, Hitachi, NetApp and many others. Commvault's global headquarters is located in Tinton Falls NJ, with additional offices that support customers globally across the Americas, EMEA, and APAC.

Commvault is an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are always committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. and we will not discriminate against on the basis of such characteristics or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we work.

title: Associate Data Scientist

description:
b'Company Overview

Digital Assets Data is a leader in helping sophisticated institutional investors understand the cryptoasset markets through unique data sets and insightful analysis. A fast-growing startup with over $5m in seed funding, Digital Assets Data has already rolled out software to some of the top crypto funds.

Data Scientist Role

Digital Assets Data is looking for a Data Scientist to join our analytics team based in Denver, CO. As a Data Scientist, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be a part of a high performing team that is leading the disruption of the crypto investment industry. We are looking for someone who is motivated and passionate about designing novel trading indicators, indices, and analyses in the emerging field of cryptoanalysis as well as producing thought leadership that will help shape how investors think about and value the space. With extremely large datasets consisting of billions of records from exchanges and blockchains, you will be utilizing data that very few in the industry has access to.

Perks

  • Join a well-funded and rapidly growing startup in one of the fastest growing tech sectors\xe2\x80\x94cryptocurrencies and distributed ledger technology
  • Work with an energetic, passionate, and knowledgeable team\xe2\x80\x94a team that\xe2\x80\x99s previously built and sold an enterprise, software-as-a-service startup, also in the fintech space
  • Learn about distributed ledger technology and the cryptocurrency ecosystem
  • Receive competitive benefits (health, dental and vision)
Duties and Responsibilities

  • Produce novel analyses on the cryptoasset markets utilizing Python and Jupyter Notebooks
  • Evaluate the use of standard financial modeling techniques for use in cryptocurrency
  • Develop trading indicators and predictive / forecasting models specific to cryptoasset markets that showcase the Digital Assets Data analytic platform and datasets
  • Communicate findings to non-technical customers and stakeholders
  • Work collaboratively with the development team to enhance our analytic infrastructure and ensure our data is complete and high quality
  • Help design and implement standard data science functions within the analytic platform, lowering the technical requirement for customers to produce their own advanced analyses
  • Implement new statistical variables via SQL stored procedures
  • Lead, develop, and mentor a team of 4+ Research Analysts and Junior Data Scientists
  • Some travel may be required
Required Qualifications

  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, or other Quantitative Discipline
  • Bachelors + 4 Years Experience, Masters + 2 Years Experience
  • Expertise in analytical technology
  • Fluency in Python for analytics (Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, Scikit-learn, etc)
  • Knowledge and education in statistics, probability, and combinatorics and their applications in business and analytics
  • Extensive experience manipulating and analyzing time-series data
  • Machine learning expertise -- building machine learning models from start to finish, including gathering and cleaning data, feature engineering, feature selection and dimensionality reduction, algorithm selection, algorithm tuning, output generation and use
  • Extensive experience working with relational databases, including ETL and data warehousing fundamentals
  • Mastery of SQL (preferably PostgreSQL)
  • Ability to be a leading contributor and thought leader in the emerging field of cryptoanalysis
  • Experience in financial data analysis
Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in analyzing cryptoassets, preferably from a financial perspective
  • Experience using the the Jupyter Notebook ecosystem, leveraging Altair for visualization
  • Experience with leveraging big data tools, including Spark and Hadoop, for data science
Digital Assets Data Inc. is not able to offer immigration sponsorship at this time.'

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Inovalon is a leading technology company that combines advanced cloud-based data analytics and data-driven intervention platforms to achieve meaningful insight and impact in clinical and quality outcomes, utilization, and financial performance across the healthcare landscape. Inovalon's unique achievement of value is delivered through the effective progression of Turning Data into Insight, and Insight into Action.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Michael Kors is always interested in hearing from talented, globally-minded individuals with a passion for fashion.

If you enjoy working in a creative, fast-paced environment, then we would love to hear from you!

Position Overview:

The Data Analyst is responsible for understanding and advancing Michael Kors knowledge of customer behavior through data. This role will support the Digital, Email and Retail Marketing teams to provide customer lists, reports and insights to inform strategic decision making and marketing activations. The Data Analyst will also become a subject matter expert on Michael Kors customer data and downstream systems, supporting the Advanced Analytics team in leveraging the data and analytics tools.

Major responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Development and execution of SQL and R-based queries to create customer lists and KPI-based reports. Draws recommendations from insights for business-facing customer profiles.
  • Partners with Digital, Email and Retail Marketing teams to activate on customer data strategies; responsible for implementation of marketing campaigns and customer journeys in Customer Data Platform. The Data Analyst will also implement algorithms and segments created by the Advanced Analytics team in the Customer Data Platform.
  • Acts as an expert on Michael Kors customer data, maintaining a clear understanding of the data and business rules in the Data Dictionary.
  • Supports new technological integrations, upgrades and ingestion of new data sources by validating data between systems; ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
  • Identify and research data inconsistency issues, working closely with IT business partners and outside vendors to enhance Michael Kors Analytics and Reporting Environment.
  • Works with IT Data Engineer to implement new business variables in Michael Kors Analytics and Reporting Environment.
  • Executes data capture and database reporting to compare with Michael Kors goals for database health and growth.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Business Analytics or related field.
  • 1-2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience working in data/analytics.
  • Familiarity one or more of the following: customer transaction data and email data, loyalty, web interaction data
  • Proficiency in SQL, R and Python preferred.
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).
  • Ability to prioritize and manage assignments to meet deadlines and establish solid relationships.
  • Solid oral and written communication skills.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer M/D/F/V

title: ESCC Data Analyst (24951)

description:
b"*****************************************
Together, we will save millions of lives.
*****************************************

Carrot Inc. is a digital health company tackling the global health crisis of cigarette smoking, the chief preventable cause of death in America. Our unique technology combines an FDA cleared medical device with cognitive behavioral therapy delivered by live human coaches via an engaging smartphone app. We're led by a team with deep medical device and healthcare expertise, and funded by one of the leading digital health investors.

Joining at this formative stage, you'll have the unique opportunity help bring to market a broad range of projects and deliverables for a variety of audiences including consumers, behavioral coaches, content creators, and more.

-----------
Description
-----------

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to define key metrics, build dashboards, run custom analyses, find data insights and publish them. You will primarily work with Carrot's Product team and Data Engineering team, but will also work with other stakeholders in Marketing, Sales, Customer Support and Finance. You will enable product user success and feature testing.

--------------------
What you'll be doing
--------------------

  • Design, build, and maintain multi-dimensional dashboards and analyses to offer data-enabled business decisions and insights
  • Build models of user behavior analysis
  • Document and maintain a Dictionary of Business Terms and Metrics
  • Work with the Data Engineering Team to maintain a Data Dictionary in the Carrot Data Warehouse that enables you to work efficiently
  • Work with the QA and development teams to confirm existing and new features are instrumented properly
  • Identify focus areas, formulate hypotheses, and create in-depth analyses to translate data into insights and make recommendations to improve the product to drive outcomes for users and achieve business goals
  • Lead A/B test design, implementation and evaluation for growth and engagement campaigns, and make results-driven recommendations
--------------------
What you should have
--------------------

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in Engineering or other quantitative field (i.e. Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science)
  • 5+ years of experience in business intelligence, business analytics, consulting, and/or data science
  • Fantastic SQL skills and Tableau Skills
  • Skills in Linux, R, Python, and Excel to analyze multi-dimensional data sets
  • Knowledge of 3rd party data tools (ie Mixpanel, Google Analytics, and Zendesk)
  • A strong understanding of statistics
  • A genuine passion for data and insights
  • Ability to draw conclusion from data and provide recommendations
  • Presentation skills including creating Keynote/PowerPoint presentations
  • Ability to prioritize and project manage requests for engineering
  • Bonus: Machine Learning algorithm experience
-------------
What We Offer
-------------

At Carrot Inc., we'll take care of you.

In addition to competitive salaries, challenging work assignments, and developmental opportunities, we offer medical, dental and vision insurance, stock options and generous PTO, including dedicated time for volunteering.

Office location featuring Bay Trails access to the waterway, walking path, full service gym with pool, world class cafe on-site, Caltrain shuttle and close proximity to 101.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Visit www.pivot.co ( http://www.pivot.co/ ) and my.pivot.co ( http://my.pivot.co/ ) (our product websites) to learn more about what we are doing."
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
b"As a Data Analyst, you will help build TrueMotion's data lake and collect, analyze and validate data for use by the organization and/or its clients. You will construct and apply standard statistical analysis and or financial models to verify data acceptability and accuracy, and ensure data integrity by implementing quality assurance practices, gather and entering missing data and resolving any anomalies. You will identify areas of improvement in data collection processes or systems and make recommendations to correct any deficiencies. You will work as part of our data lake team on the ETL (extraction, transform and load) process and projects.

You will:
  • Perform business analysis using various techniques, including statistical analysis and predictive modeling.
  • Work with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success and other departments to identify their reporting requirements, document reports and their interdependencies.
  • Develop dashboards, reporting, and presentations.
  • Develop actionable insights with recommendations for the current business operations or issues.
  • Develop data testing and monitoring algorithms that efficiently identify incongruences and changes in data and reporting.
  • Monitor data lake for changes and discrepancies in findings, notifying manager, and identify data points that routinely require review.
  • Update and add new data in data lake including setting up data dictionaries, definitions, document reporting and their dependencies, and to relay internal department data and reporting requirements.
  • Produce ad hoc data and reports.
  • Identify data processes and practices in need of improving and recommend plan for improving the process.
  • Complete any additional tasks that may arise.
You have:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science or similar required. Master's degree preferred.
  • Minimum 2 years' experience in Data Analytics and Reporting, Data Science, Data Quality, or Data Warehousing.
  • Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Infogram, Plotly and/or Visual.ly.
  • Ability to code in SQL to update and retrieve data, highlight data changes and identify data incongruencies.
  • Strong communications skills with ability to raise questions, define needs and relay outcomes.
  • MS Office including Excel and PowerPoint.
Work Environment:
  • General environment that requires long periods of sitting and/or standing, and bending.
  • Ability to routinely lift 5 lbs. or less.
  • Use of computer for long periods of time with ability to read, comprehend and interpret graphical, visual and/or written material.
Compensation:
  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Stock options
  • Comprehensive benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k)
  • Flexible Paid Time Off
Additional Perks

  • Feel great working to solve a serious problem (distracted driving)
  • Touch your toes thanks to our daily post stand-up meeting team stretch
  • Burn some calories during our optional weekly fun-run around the Boston waterfront
  • Get to really know your coworkers over a drink and snacks every Thursday afternoon
  • Have fun at our frequent team outings, where we go to Red Sox games, volunteer to clean-up the Esplanade, etc.
Why TrueMotion?

At TrueMotion we build solutions that make driving safer, lower cost, and more fun. We use the smartphone as a sensor and machine learning to turn phone data into driving data. We believe distracted driving is a solvable problem and partner with insurance companies and other relevant organizations to drive change (pun intended). We are a band of entrepreneurs dedicated to our mission and having fun at our office on Fort Point Channel!

TrueMotion is backed by General Catalyst, Bain Capital Ventures and Lakestar. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability state."
title: Data Analyst II

description:
b'
Internship
Rally Health is all about putting health in the hands of the individual. It's our mission, and it drives everything we do, which is to empower people with easy-to-use online and mobile tools that help them take charge of their health and health care, from improving their diet and fitness to selecting health benefits, and choosing the right doctor at the right price for their needs.

Our culture is built on a deep and sincere commitment to helping people live healthier lives. To do this, we are committed to innovating at every level. As our president and COO David Ko says, "We are a company that continuously innovates. It cannot end. It has to be in everything we do, which means that some of the things we're going to do are not going to work \xe2\x80\x93 and that's okay. We're not trying to build something that is churn and burn. We're building something that follows consumers over their lifetime."

Responsibilities:
  • Conduct ad-hoc data analyses and queries to support product capabilities
  • Monitor operational dashboards and use data analysis to investigate issues
  • Investigate and answer questions with data
  • Help define and monitor key business and operational metrics
  • Work with our data to ensure accuracy, answer product questions, communicate value to clients and measure and improve our performance to make sure we are effectively delivering initiatives and driving health improvements
  • Occasionally work on investigations and analyses with Survey and Campaigns data
  • Be the go-to team member for data and investigations essential to the functioning of these product areas, using a mixture of BI tools, direct querying and data analysis to support operational needs
Qualifications:
  • Pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree, or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience with SQL, including the ability to work with data structures
  • Experience with Python or R
  • General understanding of data schemas and structures
  • Proficiency using Excel to analyze data
  • An inquisitive mind and keen business insight
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent communications skills with and about data
  • Proven ability to manage competing priorities at a time
  • Adaptable, proactive, energetic and willing to learn and deliver on a variety of tasks and responsibilities
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment focused on continuous product innovation
  • Experience with Hadoop/Hive/Spark and big data environments preferred
  • Experience scripting in Bash or similar preferred
  • Experience querying MongoDB preferred
  • Experience building dashboards and visualizations in Tableau, or ability to quickly get up to speed
Why join Rally? On top of an innovative work atmosphere and a chance to help people change their lives, we offer competitive pay, daily catered lunches, and an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). In addition, offer the ability to grow, while truly making an impact in the healthcare system.

Rally Health is committed to ensuring that its workforce reflects America's diverse population. Rally Health knows that such diversity will enrich us with the talent, energy, perspective and inspiration it needs to achieve its mission. Rally Health believes in a policy of equal employment and opportunity for all people based on merit and commitment to the principles of diversity. It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote individuals in all job titles, and administer all programs, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, sex, age, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, genetic information, disability, matriculation, political affiliation, veteran status, union affiliation, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply. Applicants who require an accommodation related to the application and/or review process should notify Talent Acquisition (recruiting@rallyhealth.com).

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.'
title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b'

TEAM VELOCITY
Team Velocity is a full-service marketing agency serving the automotive industry, providing fully integrated marketing solutions to Manufacturers (OEMs) and Dealerships nationwide. Our unique culture promotes creativity, camaraderie, and success. Our team members are hard-working and driven to achieve success for our clients.

DATA ANALYST
This position will create and prepare marketing lists using specific company processes, as well as custom client instructions. As a member of the Product Development Team, you will work closely with other Data Analysts and the Production Team in a coordinated effort to produce quality marketing materials to meet customer satisfaction and performance goals.

Local candidates preferred. Exceptional remote candidates living in the Eastern Time Zone will be considered.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Review source data files for accuracy and completion which will be used within our reporting and web platform products
  • Interpret market research reports and analyze trends in client data to create clean, superior targeted consumer marketing lists
  • Communicate with outside vendors and internal personnel to ensure data is being delivered in a timely manner
  • Accurately and efficiently implement tasks from start to completion following specific guidelines and processes, cross-checking against process log and invoices to ensure accuracy
  • Assist other departments and leadership, as requested, with managing and interpreting available data for the development of marketing materials and presentations
  • Query databases using SQL tools to perform analytics
  • Utilize software and applications for list processing, data hygiene, and USPS mail pre-sort, including CASS certification, NCOA, duplicate removal, mass editing of records, ordering of conquest records, and processing/exporting into a USPS mailable formats

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Must strive to maintain and uphold all internal processes and procedures
  • Must be detail oriented and able to complete tasks in a timely manner
  • Must work well under pressure
  • Must take own initiative to improve tasks and meet company goals
  • Must be flexible to provide support on new projects and services as the company evolves and grows
  • Must be able to work well as a team player
  • Must be punctual and have a professional demeanor

REQUIREMENTS:

  • BA/BS in computer science, mathematics, statistics, business or related field
  • 2-5 years\xe2\x80\x99 professional experience with relevant applications
  • Experience with SQL Server Management Studio or similar database tooling, a PLUS!
  • Analytical mindset and attention to detail
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office products
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

COMPENSATION
Competitive compensation will be commensurate with experience. Participation in company benefit offerings includes medical, dental, vision, 401K, and wellness. This is a full-time, onsite, salaried position located at our corporate office in Herndon, VA. Local candidates preferred. Exceptional remote candidates living in the Eastern Time Zone will be considered.

NEXT STEPS
If you are interested in this position and believe your experience is a perfect fit, please COMPLETE the online application. Please be sure to include a current resume along with your contact information. Incomplete submissions will not be considered. No phone calls, please.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Data Tree LLC is the nation's leading provider of property information and online recorded public land records. We offer billions of imaged documents along with innovative, comprehensive post closing and servicing solutions, including document retrieval, data delivery, lien release and assignment preparation, and document management services. Data Tree is a member of the First American Financial Corporation family of companies that was named one of FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For\xc2\xae in 2016 and 2017. For more information, please visit www.datatree.com.

Job Summary

First American Data Tree is a company concentrated on delivering high quality data solutions to the financial, real estate and legal markets. We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Data Analyst to join our highly energized organization supporting rapid growth in the real estate information industry.

This is a great opportunity to work with an entrepreneurial minded team within the First American Data Operations organization. You will determine innovative methods to enhance our data assets by examining client reported inquiries and conducting detailed analysis to recommend solutions to enhance data quality. This is a unique position that requires a regular engagement with customers, yet still working in the heart of the data organization. The ideal candidate has proven public record data knowledge, experience with high-touch client engagements, and a demonstrated passion for achieving data superiority.

Specific Responsibilities

  • Serve as the data expert and relationship manager for top clients that subscribe to our data, products and services.
  • Employ data quality tools to conduct research, determine root cause of errors, and perform data repairs.
  • Work with various data, sales, fulfillment and product teams to enhance data solutions.
  • Represent data team in meetings with clients, sales and stakeholders.
  • Conduct training and support on-boarding process by establishing the rules of engagement for \xe2\x80\x9cmaintenance data support\xe2\x80\x9d.

Job Qualifications

  • BS Degree in a relevant discipline (C.S., CIS, Statistics, etc.) or 5+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience working with public record data
  • Demonstrated experience with SQL to performing data quality reviews and analysis
  • Ability to use data products or bulk data files to analyze the content and quality of a deliverable.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and experience interfacing with clients, products and sales teams
  • Ability to make independent decisions on behalf of the data quality team

First American invests in its employee\xe2\x80\x99s development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer. For more information about our Company and our dedication to putting People First, check out firstam.com/careers.

title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
b'
The Role
Come help our customers learn more about the world. Below is a small sample of the questions we've asked of our data over the last year.

  • Did Lyft's prospects improve in politically progressive areas in the aftermath of Uber's press woes?
  • Is Amazon's revenue growth in the fourth quarter primarily driven by customers in rural areas?
  • How did the path of the solar eclipse affect hotel bookings across the United States?


As part of a nascent customer-focused function on the data team, you will be responsible for helping industry-leading companies understand how purchase and travel behavior is changing in America. You will become an expert in our dataset and answers questions from prospects, customers, and internal stakeholders to help extract value from our data.

You
You creatively work through problems with statistically sound thinking and have the natural itch to follow obstacles to their root cause. You think deeply about the problems ahead and are comfortable moving between tools in your toolbelt. And you are quick to learn, implementing new approaches when facing questions that demand it. You are a stickler for quality and pay careful attention to the details that matter.

You are a gifted communicator and are passionate about helping others make sense of data. You are comfortable juggling multiple projects at one time and relish the opportunity to empower leaders in finance, technology, and consumer goods with data to shape their long term strategy.

Requirements
  • 2+ years of SQL experience
  • Ability to communicate findings to non-experts
  • Desire to learn data modeling technologies (python, spark) and build on statistical knowledge
  • Bachelors in social science (Economics, Sociology, ...), related discipline or equivalent experience
  • Excited by a high learning curve
  • Excellent written and oral communicator


Compensation and Benefits
  • Highly competitive salary and benefits
  • Stock grants pre-IPO at a company backed by top investors
  • Take unlimited, responsible vacation


About Us
Edison provides intelligent email solutions for users and competitive intelligence for businesses. The largest, most valuable and as yet untapped data on earth is in mail; 3x larger than the worldwide web. Through our user base of more than 3 million users, we empower investors, brands, and technology companies to understand trends in the marketplace and gain deep insights into consumer behavior patterns.

As a team, we're collaborative, engaged, and committed to continually improving as we serve our mission. None of us are on an island- we trust our teammates to lend a hand when we're stuck and our egos take a backseat to figuring out the best approach to tackling problems. We're energized by tough problems and are excited to know that a challenge ahead of us does not have a textbook solution. Finally, we're always in a posture of learning- there is a lot we do not know but that does not hold us back from making an attempt at solutions. We lead thorough blameless postmortems to become better analysts, scientists, and leaders.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Job Description

As a Data Analyst , you will leverage data and statistics to revolutionize Kaplan Professional platforms and products to drive meaningfully better outcomes for our learners and our clients.

Job Requirements


Problem Definition:

  • Assess work requests and determine the problem to be solved
  • Converse with stakeholders to ensure the problem is accurately defined
  • Gather and generate hypotheses as to what solutions might exist


Data Preparation / Analysis:

  • Determine all data points to be collected to analyze the problem
  • Gather data from disparate sources (APIs, databases, files, and, documents)
  • Clean and merge data sets to make broader data sets for analysis
  • Perform exploratory analysis to understand the nature of data sets
  • Identify relationships, patterns, and, driving factors in data
  • Build, evaluate, and refine predictive models over time


Recommend Solutions:

  • Synthesize outcomes from analysis and distill into feasible solutions
  • Communicate key findings in data using intuitive visualizations
  • Present findings and recommendations to business executives


Minimal travel (<10% per year) for training conferences or team meetings

Minimum Requirements

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Quantitative Discipline or equivalent in education and experience
  • Some experience in data analysis, 1 year strongly preferred
  • Solid skills in Python/R to perform job responsibilities
  • Sound knowledge of what methods to apply based on the problem to be solved.
  • Firm grasp of the scientific method and how to conduct experiments.
  • Sound knowledge of the best way to visually communicate data to lay audiences.
  • Attention to detail and a good grasp of task feasibility /effort.
  • Ability to create organized process documents for work.
  • Ability to collaborate with others within and across teams.
  • Strong desire/passion to work in education and to educate.
  • Professional
  • Inclusive
  • Creative
  • Courageous
  • Adaptable
  • Accountable

Preferred Qualifications

  • Master\xe2\x80\x99s level or higher in a quantitative degree.
  • 3+ years of experience with data analytics.
  • 1-2 years of experience in a commercial environment.
  • Experience applying data analysis or machine learning techniques to analyze student learning.
  • Experience using source control such as GitHub / Git for scripts.
  • Experience with database querying and business intelligence toolsets such as SRRS and Tableau.
  • Experience presenting findings within spreadsheet, document, and slide format.
  • Experience working in a lean culture (Gemba, Standard Work, A3, MDI).

Location

Remote/Nationwide, USA

Additional Locations

Employee Type

Employee

Job Functional Area

Data Analytics/Business Intelligence

Business Unit

00079 Kaplan Professional

Kaplan is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Job Description:

Company description:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 125 years and today has one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest news gathering operations globally. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America\xe2\x80\x99s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barron\xe2\x80\x99s, MarketWatch, Financial News, DJX, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.

The Wall Street Journal is America\xe2\x80\x99s largest newspaper by paid circulation with more than 2.2 million customers. In recent years, the Journal has expanded its core content offering to include coverage of the arts, culture, lifestyle, sports, and personal health, building on its heritage as the leading source of business and financial news. Published by Dow Jones, one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest news gathering operations with nearly 2,000 journalists in more than 80 bureaus, The Wall Street Journal now spans 12 editions in nine languages, engaging readers across newspapers, websites, magazines, social media, and video. The Journal holds 35 Pulitzer Prizes for outstanding journalism.

Dow Jones Analytics Team

The Dow Jones Analytics team comprises of a central group of Reporting / Analysts and insight specialists that empower the Dow Jones businesses to make data led informed decisions. They are based out of three main locations (Princeton, NJ; New York, and London)

Position Statement: Working closely with internal clients to define, implement, monitor an analytics suite of reports and provide insight into the numbers to help improve business outcomes.

Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:

  • Overseeing daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboards and building new using Tableau off of the new Customer Data Lake
  • interpreting trends from the data and working closely with stakeholders to enable them to understand the dynamics behind the data.
  • Proposing future actions based on the insights learnt.

Preferred Tools/Skills:

  • Understanding of membership process
  • Understanding of ROI
  • Understanding of Close rates and Churn
  • Use of Tableau / SQL
  • Use of analytics tool such as Adobe / Google Analytics
  • Detail Orientation
  • Self-starter
  • Strong written and oral communications needed

Knowledge/Experience: Ideally have worked as a Data Analyst within an organization that deals with membership and advertising models.

Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets .

Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, please reach out to us at TalentResourceTeam@dowjones.com . Please put \xe2\x80\x9cReasonable Accommodation" in the subject line.

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 125 years and today has one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest news gathering operations globally. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America\xe2\x80\x99s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barron\xe2\x80\x99s, MarketWatch, Financial News, DJX, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (NASDAQ: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"Be a part of a data analysis team which helps retailers globally to find trends within their stores by analyzing billions of data points.

RetailNext is transforming physical retail by providing retailers with billions of data points to help them to optimize the shoppers' experience!

What is the opportunity?

RetailNext is looking for a Data Analyst to work with large data sets and assist the world's largest retailers run their business through data insights. Being an Analyst for a thriving start-up, you will be required to practice your analytical, creative, and innovative abilities. As part of a growing, fast-paced venture, this is a unique opportunity to collaborate on the analytical direction of RetailNext.

You will help by cleansing large sets of data to help retailers why their customers are acting the way they are! Additionally, you will help to contribute your findings to customer presentations where we reveal the insights we have discovered.

What will you be doing?

  • Model and analyze RetailNext's rich set of disparate data and prepare actionable recommendations for our retail customers
  • Compile and aggregate data from SQL databases for retail customer analysis
  • Mine data to produce periodic trend reports for both specific retailers as well as broader industry consumption
  • Work closely with the customer success team to design and implement advanced data solutions for customers
  • Work with product management, engineering, support, and other functions within the company to advance data initiatives
  • Be an active member/contributor to an incredible analyst team at a dynamic leading-edge technology company
Who are you?

  • 2-5 years of experience with statistical data analysis
  • Experience with SQL, including complex queries from multiple data sources
  • Experience with R or other statistical modeling programs a plus
  • Passionate about the retail industry and applying analytics to enhancing the retail experience
  • Ability to glean actionable insights from large data sets and build well-crafted stories using PPT
  • Strong understanding of and sensitivity towards data integrity and cleanliness
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and comfortable working collaboratively.
  • PowerPivot and PowerQuery experience strongly preferred
"
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
b"

We are searching for a Data Analyst to join our Enterprise Data Operations team in San Rafael. You will be responsible for building dashboards, metrics, and providing ad-hoc reporting to support EDM ops team. You will develop cross-functional relationships across engineering, sales strategy, and operations teams.

You will partner with other team members to assess and design new processes or process modifications to increase team efficiency, reduce risk, and improve our service. You will perform daily oversight activities that validate processes are executed as designed and escalate issues as appropriate. You will develop technical documentation, system guides, and provide training on efficiency solutions.

Our Enterprise Data Management Operations team provides and organizes data to drive key business initiatives across the company. We complement and support Sales Strategy , Sales Finance and Marketing teams across three critical areas: master data management activities, data enrichment, and building and maintaining company hierarchies.

Responsibilities
  • Developing and implementing Python programs for enterprise data enrichment processes
  • Building dashboards and Metrics for internal and external customers
  • Designing and developing new processes or modifying existing processes to increase team efficiency, reduce risk and to improve our services
  • Structuring various SQL queries to pull out large volume of data for ad-hoc analyses, monitoring data ETL process and creating recurring files sending to offshore team and vendors
  • Data-mining across databases to look for potentials of data enrichment with existing records and to detect syncing issues between databases and servers
  • Managing various platforms such as Salesforce, Siebel, MDM and Marketo by importing/exporting and cleansing customer data for sales reps and generating reports for stakeholders
  • Training onboarding or existing team members on processes and tools

Preferred Qualifications
  • Can adapt to change and is open to learning new skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills and sharp business judgment
  • Detail-oriented, ensuring data accuracy and consistency
  • Passionate about improving the customer experience
  • Open to new ideas and respectful of differing opinions/perspectives
  • Addresses difficult problems head-on and challenges the status quo
  • Data-curious, interested in telling the story behind the data
  • Self-motivated and can work independently in a fast-paced environment
  • Experience with and good knowledge of SQL, Python, MS Excel/PowerPoint, Google Sheets, R, HTML

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.
#LI-DNP

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

To all recruitment agencies: Autodesk does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Autodesk will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Autodesk, Inc.

title: Master Data Analyst

description:
b'

THE COMPANY: BRAINJOLT (brainjoltmedia.com)

Brainjolt is a leading digital media company with two sites in Quantcast\xe2\x80\x99s top 75 mobile sites in the U.S. We are a team of constant learners who value scrappy cleverness as much as best practices.

And it\xe2\x80\x99s working. Despite a lean team, we reach 36 million users a month across our properties and social media channels with engaging, smile-inducing viral stories, quizzes, and more.

Highlights\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Our flagship viral site, 22 Words, is ranked in the top 20 mobile sites in the country with 20M unique visitors a month.
  • MagiQuiz is ranked in the top 75 mobiles sites, boasting 3-minutes on site per visitor and whopping 60% completion rate.
  • Our social following is at 26 million and is growing fast.

Brainjolt is a culture of constant and continuous learners, who strive to better themselves every day.

THE OPPORTUNITY: PRODUCT DATA ANALYST

At the heart of it, we need someone who\xe2\x80\x99s a numbers monster to analyze pricing and bidding strategies to help develop, grow and support Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue strategy. As the Product Data Analyst, you will provide insights related to ad revenue KPIs and discover ways to automate the revenue reporting and data analysis process. We\xe2\x80\x99re keen to partner with someone who has Excel/modeling skills related to pricing, and possibly has worked at a trading desk or in fin-tech in the past.

Specifically\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Provide clean, trusted reporting about revenue.
  • Analyze pricing and bidding strategies to produce compelling models that are action-biased.
  • Work with the VP of Product and Director of Revenue to optimize existing revenue models and create new revenue streams
  • Produce detailed reports with clean, actionable data.
  • Provide thoughtful, deep analysis on areas of concern or question for the revenue team and provide recommendations on next action items.
  • Create and draft test plans and requirements for hand-off to the Company developers.
  • Structure and report on A/B tests to increase site monetization.
  • Reports to the VP of Product.

Requirements

Have to Have

  • EDUCATION: Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent experience. (Non-traditional paths welcome!)
  • EXPERIENCE: 2+ years of revenue, pricing, yield experience building pricing/bid strategies.
  • Strong foundation in Excel/data modeling with experience in aggregating 1st and 3rd party data
  • Knowledge of data management technologies and third party data sources like GDS, GA, and GAM
  • Desire to continually develop and discover new opportunities in the ever-changing programmatic ecosystem.
  • A love of working in a fast paced environment.
  • A self-starter with a results + growth driven mindset.
  • No Drama.


Nice to Have

  • Familiar with DSPs, SSPs, Exchanges, Ad Networks, Ad-Server (specifically DFP).
  • Measurable success developing programmatic strategies and managing strategic partnerships.
  • Foundational experience with Header Bidding strategies and ad stack technologies.
  • Proven track record of meeting revenue goals and supporting new business with third party vendors, trading desks, and DSPs.

EXPECTATIONS

  • REPORTING: Primary responsibility around revenue and performance reporting to ensure accurate data is provided daily either through automation or manual pulling of data.
  • TROUBLESHOOTING: This position will require some on-call availability on weekends (when needed) to deliver revenue reporting, troubleshoot issues and Ad Stack needs, communicate with revenue partners and coordinate with appropriate internal stakeholders on revenue and/or UX initiatives.
  • MITIGATE RISKS: Constantly monitor performance to eliminate any/all issues that negatively impact Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue and overall performance.
  • DATA INTEGRITY & KNOWLEDGE: Expert attention to detail and knowledge as it relates to Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue and performance data with a keen ability to deliver key insights and recommendations to ensure trust is constantly maintained with all internal stakeholders.
  • THOUGHT LEADERSHIP: Deliver key insights to the entire Brainjolt team in an effort to educate and enhance the entire company on opportunities for optimization and overall improvement.

Benefits

This position is fully remote.

Brainjolt is a fun, fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that empowers its employees to work independently and drive results that greatly impact the business. Since early on, one of our go-to values has been Fight boredom, spread happiness. We strive to do this not just for our audience, but for our team, too. In addition to basic benefits, here are some additional ways we support your continued success and happiness:

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Home internet & mobile phone assistance
  • Gym membership assistance
  • 2 tickets to a concert of your choice per year
  • Spotify, Netflix, & Audible subscriptions.
  • Monthly Personal & business-related book budget
  • And more\xe2\x80\xa6
'
title: Product Data Analyst (Remote)

description:
b"

Responsibilities

The position is responsible for the following activities:

  • Compile, validate, manage and analyze data that will be used to build various reports for the Tolling Group, Senior and Executive Management.
  • Create and maintain a library of documentation on query and report designs.
  • Compile data from various systems and perform quantitative and qualitative data analysis for internal and external requests.
  • Present data findings in a clear manner so Management understands and can determine a course of action.

Qualifications

Candidates must present the following qualifications to be considered eligible for this position:

  • Must possess a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics or a related field from an accredited college or university.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of SQL, including SQL tuning and advanced SQL queries using Oracle.
  • Demonstrated in Business Intelligence.
  • Demonstrated creating Dashboards using various BI tools.

Desired

Ideal candidates will present the following profile:

  • Knowledge of Tableau.
  • Experience in Data warehousing.
  • Knowledge of SAS.
  • Experience in ETL.
  • Knowledge of toll collection and/or back office operations.
  • Experience in Object Oriented Programming.
  • Familiarity with multiple database and reporting technologies is required.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Able to work well in a team environment, handle multiple assignments and meet deadlines.
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines while achieving required results
  • Ability to evaluate problem situations and determine optimum strategies for solutions
  • Self-motivated with ability to work independently and as a team member; ability to prioritize work volume with little supervision; drive and ability to see problems through to completion; ability to handle multiple tasks, projects, and priorities; ability to meet deadlines under time constraints and handle pressure situations with composure

Compensation & Benefits

The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey offers a competitive salary, an outstanding benefits package and a professional environment that supports development and recognizes achievement.

How To Apply

Interested candidates should apply to this job by clicking on the Apply Now button and submitting a combined cover letter and resume.

Only applicants under consideration will be contacted.

About The Port Authority

Founded in 1921, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey builds, operates, and maintains many of the most important transportation and trade infrastructure assets in the country. The agency's network of aviation, ground, rail, and seaport facilities is among the busiest in the country, supports more than 550,000 regional jobs, and generates more than $23 billion in annual wages and $80 billion in annual economic activity. The Port Authority also owns and manages the 16-acre World Trade Center site, where the 1,776-foot-tall One World Trade Center is now the tallest skyscraper in the Western Hemisphere.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey/Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Data Analyst (Performance Analyst)

description:
b'

THE COMPANY: BRAINJOLT (brainjoltmedia.com)

Brainjolt is a leading digital media company with two sites in Quantcast\xe2\x80\x99s top 75 mobile sites in the U.S. We are a team of constant learners who value scrappy cleverness as much as best practices.

And it\xe2\x80\x99s working. Despite a lean team, we reach 36 million users a month across our properties and social media channels with engaging, smile-inducing viral stories, quizzes, and more.

Highlights\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Our flagship viral site, 22 Words, is ranked in the top 20 mobile sites in the country with 20M unique visitors a month.
  • MagiQuiz is ranked in the top 75 mobiles sites, boasting 3-minutes on site per visitor and whopping 60% completion rate.
  • Our social following is at 26 million and is growing fast.

Brainjolt is a culture of constant and continuous learners, who strive to better themselves every day.

THE OPPORTUNITY: PRODUCT DATA ANALYST

At the heart of it, we need someone who\xe2\x80\x99s a numbers monster to analyze pricing and bidding strategies to help develop, grow and support Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue strategy. As the Product Data Analyst, you will provide insights related to ad revenue KPIs and discover ways to automate the revenue reporting and data analysis process. We\xe2\x80\x99re keen to partner with someone who has Excel/modeling skills related to pricing, and possibly has worked at a trading desk or in fin-tech in the past.

Specifically\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Provide clean, trusted reporting about revenue.
  • Analyze pricing and bidding strategies to produce compelling models that are action-biased.
  • Work with the VP of Product and Director of Revenue to optimize existing revenue models and create new revenue streams
  • Produce detailed reports with clean, actionable data.
  • Provide thoughtful, deep analysis on areas of concern or question for the revenue team and provide recommendations on next action items.
  • Create and draft test plans and requirements for hand-off to the Company developers.
  • Structure and report on A/B tests to increase site monetization.
  • Reports to the VP of Product.

Requirements

Have to Have

  • EDUCATION: Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent experience. (Non-traditional paths welcome!)
  • EXPERIENCE: 2+ years of revenue, pricing, yield experience building pricing/bid strategies.
  • Strong foundation in Excel/data modeling with experience in aggregating 1st and 3rd party data
  • Knowledge of data management technologies and third party data sources like GDS, GA, and GAM
  • Desire to continually develop and discover new opportunities in the ever-changing programmatic ecosystem.
  • A love of working in a fast paced environment.
  • A self-starter with a results + growth driven mindset.
  • No Drama.


Nice to Have

  • Familiar with DSPs, SSPs, Exchanges, Ad Networks, Ad-Server (specifically DFP).
  • Measurable success developing programmatic strategies and managing strategic partnerships.
  • Foundational experience with Header Bidding strategies and ad stack technologies.
  • Proven track record of meeting revenue goals and supporting new business with third party vendors, trading desks, and DSPs.

EXPECTATIONS

  • REPORTING: Primary responsibility around revenue and performance reporting to ensure accurate data is provided daily either through automation or manual pulling of data.
  • TROUBLESHOOTING: This position will require some on-call availability on weekends (when needed) to deliver revenue reporting, troubleshoot issues and Ad Stack needs, communicate with revenue partners and coordinate with appropriate internal stakeholders on revenue and/or UX initiatives.
  • MITIGATE RISKS: Constantly monitor performance to eliminate any/all issues that negatively impact Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue and overall performance.
  • DATA INTEGRITY & KNOWLEDGE: Expert attention to detail and knowledge as it relates to Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue and performance data with a keen ability to deliver key insights and recommendations to ensure trust is constantly maintained with all internal stakeholders.
  • THOUGHT LEADERSHIP: Deliver key insights to the entire Brainjolt team in an effort to educate and enhance the entire company on opportunities for optimization and overall improvement.

Benefits

This position is fully remote.

Brainjolt is a fun, fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that empowers its employees to work independently and drive results that greatly impact the business. Since early on, one of our go-to values has been Fight boredom, spread happiness. We strive to do this not just for our audience, but for our team, too. In addition to basic benefits, here are some additional ways we support your continued success and happiness:

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Home internet & mobile phone assistance
  • Gym membership assistance
  • 2 tickets to a concert of your choice per year
  • Spotify, Netflix, & Audible subscriptions.
  • Monthly Personal & business-related book budget
  • And more\xe2\x80\xa6

title: Jr. Data Analyst

description:
b'
Job Description

The Sr Business Intelligence/Data Analyst will develop system integration test plans, design and author SQL test scripts and test sets that encompass valid and invalid data, prepare test data, execute test scripts, document test results and analysis, including defect identification and resolution, and ensure that data adheres to the functional requirements as communicated by the business.

This position requires a self-motivated, dedicated, focused, and detailed individual to perform specialized testing procedures on data warehouse and ETL processes using both automated and non-automated tools. This is a hands-on position that requires a motivated self-starter with a high degree of personal accountability to manage multiple cycles of data analysis using advanced or complex SQL queries in SQL Server and/or Oracle databases as needed.

A Day in the Life:

  • Plan, coordinate, design, execute, track and report on data-driven testing for a large data warehouse and related software tools.
  • Develop a strong understanding of enterprise databases, system dependencies and the interfaces between them.
  • Reliably analyze requirements, design, reporting and testing specifications to maintain a comprehensive test suite for Enterprise Systems. Ensure that developed tests can be leveraged in the future through appropriate stewardship of test models, test data, and test processes. Continuously improve test assets based on lessons learned.
  • Define and build the test strategy, test plan, and test cases to guarantee that all data flowing within and across the Acquisition, CRM, Analytics, and Reporting systems assure data quality from both quantitative and qualitative perspectives.
  • Design and execute traceable test scripts that verify and validate the systems\xe2\x80\x99 extraction/insertion and transformation logic. Tracks data elements from source through transformation to target.
  • Work collaboratively with software architects, business analysts, developers, database administrators and data quality to resolve and correct defects. May be required to assist in the manual correction of data errors in source systems as needed.
  • Analyze formal test results in order to discover and report any defects, errors, configuration issues, and interoperability flaws.
  • Identify problematic areas on ETL processes, data workflows, data transformations, and data exceptions.
  • Communicate test progress, test results, and quality metrics to team members and management.
  • Proactively make recommendations to improve efficiency and effectiveness as it relates to quality standards and testing methodologies.
  • Provide guidance, technical assistance, and mentoring in data quality to other team members.
  • Comply with any applicable IT standards and policies. Keeps current with industry trends and practices within area of responsibility.
  • Mine large datasets and draw actionable insights
  • Present discoveries and insights to line of business teams, relating them to specific programs and initiatives
  • Partner with cross functional teams across Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Engineering in operationalizing the initiatives
  • Act as the end to end owner of the analytical method, monitoring mechanisms, and corresponding business impact of the solution delivered to the business.
  • Use predictive analytics or machine learning techniques to solve complex problems and drive business decisions
  • Employ the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns of both bad and good trends in order to help drive efficiency.
  • Design experiments, test hypotheses, and build actionable models
  • Contribute to and participate in MBR/QBR providing key results and insights
  • Present findings and recommendations to key decision makers at various management levels using a collection of dashboards, reports, and presentations
  • Learns broad range of design choices and available technology as well as becomes a SME for multiple areas
  • Consistently delivers high quality work with high test focus through automation and reviews and defines the standards for quality for the team, owns deployment,
  • Monitoring prod site issues, plans for issues by thinking proactively.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems or related discipline is required.
  • 9+ years of Data Analytics and Reporting experience
  • 3+ years experience writing complex SQL scripts to accomplish data conversion/validation testing required; experience extracting data and performing external validation of business rule transformation and violations required.
  • Experience with Hadoop is preferred
  • 3+ years direct hands-on experience with query editors, ETL and/or automation test tools; Informatica PowerCenterIDQ, HP-Mercury Quality Center and Functional Test/QTP preferred.
  • 4+ years experience with RDBMS (Oracle 10g+ or SQL Server 2005+) and database scripting and tools required Proficiency with Microsoft Office 2010 productivity suite
  • Expertise with all phases and stages of testing including functional, system, integration, data validation, performance, load, end-to-end, and regression testing.
  • Strong experience designing and developing modular manual and automation test procedures and test cases utilizing data driven, validation and verification techniques and strategies.
  • Prior healthcare industry experience in an Agile/Sprint development environment desired.
  • Strong knowledge of Data Warehouse and Data Quality practices and concepts.
  • Advanced understanding and interpretation of requirements, technical documents and development code. Proficiency in developing SQL scripts and testing extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) processes.
  • Strong organizational, communication, and analytical skills are necessary. Strong troubleshooting, investigative, and problem solving abilities. Superior written and verbal communication skills with ability to clearly and concisely articulate issues effectively to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Detailed-oriented with the ability to decompose complex and diverse projects into manageable pieces.
  • Ability to multi-task, self-manage and prioritize tight deadlines effectively.
  • Strong team player, self-starter and can work independently or with direction.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment with cross-functional teams is required


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

'
title: Sr BI/Data Analyst (Hadoop & SQL)

description:
b'
Internship

Position:

Reporting/Data Analyst Intern

Job Description:

Reporting/ Data Analyst Intern - Full-time - Summer 2019

Job Description:

Interviews: October 2018 - March 2019

Internship: Approximately 11 weeks; mid-May/mid-June to August/September. Candidates must be available to be in Denver, CO on June 17th, 2019 and through at least August 16, 2019

Based on your experience and interests, you will interview with and work on a team for approximately 11 weeks during the summer. Interns may be considered for potential full-time opportunities on based on their internship performance.

Who is Arrow Electronics?

Arrow Electronics is a global provider of products, services and solutions to industrial and commercial users of electronic components and enterprise computing solutions. Arrow serves as a supply channel partner for more than 150,000 original equipment manufacturers, value-added resellers, contract manufacturers, and commercial customers through a global network. The company maintains over 300 sales facilities and 45 distribution and value-added centers, serving over 80 countries.

A Fortune 113 company with 18,800 employees worldwide, Arrow brings technology solutions to a breadth of markets, including telecommunications, information systems, transportation, medical, industrial and consumer electronics.

Arrow provides specialized services and expertise across the entire product lifecycle. Arrow does this by connecting customers to the right technology at the right place, right time and right price

Arrow provides extraordinary value to customers and suppliers - the best technology companies in the world - and connects them through the company's industry-leading services.

Why Be an Intern?

  • Hands-on approach to learning and applying your degree
  • Chance to network with 125 interns across the U.S.
  • Small forums with our Executives and past interns
  • Stretch your presentation skills in front of our VP\xe2\x80\x99s and Directors

Functional Area

We have an exciting opportunity for Reporting/Data Analyst Intern to work full time over the summer. The IT/ Computer Information Systems Intern will develop applications that are used by Arrow\xe2\x80\x99s core businesses, as well as external customers, to deliver data and performance reports. The intern will provide data analysis focusing on the business needs and drivers. They will focus on the definition, construction, and deployment of reports, dashboards, metrics and analytic components within a dynamic and high profile business intelligence environment.

Requirements & Skills

  • Currently enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Equivalent with a graduation date no earlier than December 2019
  • Available to work full-time (40 hours/week) during the summer (May or June through Mid-August)
  • 3.0 GPA or Higher
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize based on opportunities and effectively multitask
  • Experience using Microsoft Office
  • Detail oriented mindset

Compensation

This is a paid position.

Location:

Denver (Panorama)

Time Type:

Full time

Job Category:

Non-Customer Facing/Supplier Facing

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"

Using neuroscience-based assessments and machine learning algorithms, pymetrics is reinventing the recruiting industry by matching candidates to jobs and companies where they are most likely to succeed. We are leading the charge in an evolving industry, and growing our amazing team to support the mission of using data to unleash one's full potential and remove bias from hiring.


Are you a hardworking Data Analyst who has a curiosity for solving problems and a propensity for exploring data? Do you love understanding people, behavior and believe in making the hiring-process more equitable for everyone?


As our next Data Analyst, you will work with the Data Insights & Analytics Team to understand how our product provides value for our clients. We want to make sure we\xe2\x80\x99re delivering on our mission of making hiring more predictive and less biased, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll be measuring that impact. title: Intern - Data Analyst Community Engagement

description:

Data Analyst

School of Medicine-RC - United States-Pennsylvania - (19002353)
The University of Pittsburgh Department of Radiology is seeking a full-time staff Data Analyst for the Psychiatric Molecular Imaging Program.
The applicant is expected to have strong computer and analytical skills and be comfortable using a variety of hardware platforms and specialized software tools. The Data Analyst will use various software tools (i.e. PMOD, MS Office, SPSS, MATLAB) to perform medical image data processing and analysis tasks to investigate neurochemical abnormalities in addictive disorders in humans. Strong oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skills are essential. The applicant should have a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with a focus in neuroscience, psychology, psychiatry or a related discipline.

Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree preferred or Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree and 1-2 years or more experience in lieu of Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree.
Assignment Category Fulltime-Regular
Job Classification Staff.Systems/Programmer.III
Campus Pittsburgh
Minimum Education Level Required Baccalaureate
Minimum Experience Level Required 1-2 years experience
Work Schedule Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5:00pm
Hiring Range $35,100.00 - $56,784.00
