title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

THE COMPANY: BRAINJOLT (brainjoltmedia.com)

Brainjolt is a leading digital media company with two sites in Quantcast\xe2\x80\x99s top 75 mobile sites in the U.S. We are a team of constant learners who value scrappy cleverness as much as best practices.

And it\xe2\x80\x99s working. Despite a lean team, we reach 36 million users a month across our properties and social media channels with engaging, smile-inducing viral stories, quizzes, and more.

Highlights\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Our flagship viral site, 22 Words, is ranked in the top 20 mobile sites in the country with 20M unique visitors a month.
  • MagiQuiz is ranked in the top 75 mobiles sites, boasting 3-minutes on site per visitor and whopping 60% completion rate.
  • Our social following is at 26 million and is growing fast.

Brainjolt is a culture of constant and continuous learners, who strive to better themselves every day.

THE OPPORTUNITY: PRODUCT DATA ANALYST

At the heart of it, we need someone who\xe2\x80\x99s a numbers monster to analyze pricing and bidding strategies to help develop, grow and support Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue strategy. As the Product Data Analyst, you will provide insights related to ad revenue KPIs and discover ways to automate the revenue reporting and data analysis process. We\xe2\x80\x99re keen to partner with someone who has Excel/modeling skills related to pricing, and possibly has worked at a trading desk or in fin-tech in the past.

Specifically\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Provide clean, trusted reporting about revenue.
  • Analyze pricing and bidding strategies to produce compelling models that are action-biased.
  • Work with the VP of Product and Director of Revenue to optimize existing revenue models and create new revenue streams
  • Produce detailed reports with clean, actionable data.
  • Provide thoughtful, deep analysis on areas of concern or question for the revenue team and provide recommendations on next action items.
  • Create and draft test plans and requirements for hand-off to the Company developers.
  • Structure and report on A/B tests to increase site monetization.
  • Reports to the VP of Product.

Requirements

Have to Have

  • EDUCATION: Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent experience. (Non-traditional paths welcome!)
  • EXPERIENCE: 2+ years of revenue, pricing, yield experience building pricing/bid strategies.
  • Strong foundation in Excel/data modeling with experience in aggregating 1st and 3rd party data
  • Knowledge of data management technologies and third party data sources like GDS, GA, and GAM
  • Desire to continually develop and discover new opportunities in the ever-changing programmatic ecosystem.
  • A love of working in a fast paced environment.
  • A self-starter with a results + growth driven mindset.
  • No Drama.


Nice to Have

  • Familiar with DSPs, SSPs, Exchanges, Ad Networks, Ad-Server (specifically DFP).
  • Measurable success developing programmatic strategies and managing strategic partnerships.
  • Foundational experience with Header Bidding strategies and ad stack technologies.
  • Proven track record of meeting revenue goals and supporting new business with third party vendors, trading desks, and DSPs.

EXPECTATIONS

  • REPORTING: Primary responsibility around revenue and performance reporting to ensure accurate data is provided daily either through automation or manual pulling of data.
  • TROUBLESHOOTING: This position will require some on-call availability on weekends (when needed) to deliver revenue reporting, troubleshoot issues and Ad Stack needs, communicate with revenue partners and coordinate with appropriate internal stakeholders on revenue and/or UX initiatives.
  • MITIGATE RISKS: Constantly monitor performance to eliminate any/all issues that negatively impact Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue and overall performance.
  • DATA INTEGRITY & KNOWLEDGE: Expert attention to detail and knowledge as it relates to Brainjolt\xe2\x80\x99s revenue and performance data with a keen ability to deliver key insights and recommendations to ensure trust is constantly maintained with all internal stakeholders.
  • THOUGHT LEADERSHIP: Deliver key insights to the entire Brainjolt team in an effort to educate and enhance the entire company on opportunities for optimization and overall improvement.

Benefits

This position is fully remote.

Brainjolt is a fun, fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that empowers its employees to work independently and drive results that greatly impact the business. Since early on, one of our go-to values has been Fight boredom, spread happiness. We strive to do this not just for our audience, but for our team, too. In addition to basic benefits, here are some additional ways we support your continued success and happiness:

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Home internet & mobile phone assistance
  • Gym membership assistance
  • 2 tickets to a concert of your choice per year
  • Spotify, Netflix, & Audible subscriptions.
  • Monthly Personal & business-related book budget
  • And more\xe2\x80\xa6

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
Internship

Check It Out!

Ready to be a Cooper too? This might just be right up your alley!

We\xe2\x80\x99re here to keep the dream of home ownership alive. Oh, and while we\xe2\x80\x99re at it, we\xe2\x80\x99re determined to change the lending industry itself. It\xe2\x80\x99s simple, but it won\xe2\x80\x99t be easy. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll need a great team behind us. (That\xe2\x80\x99s where you come in.) We want to show the world that transparency, candor and collaboration aren\xe2\x80\x99t just good values. They\xe2\x80\x99re good business. Working here isn\xe2\x80\x99t for people who want to punch a clock. It\xe2\x80\x99s for people who want to punch a hole in the status quo. Come join us. And make a difference instead of just a living.

Intern Job Summary

The Mr. Cooper 12 week long Summer Internship Program provides real-world, professional work experience and the opportunity to be a valued contributor! From day one you\xe2\x80\x99ll be working side-by-side with your mentor and manger on project-based work that enables you to apply the knowledge and skills you are learning through college courses. And we\xe2\x80\x99re not talking about \xe2\x80\x9cbusy work\xe2\x80\x9d here; this is about gaining valuable hands-on experience that is critical to our success. You\xe2\x80\x99ll do real work, earn real pay and have a ton of fun while doing it!

Role and Responsibilities

The data analyst Intern will be involved in learning efficient ways of gathering business requirements and putting together source to target data mappings (sttm) for reporting & etl development in an agile environment. This position will also involve reverse engineering stored procedures and SQL scripts in an effort to create data mappings documentation from existing logic. The intern will be embedded with the rest of the data engineering team comprising of data architects, data analysts and BI Developers. This intern is coming in at a pivotal moment in the advancement of the data space because of the exciting upcoming efforts geared for implementation by our team. The scope of the summer project assignment is gathering Reporting and ETL requirements, and putting together Source to target data mappings through reverse engineering of existing sql stored procedures and scripts sometimes.

Essential Functions

\xe2\x80\xa2Gather and put together data mappings for ETL & reporting development \xe2\x80\xa2Work in an agile team environment to complete projects \xe2\x80\xa2Showcase the ability to accurately gather and sometime reverse engineer and translate business requirements to technical requirements

What will you gain?

1. You'll be able to work with innovative and cutting edge technologies

2. Involvement with exciting and extremely visible projects

3. We have an incredibly technologically diverse team in terms of skillset that you'd work alongside

Requirements for this Role

\xe2\x80\xa2Knowledge and understating of ETL & Data technologies pertaining to reporting \xe2\x80\xa2Hands-on and understanding of SQL programming \xe2\x80\xa2Hands-on and understanding of rdbms (relational database management system) \xe2\x80\xa2Knowledge and understanding of Data Analysis \xe2\x80\xa2Preferred: Knowledge and understanding of at least one reporting and/or etl tool \xe2\x80\xa2Preferred: CLOUD COMPUTING (azure is a plus) \xe2\x80\xa2Preferred: data science

Intern Qualifications & Ability:

  • A high school diploma or state accepted equivalency is required.
  • Currently a junior or senior in college with an expected graduation date in 2019 - 2021
  • Must be 18 years of age
  • Ability to execute multiple tasks and projects concurrently to meet deadlines
  • Demonstration of leadership and working within a group or team environment a plus
  • Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas

title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b'

Who are we?

AP Intego - one of the fastest growing insurance agencies in the country - is looking for a bright, motivated and hard-working individual to join our team to help us accomplish our mission of combining insurance know-how, innovative technology and world-class service to delight our customers. We are committed to providing our employees with excellent pay & benefits, and a chance to contribute meaningfully to a growing company in an exciting industry.

Purpose of this role: To support our organization by providing an in-depth analysis of our key metrics. As an Analyst, you will become the expert at gathering, synthesizing our data to offer solid business recommendations that support our goals and strategies. You will optimize the data to build top-down business analytics that evaluates our results and effectiveness.

Here's what you will do:

  • Collaborate and develop core dashboard metrics to support Insurance Operations.
  • Analyze intra-department metrics, summarize data and recommend improvements.
  • Analyze productivity measures, and customer retention to identify business trends.
  • Develop key loss metrics for all lines of coverage.
  • Develop predictive forecasting tools
  • Create a stewardship data model with definitions that are socialized across the company.
  • Implement dashboards in Looker that enable data-driven decision making for the organization.
  • Engage cross-functionally with all teams: Business Development, Marketing, Sales, Customer Experience & Operational teams to provide insights from a single source.

Here's what we're looking for:

A self-starter with demonstrated success handling multiple data sources, solving complex problems and performing sophisticated analysis.

  • Strong analytical, data-driven mindset, and keen intuition for insights, numbers, and data
  • 3-5 years of experience with large complex data sets from various sources.
  • Advanced experience with Excel, business analytics, Looker or other BI software.
  • Ability to conduct statistical analysis
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 Fearless when delivering information
  • Strong work ethic, and a "positive-can-do" attitude
  • Agile \xe2\x80\x93 ability to handle multiple requests
  • Excellent time management skills
  • BS in Accounts, Finance or Business.

Benefits

  • While we firmly believe that culture beats perks, we are proud to provide a comprehensive benefits package designed to meet your needs:
  • Competitive compensation
  • 10 company-paid holidays
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • Health Savings Account (depending upon your medical plan selection)
  • Basic Term Life insurance
  • Short and Long-Term Disability insurance
  • 401k plan, with matching contributions
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Fitness reimbursement
  • Voluntary supplemental insurance

About AP Intego

We are well on our way to being a leading agency for small commercial insurance. We're a fast-growing insurance tech company trying to dramatically simplify and improve how small businesses get and manage their insurance. We have over 40,000 customers and we're profitable\xe2\x80\x94something many insurtechs only dream about. Founded in 2006, AP Intego has offices in Waltham, MA, Rochester, NY, Denver, CO, and Pleasanton, CA.

Equal Opportunity Employer

AP Intego Insurance Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer; applicants are considered for all roles without regard to race, color, religious creed, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, veteran or military status, unfavorable military discharge, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

title: Financial Business Data Analyst

description:
b'
$18 an hour
Internship
Our vision at Petco is Healthier Pets. Happier People. Better World. We're making things better for pets, people and the planet through our Think Adoption First philosophy, the Petco Foundation and other important initiatives that focus on putting animals first, educating pet parents and reducing our carbon footprint. The journey starts with knowledgeable, passionately engaged associates who are proud to recommend Petco as a place to work, who believe in our Vision and who are committed to delivering a superior customer experience.
From our retail stores and our network of Distribution Centers to our Corporate offices, you'll work with others who share your values and commitment. We seek individuals who are passionate about animal welfare, have great people skills and are driven to grow and advance in their careers with us. Our ongoing growth is creating exceptional opportunities for professional development and personal enrichment throughout our organization.
Petco Animal Supplies Stores, Inc. has a paid summer internship available in its IT \xe2\x80\x93 BI and Analytics department with a focus on data analysis. This internship is based in San Diego, CA. The pay will be $18/hour.
This is a paid internship and offers hands-on learning and exposure to core areas of Data analysis. The ideal candidate is someone who is a Data Analyst with exposure to data based insights for business decision making.
Assigned Projects may include work in the following areas:
  • Analyze business metrics with business area subject matter experts
  • Analyze how to calculate business metrics and document metric definitions
  • Analyze data required to calculate business metrics and document Database table details that contain the data
  • Build a Data Catalog and Business Metrics Glossary that enables business analysts to find metrics and data required to calculate those metrics
  • Enable building a Data Lake that can be used by business analysts for self-service analytics
  • Build Data crawlers using Python/SQL that can crawl databases to build data dictionary
  • Use AWS services such as S3 buckets, Lambda functions and API gateways
  • Work closely with Data Architects, Scrum master and managers to understand AWS cloud infrastructure and enable process for data lake sandbox building
What to Expect:
The Petco internship Program is a 10 week opportunity in San Diego, CA, beginning on June 3, 2019. The intern will be expected to work 40 hours/week, Monday \xe2\x80\x93 Friday. When applicable, some interns may travel to various store sites, distribution centers or other corporate locations.
At the beginning of the internship, you will be assigned a project that is relevant to your field of study to work on during your tenure with us. You will be asked to deliver a capstone presentation at the conclusion of the internship to peers and business leaders summarizing your work at Petco.
You will be given the opportunity to work with a dedicated mentor that will be a valuable resource for you. Your mentor will work in your same department and is there to provide you with regular guidance and feedback.
While working at the Petco National Support Center in San Diego, you will be able to take advantage of the many on-site features of our pet-friendly campus, including a fitness center with yoga studio, basketball court, walking trail, Petco Caf\xc3\xa9 and Starbucks.
Preferred Major/Field of Study: Information Technoloty

A GPA of 3.2 or higher is preferred.

Currently enrolled in a Bachlor's degree program.

A successful intern candidate will possess the following competencies:
  • Planning and Execution: Asks questions to clarify assignments and priorities. Deals with high-priority work activities first. Makes sure work is done correctly. Surfaces problems and issues with speed and accuracy.
  • Drive for Results: Takes personal responsibility to take action. Puts extra effort and work to accomplish important results. Sets high standards for his/her own performance. Finishes assignments and tasks in a timely manner.
  • Process Improvement: Suggests process and practice improvement ideas. Accurately reports process improvement data. Carefully monitors the accuracy and quality of outputs, products and services. Makes suggestions to address problems and process breakdowns.
  • Communication: Listens carefully to others. Communicates clearly and concisely. Provides appropriate level of detail in communications. Writes with accuracy, simplicity and completeness. Keeps others informed.
  • Build Collaborative Relationships: Relates to others in an accepting and respectful way, regardless of their personality or background. Builds relationships by identifying and discussing common interests and priorities. Remains positive and respectful, even in difficult situations. Involves others as appropriate when issues affect them.

title: Petco Intern - Business Intelligence Data Analyst

description:
b'
Blue & Co., LLC is looking to hire a Healthcare Data Analyst in our Louisville, KY office This person will work alongside our Business Intelligence Team, providing critical data analysis/administration on client projects involving large sets of data, including massive databases. As an analyst/administrator, you will play a key role analyzing healthcare data, cross-referencing databases to find hits, developing analytical tools, and extracting data to support decision making, report findings, and discover additional opportunities to assist clients.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Conduct rigorous analysis of client healthcare data
  • Create analytical tools to assist in programmatic data analysis
  • Develop and implement analytic reports for routine client projects; promote consistencies and standardizations; increase the accuracy and timeliness of reporting data
  • Produce sound statistical findings for our consultants and clients

Skills
  • Strong experience working with EHR/EMR systems such as Epic, Cerner, and Meditech
  • Strong experience with Healthcare ASC X12 EDI standards, including 270/271 and 837/835
  • Experience conducting data analysis with Python, R, SAS, or a similar language
  • Experience with C# and the .NET framework
  • Working knowledge of SQL (writing complex queries, performing joins, etc.)
  • Working knowledge of HL7 and FHIR strongly preferred
  • Proven ability to work with large quantities of dynamically-changing data from a wide variety of sources and formats
  • Strong MS Office skills, particularly in Excel and Access

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree preferably in computer science, information systems, healthcare analytics, statistics, data science, or another quantitative major
  • 2+ years of experience in similar role with a focus in healthcare analytics at a major hospital system or consulting firm
  • Keen aptitude in analyzing, interpreting and communicating outputs, including those of large data sets, from both an internal and a client perspective
  • Excellent working knowledge of HIPAA regulations, particularly concerning the access and analysis of patient records
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Professional presence
  • Organizational and time management skills; self-starter; independent worker

This is a fantastic career opportunity if you are looking for above-average progression in a growing public accounting firm! You will be a key contributor on a team of highly skilled, well-respected experts in the industry. We offer ongoing professional development and coaching to reach your goals.

We are responsive. We are caring. We are advocates.
Blue & Co., LLC, is proudly ranked as a top 60 CPA firm in the U.S. From a startup in 1970 to thirteen offices throughout Indiana, Kentucky, Ohio, and Texas, our success is driven by a culture of responsive solutions for our clients and a real commitment to our employees.

We will not sponsor an employment related visa for this position. A background check will be required for employment in this position. Blue is an EOE/AA employer. M/F/D/V. All individuals, including minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. No phone calls please. Agency candidates will not be considered for this position.

title: Data Analyst Co-Op

description:
b'
Internship
Samsara hardware products are plug and play, and core to the product portfolio. The hardware team is responsible for industrial design, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and supply chain. Everyone on the team has a large impact in bringing products to market. We focus on the key creative/design/problem-solving and bolster our development resources with top JDMs, toolmakers, and suppliers.

The Data Analytics Engineering Intern is will own and lead projects from end-to-end. You'll dive into complex datasets to analyze trends, identify opportunities and quantify the potential value of new products and initiatives. This role is dynamic in that you will be responsible for collecting, scoping, implementing and extracting learnings from large datasets for the engineering and operations team!

Responsibilities:
  • Use best practices to build data architecture and combine multiple data streams so that our business users can read results in SQL, Big Query and one-off reports.
  • Use a data-driven, user-centric approach to grow and optimize the business
  • Manage multiple projects with shifting priorities ensuring delivery of updates and releases by aggressive deadlines.
  • Identifying, analyzing and reporting on performance and KPIs such as device field performance metrics, manufacturing data, cohort analyses, demand planning, returns metrics etc.
  • Provide data to operations and engineering teams to size and quantify product changes.
  • Help optimize team efficiency by refining our supply/demand matching
  • Proactively identify areas for improvement in the business through data
  • Proliferate a data-driven culture
Qualifications:
  • Studying a major focused on analytics, data science or statistics
  • Strong applied analytics - you love data, gleaning insights from data, and making decisions based on data
  • Comfortable with both engineering data and business analytics
  • Experience with mySQL (or similar), R and Python
  • Experience with Google Analytics and Tableau
  • Quantitative analysis - you have experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets using SQL(or graphQL) and understand basic statistics; experience with advanced visualization tools is a plus
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills - effectively presenting insights is as important as the insights themselves
  • Can work cross-functionally, particularly with engineering, product and growth teams
  • Creative, scrappy
  • Excellent quantitative and data analytics skills
  • Team-player: we rely on each other to be candid, supportive, hardworking and genuine
At Samsara, we welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.'
title: (Intern) Data Analyst Engineer

description:
b'

Job Description

As a Data Analyst , you will leverage data and statistics to revolutionize Kaplan Professional platforms and products to drive meaningfully better outcomes for our learners and our clients.

Job Requirements


Problem Definition:

  • Assess work requests and determine the problem to be solved
  • Converse with stakeholders to ensure the problem is accurately defined
  • Gather and generate hypotheses as to what solutions might exist


Data Preparation / Analysis:

  • Determine all data points to be collected to analyze the problem
  • Gather data from disparate sources (APIs, databases, files, and, documents)
  • Clean and merge data sets to make broader data sets for analysis
  • Perform exploratory analysis to understand the nature of data sets
  • Identify relationships, patterns, and, driving factors in data
  • Build, evaluate, and refine predictive models over time


Recommend Solutions:

  • Synthesize outcomes from analysis and distill into feasible solutions
  • Communicate key findings in data using intuitive visualizations
  • Present findings and recommendations to business executives


Minimal travel (<10% per year) for training conferences or team meetings

Minimum Requirements

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Quantitative Discipline or equivalent in education and experience
  • Some experience in data analysis, 1 year strongly preferred
  • Solid skills in Python/R to perform job responsibilities
  • Sound knowledge of what methods to apply based on the problem to be solved.
  • Firm grasp of the scientific method and how to conduct experiments.
  • Sound knowledge of the best way to visually communicate data to lay audiences.
  • Attention to detail and a good grasp of task feasibility /effort.
  • Ability to create organized process documents for work.
  • Ability to collaborate with others within and across teams.
  • Strong desire/passion to work in education and to educate.
  • Professional
  • Inclusive
  • Creative
  • Courageous
  • Adaptable
  • Accountable

Preferred Qualifications

  • Master\xe2\x80\x99s level or higher in a quantitative degree.
  • 3+ years of experience with data analytics.
  • 1-2 years of experience in a commercial environment.
  • Experience applying data analysis or machine learning techniques to analyze student learning.
  • Experience using source control such as GitHub / Git for scripts.
  • Experience with database querying and business intelligence toolsets such as SRRS and Tableau.
  • Experience presenting findings within spreadsheet, document, and slide format.
  • Experience working in a lean culture (Gemba, Standard Work, A3, MDI).

Location

Employee

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"

Summary

Posted: Mar 13, 2019
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number: 200041690
At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Would you like to work in an energizing environment where your abilities will be challenged on a day-to-day basis? If you are passionate about innovating to deliver insights through large-scale data solutions, and leading a team of committed Data Analysts to do the same, then Apple\xe2\x80\x99s Global Business Intelligence AppleCare Data and Analytics Manager role is for you. Lead a team of committed Data Analytics professionals, applying your standout combination of intuition for business and technical knowledge. The GBI AppleCare Data Analyst maintains a strong awareness of the data and systems utilized by the AppleCare business teams they partner with. This person is responsible for hands on collaboration with business partners to understand their needs, engagement and iteration on usage of existing data, driving AppleCare Enterprise Semantic requirements, and much more.
Key Qualifications
  • Ability to partner with technical business teams, ensuring that the Data Team is actively engaging, developing a deep understanding of current data needs, as well as driving data strategy for GBI AppleCare
  • Hands-on experience engineering and documenting process flows
  • Validated expertise with Tableau, SQL and other data visualization tools
  • Hands-on experience leading technology projects and ability to drive cooperation between Data Team, Product managers and the rest of GBI
  • Excellent problem solving abilities
  • Effectively coordinate work and communication across disparate groups of individuals and levels in the organization
  • Thrive in a dynamic environment, maintaining poise and a positive attitude
  • Demonstrate solid grasp of development processes and agile methodologies
  • Communicate complex technical solutions to non-technical users
  • Possess a very high degree of natural curiosity to drive the next levels of business questions and insights
  • Demonstrate resilience and adaptability, in the midst of ambiguity, to drive business impacting change
  • Experience with or advanced courses on data science and machine learning is a plus
Description
Identify analytics opportunities that will craft the future of the GBI team by explaining methodology to business users, implementing analysis and interpreting results. Work with a team of developers who execute quick turn and long lead analytics projects that provide insights into our customers and business trends. Partner with business owners to understand specific requirements for analysis of data. Define and analyze your client organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategy, direction, and structure. Lead the development of models and tools to allow for insightful analysis. Identify and document system deficiencies and recommend solutions. Publish and communicate results, ensuring timely and accurate reports are delivered to the teams. Need to be able to work in a rapidly changing environment, perform effectively under dynamic conditions such as directional changes, tight deadlines and limited resources. Organizational skills and the ability to multi-task are important.
Education & Experience
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent work experience preferred.
"
title: Global Business Intelligence AppleCare Data Analyst

description:
b'
Job Description

The Sr Business Intelligence/Data Analyst will develop system integration test plans, design and author SQL test scripts and test sets that encompass valid and invalid data, prepare test data, execute test scripts, document test results and analysis, including defect identification and resolution, and ensure that data adheres to the functional requirements as communicated by the business.

This position requires a self-motivated, dedicated, focused, and detailed individual to perform specialized testing procedures on data warehouse and ETL processes using both automated and non-automated tools. This is a hands-on position that requires a motivated self-starter with a high degree of personal accountability to manage multiple cycles of data analysis using advanced or complex SQL queries in SQL Server and/or Oracle databases as needed.

A Day in the Life:

  • Plan, coordinate, design, execute, track and report on data-driven testing for a large data warehouse and related software tools.
  • Develop a strong understanding of enterprise databases, system dependencies and the interfaces between them.
  • Reliably analyze requirements, design, reporting and testing specifications to maintain a comprehensive test suite for Enterprise Systems. Ensure that developed tests can be leveraged in the future through appropriate stewardship of test models, test data, and test processes. Continuously improve test assets based on lessons learned.
  • Define and build the test strategy, test plan, and test cases to guarantee that all data flowing within and across the Acquisition, CRM, Analytics, and Reporting systems assure data quality from both quantitative and qualitative perspectives.
  • Design and execute traceable test scripts that verify and validate the systems\xe2\x80\x99 extraction/insertion and transformation logic. Tracks data elements from source through transformation to target.
  • Work collaboratively with software architects, business analysts, developers, database administrators and data quality to resolve and correct defects. May be required to assist in the manual correction of data errors in source systems as needed.
  • Analyze formal test results in order to discover and report any defects, errors, configuration issues, and interoperability flaws.
  • Identify problematic areas on ETL processes, data workflows, data transformations, and data exceptions.
  • Communicate test progress, test results, and quality metrics to team members and management.
  • Proactively make recommendations to improve efficiency and effectiveness as it relates to quality standards and testing methodologies.
  • Provide guidance, technical assistance, and mentoring in data quality to other team members.
  • Comply with any applicable IT standards and policies. Keeps current with industry trends and practices within area of responsibility.
  • Mine large datasets and draw actionable insights
  • Present discoveries and insights to line of business teams, relating them to specific programs and initiatives
  • Partner with cross functional teams across Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Engineering in operationalizing the initiatives
  • Act as the end to end owner of the analytical method, monitoring mechanisms, and corresponding business impact of the solution delivered to the business.
  • Use predictive analytics or machine learning techniques to solve complex problems and drive business decisions
  • Employ the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns of both bad and good trends in order to help drive efficiency.
  • Design experiments, test hypotheses, and build actionable models
  • Contribute to and participate in MBR/QBR providing key results and insights
  • Present findings and recommendations to key decision makers at various management levels using a collection of dashboards, reports, and presentations
  • Learns broad range of design choices and available technology as well as becomes a SME for multiple areas
  • Consistently delivers high quality work with high test focus through automation and reviews and defines the standards for quality for the team, owns deployment,
  • Monitoring prod site issues, plans for issues by thinking proactively.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems or related discipline is required.
  • 9+ years of Data Analytics and Reporting experience
  • 3+ years experience writing complex SQL scripts to accomplish data conversion/validation testing required; experience extracting data and performing external validation of business rule transformation and violations required.
  • Experience with Hadoop is preferred
  • 3+ years direct hands-on experience with query editors, ETL and/or automation test tools; Informatica PowerCenterIDQ, HP-Mercury Quality Center and Functional Test/QTP preferred.
  • 4+ years experience with RDBMS (Oracle 10g+ or SQL Server 2005+) and database scripting and tools required Proficiency with Microsoft Office 2010 productivity suite
  • Expertise with all phases and stages of testing including functional, system, integration, data validation, performance, load, end-to-end, and regression testing.
  • Strong experience designing and developing modular manual and automation test procedures and test cases utilizing data driven, validation and verification techniques and strategies.
  • Prior healthcare industry experience in an Agile/Sprint development environment desired.
  • Strong knowledge of Data Warehouse and Data Quality practices and concepts.
  • Advanced understanding and interpretation of requirements, technical documents and development code. Proficiency in developing SQL scripts and testing extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) processes.
  • Strong organizational, communication, and analytical skills are necessary. Strong troubleshooting, investigative, and problem solving abilities. Superior written and verbal communication skills with ability to clearly and concisely articulate issues effectively to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Detailed-oriented with the ability to decompose complex and diverse projects into manageable pieces.
  • Ability to multi-task, self-manage and prioritize tight deadlines effectively.
  • Strong team player, self-starter and can work independently or with direction.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment with cross-functional teams is required


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

'
title: Sr BI/Data Analyst (Hadoop & SQL)

description:
b"Focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, FSA, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers SAIC and AECOM, has a vacancy for a Data Analyst. In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the DEA.

A Data Analyst executes the following duties:
  • Provide organization and management of case files
  • Review data (completeness of information, proper execution)
  • Extract data from data base
  • Obtain additional information from other investigative agencies/data base
  • Establish/maintain physical file
  • Prepare notices/advertisements
  • Receive, suspense petitions, claims, process sharing requests
  • Reconcile inconsistencies
  • Prepare declarations
  • Gather information and organize investigative package
  • Verify case files and case tracking system
  • Maintain internal status information on the disposition of all forfeited assets
  • Assure information is accurate and perform analytical computations necessary to process data
  • Conduct and reconcile inventories
  • Distribute and receive documents
  • Assist lead analyst or official in obtaining/collecting all documents/information to complete case file
  • Provide administrative information and assistance concerning case to other investigative agencies, local law enforcement agencies, US Attorney, and other DOJ processing units, and higher headquarters
  • Extract data from agency data base for management and program reports
  • Perform word processing relevant to case documentation
  • Perform data entry relevant to case
A Data Analyst must meet the following qualifications:
  • High School diploma, bachelor's Degree preferred
  • Ability to review and analyze data and information from multiple sources
  • Ability to establish case/project files
  • Ability to enter and retrieve data from data bases
  • Ability to prepare and format management reports
  • Ability to manipulate, transfer, and compute and print information
  • Ability to create and manipulate spreadsheets
  • Ability to prepare and correct reports and correspondence using word processing software
  • Ability to obtain and maintain Public Trust Security Access
This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation.

Forfeiture Support Associates (FSA), LLC is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote quali\xef\xac\x81ed persons in all job titles without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender, HIV status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation (including gender expression and identity), veteran status, family leave status or any protected group status as de\xef\xac\x81ned by applicable law."
title: Data Analyst Supporting the DEA

description:
b'
$43,540 - $65,310 a year

Under general direction, is responsible for collection, management, processing, and analysis of local, state, and national public health datasets. Also partakes in: preparation of health data reports and fact sheets, data mapping and visualization, and development of innovative ideas around new data collection and analysis. Working conditions are primarily in an office
environment. May exercise direct supervision over assigned staff.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:


  • Assists in acquisition, collection, and management of epidemiological/public health data from various sources.
  • Maintains and adheres to data integrity and confidentiality rules and guidelines at all times.
  • Processes, analyzes, and interprets epidemiological/public health data.
  • Conducts mapping and visualization of data.
  • Partakes in epidemiological research and literature review when necessary.
  • Produces epidemiological reports and data fact sheets on a routine basis, as needed.
  • Reports data findings and results of epidemiological investigations to various professional, state, and local partners, in compliance with local, state, and federal agency guidelines and regulations.
  • Works with public relations and the communications team to maintain website content and release information about current health data and reports to the media and the public.
  • Represents San Antonio Metropolitan Health District and conducts presentations at conferences and meetings.
  • Participates in making data-informed decisions and identifying key health indicators as part of the assessment and evaluation process in community health planning for the department.
  • Confers with outside organizations and agencies to maintain and establish partnerships and collaborations.
  • Performs related duties and fulfill responsibilities as required.


JOB REQUIREMENTS:


  • Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with preferable coursework in Public Health, Epidemiology, or a related field with two (2) years of experience in disease control, infection control or epidemiology.
OR
  • Master's degree in Public Health, Science of Epidemiology, Biostatistics or related field is required.
  • This position requires a valid Class "C" Texas Driver's License OR valid driver's license from another state with the ability to obtain a valid Class "C" Texas Driver's License within 30 days of becoming a Texas resident. Use of your own personal vehicle may at time be required and proof of Liability Insurance will be required.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 2 years of experience in quantitative data management and basic data analysis, public health research, investigation and prevention of chronic and communicable diseases, application of epidemiological methods, or study design.
  • Excellent computer skills in Microsoft Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Publisher.
  • Experience and training in coding and analysis using statistical software (e.g. SAS, STATA, R, SPSS).
  • Experience and knowledge of data mapping and visualization tools (e.g. ArcGIS, Tableau).
  • Good understanding of epidemiological principles, study designs, and methods.
  • Knowledge of public health datasets, agencies, and programs (e.g. CDC, Census Bureau).
  • Knowledge of chronic disease epidemiology and data (e.g. Cancer, heart disease, Asthma, etc.).
APPLICANT INFORMATION:
  • If selected for this position, official transcripts, diplomas, certifications and licenses must be submitted at the time of processing. Unofficial transcripts and copies of other relevant documents may be attached to the application for consideration in advance.
  • Please be advised that if selected for this position, information regarding employment history as it relates to the qualifications of the position will be needed for employment verification. Applicants claiming military service to meet the experience requirement for this position may attach a DD214 to the application.
  • Unless otherwise stated, applicants are permitted to substitute two years of related full-time experience for one year of higher education or one year of related higher education for two years of experience in order to meet the minimum requirements of the job. One year of full-time experience is defined as 30 or more hours worked per week for 12 months. One year of higher education is defined as 30 credit hours completed at an accredited college or university.
  • Applicants selected for employment with the City of San Antonio in this position must receive satisfactory results from pre-employment drug testing and background checks. If required for the position, a physical, motor vehicle record evaluation, and additional background checks may be conducted.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
  • Physical requirements include frequent lifting/carrying up to 5 pounds and occasional lifting/carrying up to 25 pounds; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, and walking to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office environment with occasional exposure to hazardous materials, bodily fluids and infectious diseases.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:


  • Knowledge of the principles and methods of epidemiology and related biostatistics.
  • Knowledge of communicable diseases and chronic health conditions.
  • Knowledge of public health organizations and agencies.
  • Skills in effective communication and collaboration with Informatics team members, as well with city staff, partner organizations, and the public.
  • Skills in preparation and successful execution of oral presentations in front of an audience.
  • Skills in coding, programming, and analysis of data using appropriate software.
  • Ability to take charge in identifying solutions, best practices, and novel methods by researching what other successful agencies have done.
  • Ability to routinely engage in team-work and maintain good working relationships with colleagues and partner organizations.
  • Ability to effectively and simply explain and translate the work of the Informatics Teams in a way that is understood by a lay audience and non-technical individuals.



  • Unless otherwise stated, applicants are permitted to substitute two years of related full-time experience for one year of higher education or one year of related higher education for two years of experience in order to meet the minimum requirements of the job. One year of full-time experience is defined as 30 or more hours worked per week for 12 months. One year of higher education is defined as 30 credit hours completed at an accredited college or university.

  • Applicants selected for employment with the City of San Antonio must receive satisfactory results from pre-employment drug testing, references, background checks, and credential verification, as required by the position. Depending on the position, selected applicants may be required to comply with any state and federal requirements for the position and may be subject to interval criminal background checks in accordance with relevant regulations.

APPLICATIONS MAY BE FILED ONLINE AT:
http://www.sanantonio.gov/HR/CareerCenter.aspx

Human Resources Department
San Antonio, TX 78205
210-207-8705

hrcustomerservice@sanantonio.gov

title: Epidemiologist / Data Analyst

description:
b'
The Role
Come help our customers learn more about the world. Below is a small sample of the questions we've asked of our data over the last year.

  • Did Lyft's prospects improve in politically progressive areas in the aftermath of Uber's press woes?
  • Is Amazon's revenue growth in the fourth quarter primarily driven by customers in rural areas?
  • How did the path of the solar eclipse affect hotel bookings across the United States?


As part of a nascent customer-focused function on the data team, you will be responsible for helping industry-leading companies understand how purchase and travel behavior is changing in America. You will become an expert in our dataset and answers questions from prospects, customers, and internal stakeholders to help extract value from our data.

You
You creatively work through problems with statistically sound thinking and have the natural itch to follow obstacles to their root cause. You think deeply about the problems ahead and are comfortable moving between tools in your toolbelt. And you are quick to learn, implementing new approaches when facing questions that demand it. You are a stickler for quality and pay careful attention to the details that matter.

You are a gifted communicator and are passionate about helping others make sense of data. You are comfortable juggling multiple projects at one time and relish the opportunity to empower leaders in finance, technology, and consumer goods with data to shape their long term strategy.

Requirements
  • 2+ years of SQL experience
  • Ability to communicate findings to non-experts
  • Desire to learn data modeling technologies (python, spark) and build on statistical knowledge
  • Bachelors in social science (Economics, Sociology, ...), related discipline or equivalent experience
  • Excited by a high learning curve
  • Excellent written and oral communicator


Compensation and Benefits
  • Highly competitive salary and benefits
  • Stock grants pre-IPO at a company backed by top investors
  • Take unlimited, responsible vacation


About Us
Edison provides intelligent email solutions for users and competitive intelligence for businesses. The largest, most valuable and as yet untapped data on earth is in mail; 3x larger than the worldwide web. Through our user base of more than 3 million users, we empower investors, brands, and technology companies to understand trends in the marketplace and gain deep insights into consumer behavior patterns.

As a team, we're collaborative, engaged, and committed to continually improving as we serve our mission. None of us are on an island- we trust our teammates to lend a hand when we're stuck and our egos take a backseat to figuring out the best approach to tackling problems. We're energized by tough problems and are excited to know that a challenge ahead of us does not have a textbook solution. Finally, we're always in a posture of learning- there is a lot we do not know but that does not hold us back from making an attempt at solutions. We lead thorough blameless postmortems to become better analysts, scientists, and leaders.

title: Data Entry and Analyst

description:
b'
$92,093 - $118,670 a year

There is only one city in the country that can say it is the Nation\xe2\x80\x99s Capital \xe2\x80\x93 Washington, D.C. Given that distinction, the Metropolitan Police Department is the premiere law enforcement organization in the city. We receive over 19 million visitors a year, have almost 700,000 residents, and 21,000 private businesses. The Department consists of more than 4,500 members: approximately 3,850 sworn members and over 650 civilian employees. We are one of the most diverse and highly trained departments in the country. We have the honor of safeguarding and protecting not only our nation\xe2\x80\x99s residents, but also people from all over the world.

This position is located in the Metropolitan Police Department (MPD), Executive Office of the Chief, the Strategic Change Division. The Strategic Change Division is seeking a civic-minded, analytic Performance and Data Analyst to help propel performance management and analytic programs at the Metropolitan Police Department agency.

The Performance and Data Analyst will work as an expert advisor on a wide range of analytics and performance management initiatives related to the agency. The Performance and Data Analyst will use data, strategic planning, and innovation to continuously improve the programs and services of the agency.

The incumbent will be responsibility for:

  • Provide expert advice and services to MPD on strategic planning, data analysis, and development and execution of monitoring and accountability tools.
  • Develop, analyze reports on, and visualizes key performance metrics for the agency and its initiatives.
  • Conduct and interpret analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify areas of improvement and concern.
  • Evaluate the effectiveness of select programs and services, and coordinates with agencies to design on-going improvement plans for programs and services.
  • Provide guidance to agencies on the development of annual performance plans, including the development of strategic objectives and key performance metrics and helps determine agency success in meeting work plan targets.
  • Advise the supervisor on the effectiveness of existing MPD Performance Management initiatives, infrastructure, programs and policies.
  • Recommend improvement based on research of best practices and national standards.
  • Participate in the design, planning, preparation, implementation, and follow-up for CapSTAT meetings.
  • Coordinate and assists with the development of MPD\xe2\x80\x99s strategic planning. Reviews the performance plans of MPD to assure alignment with District\xe2\x80\x99s strategic plan.
  • Participate in the development and analysis of dashboards on a variety of topics to help analyze performance in priority areas.
  • Support and participate in the design of work plans, tools and templates to facilitate well-communicated, efficient, and productive performance management processes.
  • Keep abreast and knowledgeable of industry best in business intelligence, performance management, data visualization and systems analysis and design.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Expert knowledge and experience with performance management, strategic planning and change management for District government agencies and offices. Expert knowledge of, or familiarity with, business planning, reporting, measurement/monitoring, and policy analysis and formulation.
  • Analytical skills, such as statistical analysis, financial analysis, cost-benefit analysis, and/or GIS analysis. Coding experience, especially in R, is desirable and Microsoft Excel expertise is required.
  • Demonstrated experience in descriptive statistics and other analysis techniques using Microsoft Excel is required.
  • Proficiency in the use of business intelligence tools for querying and reporting data is required.
  • Experience in IBM COGNOS, Tableau, and ArcGIS preferred.
  • Ability to collect and analyze information and data on a wide variety of policy areas that affect MPD; and to make recommendations for improvements to processes, programs and/or laws or regulations.
  • Skilled in problem solving and project management to conduct in-depth research, analysis and evaluation. Excellent organizational skills, and strong attention to detail with the ability to coordinate multiple work streams, multi-task and work well under tight deadlines.
  • Understanding of the strategy and policy context of government and the department; and the ability to take a corporate perspective - having a strong awareness of the priorities and strategic objectives. Strong data analysis and critical thinking skills.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills; and the ability to interact effectively with a variety of contacts/relationships, from senior-level officials to agency analysts.

Licensures, Certifications and other requirements
N/A

Education
Bachelor's degree from an accredited four year-college or university in public and business administration, public policy, human resource management (HRM), financial management, or related field, plus five (5) years of work related experience; OR an equivalent combination of education and/or experience which exhibits the ability to perform satisfactorily in the position.

Master's degree and a minimum of three (3) years of work related experience preferred.

Experience
Applicants must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience, equivalent to a least the (CS-12) grade level, or its non-District equivalent, gained from the public or private sector. Specialized experience is defined as experience that equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform successfully the duties of the position directly related to the position.

OTHER SIGNIFICANT FACTORS
Incumbent is subject to shift work, weekend work and on-call status. Incumbent is required to travel around the Washington, DC area, to DC Courts, other District agencies, meetings, trainings and occasionally travels out of town to conferences/trainings. Incumbent is required to possess and maintain a valid motor vehicle operator\xe2\x80\x99s permit.

Positions with the Metropolitan Police Department require a criminal background, traffic record and consumer check.

The District of Columbia Government is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

'
title: Performance and Data Analyst

description:
b'

Strength Through Diversity

Ground breaking science. Advancing medicine. Healing made personal.


Roles & Responsibilities:

The Data Analyst II oversees activities related to data integrity, security and enhancement of the value of data. The Data Analyst II may direct the movement of data across multiple systems; oversee its validation and organization and make sure that data is available to appropriate people and systems within an organization. The Data Analyst II will also develop and execute reports that will be important assets of the practice as they continue to develop and evaluate a new model of care.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work with the clinical and administrative staff of the practice to define data reporting needs
  • Develop analytic reports that are easily understandable by clinical and administrative staff
  • Use modeling techniques and tools in analyzing and specifying data structure
  • Implement best practices in data management to ensure the integrity of the data, the quality of data processes and deliver analyzable or analyzed data to a variety of internal and external clients of the affiliated practice
  • Maintain data integrity and completes data analysis as necessary
  • Complete data capture, data extraction and analysis
  • Develop, maintain or implement procedures for data entry, data cleaning, documentation and other administrative tasks
  • Document, implement, maintain or recommend operating methods to improve processing, distribution, data flow, collection, database editing procedures
  • May define parameters for file or space utilization
  • Work closely with IT management and staff
  • Access data in the Data Warehouse, as required
  • Assist clinical and administrative staff with queries, statistical analyses, reports and technical difficulties related to data retrieval
  • Design and write custom applications needed to ensure the database meets requirements for the entry, management and reporting of data
  • Identify and recommend solutions to data management issues
  • Maintain knowledge of the current regulations and technologies related to data management
  • Write and prepare manuscripts and other materials for internal and external audiences
  • Perform other related duties
  • Help to build and perpetuate a practice environment and culture of collaboration, respect, learning, flexibility and fun among all team members
Requirements:
  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent education/work experience. Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in relevant field of study preferred
  • 3 years of analytics experience including report development and database application/management experience, preferably in a large medical center or healthcare environment
  • Advanced knowledge of database applications / management, SQL and /or SAS. Knowledge of computer programming preferred
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
  • Excellent conceptualization, design and analytical skills

Strength Through Diversity


The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity and inclusion is a driver for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. Yet we\xe2\x80\x99re as diverse as the city we call home- culturally, ethically, in outlook and lifestyle. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai\xe2\x80\x99s unrivaled record of achievement, education and advancement as we revolutionize healthcare delivery together.


We work hard to recruit and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you have the opportunity and support to develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, have an impact on quality patient care.


Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story!


Who We Are

Over 38,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve.


Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospitals, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai St. Luke\xe2\x80\x99s, and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai.


The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We promote recognition and respect for individual and cultural differences, and we work to make our employees feel valued and appreciated, whatever their race, gender, background, or sexual orientation.


EOE Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans

title: Summer 2019 Business Data Analyst Intern

description:
b'

Company/Position Overview

In this role you will:
  • Contribute to the overall quality of a large modernization project as part of an Agile Scrum environment
  • Identify all existing legacy data elements
  • Determine which are valid as-is, obsolete, and redundant as well as which new data elements are required in the new data repository
  • Develop strategy for migrating data from the legacy repositories to the new repository
  • Develop migration routines
  • Develop strategy for verifying the completeness and accuracy of the data migratiion
  • Design, develop, and execute automated tests to validate migration
  • Prepare, document, and present solutions to customer and other teams

Mandatory Qualifications (Education, Certifications, Experience, Skills)

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or higher in Information Systems Management, Information Technology, Actuarial Science, Computer Science, Business, Management, Engineering, Mathematics, or other related discipline
  • Seven (7) years of general IT experience working with software
  • Five (5) years of application testing and testing tools experience
  • Three (3) years of performing testing including functional and performance testing using automated testing tools
  • Experience writing and executing scripts in automated, functional testing tools such as HP Unified Functional Testing (UFT) and Selenium
  • Technical environments shall have included Oracle and web-based applications and experience dealing with legacy, desktop applications that utilize technologies such as Visual Basic and/or VBA, PowerBuilder, etc.
  • Demonstrated experience in the use of an Agile Development methodology
  • Possess and utilize excellent oral and written communication skills.
    • Strong presentation skills with PowerPoint and diagrams
    • Excellent use of Microsoft Word and Excel for deliverables to limit formatting, typos, or grammatical mistakes

Desired Qualifications (Education, Certifications, Experience, Skills)

  • Experience testing applications that involve Microsoft Excel
  • Experience testing and validating data migrations from one database platform to another (e.g., Access to Oracle)
  • Experience with behavior driven development (BDD) testing tools such as Cucumber
  • Experience with API testing tools such as PostMan and SoapUI
  • Experience with unit testing tools such as JUnit and NUnit
  • Experience with AgileCraft and/or other Agile and user story management tools
  • Currently active quality and/or testing process certification
  • Formal training and/or certifications in testing tools

Salient CRGT is a leading provider of health, data analytics, cloud, agile software development, mobility, cyber security, and infrastructure solutions. We support these core capabilities with full lifecycle IT services and training\xe2\x80\x94to help our customers meet critical goals for pivotal missions. If you are viewing this job posting outside of the Salient CRGT website, please visit: www.salientcrgt.com/careers to express interest in this position through the Salient CRGT Careers page.

title: Data Analyst/Tester

description:
b'

Data Tree LLC is the nation's leading provider of property information and online recorded public land records. We offer billions of imaged documents along with innovative, comprehensive post closing and servicing solutions, including document retrieval, data delivery, lien release and assignment preparation, and document management services. Data Tree is a member of the First American Financial Corporation family of companies that was named one of FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For\xc2\xae in 2016 and 2017. For more information, please visit www.datatree.com.

Job Summary

First American Data Tree is a company concentrated on delivering high quality data solutions to the financial, real estate and legal markets. We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Data Analyst to join our highly energized organization supporting rapid growth in the real estate information industry.

This is a great opportunity to work with an entrepreneurial minded team within the First American Data Operations organization. You will determine innovative methods to enhance our data assets by examining client reported inquiries and conducting detailed analysis to recommend solutions to enhance data quality. This is a unique position that requires a regular engagement with customers, yet still working in the heart of the data organization. The ideal candidate has proven public record data knowledge, experience with high-touch client engagements, and a demonstrated passion for achieving data superiority.

Specific Responsibilities

  • Serve as the data expert and relationship manager for top clients that subscribe to our data, products and services.
  • Employ data quality tools to conduct research, determine root cause of errors, and perform data repairs.
  • Work with various data, sales, fulfillment and product teams to enhance data solutions.
  • Represent data team in meetings with clients, sales and stakeholders.
  • Conduct training and support on-boarding process by establishing the rules of engagement for \xe2\x80\x9cmaintenance data support\xe2\x80\x9d.

Job Qualifications

  • BS Degree in a relevant discipline (C.S., CIS, Statistics, etc.) or 5+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience working with public record data
  • Demonstrated experience with SQL to performing data quality reviews and analysis
  • Ability to use data products or bulk data files to analyze the content and quality of a deliverable.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and experience interfacing with clients, products and sales teams
  • Ability to make independent decisions on behalf of the data quality team

First American invests in its employee\xe2\x80\x99s development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer. For more information about our Company and our dedication to putting People First, check out firstam.com/careers.

title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
b'
$70,000 - $100,000 a year

Jr Data Analyst

Why we need you:

We have grown to the point where our needs for data and reports have outpaced our ability to provide them.

You are a highly motivated self-starter that will use analytics to generate insights that inform business, product and marketing decisions. You will be part of a small cross-disciplinary team who guide the direction and approach to improving the experience of Lendr\xe2\x80\x99s current and prospective clients. We surface insights, make informed decisions and move fast and that\xe2\x80\x99s the way you like it.


Who are we:

In today\xe2\x80\x99s business environment where it\xe2\x80\x99s nearly impossible for small business to get traditional loans, Lendr is revolutionizing the way companies gain access to capital. We offer fast, friction-free cash advances to help small and medium business owners focus on what they do best: grow. We believe in the little guy and are here to empower these businesses to get the capital they need without having to jump through hoops.


Our tools:

SQL Server

Salesforce

Azure

AWS

Whatever you need to do your job.


Our Methods:

Agile / Scrum


What will you be doing?

  • Extract and analyze data from internal databases to inform business decisions and actions.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve data issues
  • Work with colleagues to mine internal data sources for unprecedented insight, and be able to present findings to all levels of leadership on a regular basis.
  • Generate standard and ad hoc reports on a regular basis.
  • Strong communication skills, especially written, to clearly communicate status, analysis and recommendations to internal and external partners; and the ability to communicate ideas visually with graphics.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Good familiarity with MS Excel and SQL Querying tools.
  • Create output/corrective actions based on the analysis of query results. Identify trends, issues and propose recommendations.
  • Learn and adapt to new technologies.
  • Independently prioritize and deliver across competing projects/deadlines.
  • Provide input regarding appropriate technological solutions for data challenges.
  • Use verbal and written communications to clearly communicate status, analysis and recommendations to internal and external partners.
  • Additional responsibilities as required by management.

Skills and Specifications:

  • Bachelor's degree, preferably with a concentration in information technology or computer science
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent analytical, programming and problem-solving skills
  • Detail oriented
  • Competence in quality assurance
  • Ability to work well independently or in a team environment
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office programs especially Excel

  • Experience with data ETL involving various file formats and databases: Access, SQL
  • Experience with relational databases, specifically data quality (queries, creating tables, indexes, troubleshooting)
  • The ability to present complex information in an understandable manner

title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
b'
Contract
Job Description

Job Summary

This is an insight generating role for an experienced data analyst. You will conduct robust analysis, create innovative data visualizations and design, improve and manage the data collection and tracking system. Under the supervision of the Director of Impact & Evaluation, the Data Analyst will provide business analysis expertise to help St. Joseph Center manage various information systems and measure program effectiveness to help us better serve our target population. You will have experience in SQL and be an integral part in bringing thorough analysis to our decision-making process.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Key Areas of Responsibility & Essential Duties:

  • Conduct data analysis to generate insight and measure agency and program effectiveness.
  • Create data models and compelling visualizations that depict agency and program wide outcomes and trends.
  • Monitor and improve key performance indicators (KPIs) to aid in decision making and overall strategy.
  • Build and manage an interactive dashboard through Tableau.
  • Create and improve the data collection, management and analysis process.
  • Support in drafting a monthly outcome report.
  • Help ensure that data development is in compliance with grant requirements.
  • Support with identifying data sources, calculating baselines, setting targets, benchmark goals, etc.
  • Ensure data collection and reporting methods are accurate, effective and efficient.
  • Work with programs to ensure data collection and monitoring practices are understood and in compliance with contractual requirements.
  • Support in designing and assisting with program evaluations.
  • Maintain knowledge on current HUD data elements and requirements.

Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned. The duties and responsibilities listed are designed to provide typical examples of the work performed; not all duties and responsibilities assigned are included here, nor is it expected that all similar positions will be assigned every duty and responsibility.


Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Excellent data analysis skills
  • Proficiency in SQL, including ability to write queries
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Fluent in Excel and creating data visualizations
  • Experience with creating dashboards, preferably in Tableau
  • The ability to make recommendations on database software and work with IT for implementation
  • Knowledge of both qualitative and quantitative research and analysis tools
  • Proficient in data modeling and presentation
  • Strong commitment to applying numerical data KPIs to achieve enhanced performance
  • Ability to generate key insights and perspectives from data sets and outcomes
  • Ability to recommend course corrections and actions based on findings

Experience:

  • Two-plus years running data analysis and reporting in an insight-generating role
  • Experience working with HMIS/EHR systems, i.e. Service Point; Clarity; Exym; CHAMP; Zoho; AWARDS (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited college or university, preferably in a math, science, or related field. Will consider equivalent work experience.

Direct Reports:

  • This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

Computer Skills:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Programs (Word, Excel, Access, Powerpoint)
  • Ability to use widely supported internet browsers.

Certificates, Licenses and Registrations:

  • Valid California Class C Driver License or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions.
  • Valid automobile liability insurance.

Additional Information

Status: Full-Time/Exempt

Salary: DOE

Employment with St. Joseph Center is contingent on completion of satisfactory background check.

St. Joseph Center endorses and supports the intent of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA) and the California Fair Employment and Housing Act (FEHA) and is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities who are applicants or employees who need accommodations. If you require an accommodation due to a disability to complete this application OR you are experiencing issues submitting your application and accompanying materials please contact Human Resources at 310-396-6468.

For consideration, please submit cover letter and resume. St. Joseph Center is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
