title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Overview

Western National is seeking a Junior Data Analyst to join our growing organization. This position will work closely with multiple business units throughout the organization helping to support data extraction and analytics needs.

The ideal candidate will have 0-2+ years of Data Analysis experience preferably within the Insurance Industry or a degree with a focus in Data Analytics. This role will use SQL to extract data but will also have a strong focus on analyzing the data to help come up with solutions to the business. This role will combine Technical and business aspects.

Responsibilities

Job Duties/Responsibilities
  • Work on analytical projects to help management understand detailed information about their business portfolio.
  • Produce meaningful reports and ad-hoc analysis relating to premiums, losses, business processes, agency performance and other areas that support the business.
  • Provide trend analysis and ad hoc data related activities; effectively communicate insights to customers in a clear and concise manner.
  • Conduct pre/post-rate change impact analysis to ensure our products maintain a competitive position.
  • Collaborate across several business units including Underwriting, Marketing, Product Management, and Claims to identify opportunities to improve company or operational performance.
  • Understand, extract, validate / correct and define data from multiple internal and external sources.
  • Collaborate with IT Data Management by prioritizing and defining requirements for future development and testing data elements.
  • Update and enhance existing reports and create or modify dashboards that help end users better understand their book of business.
  • Join data elements from various source systems; build data sets that allow for various types of aggregation and analysis.
  • Develop and refine sustainable processes that help improve efficiency.

Qualifications

Job Requirements and Qualifications
  • Previous Analytical experience within the Data world including previous experience in data mining, analysis and reporting is strongly preferred.
  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Data Analysis, Math or similar major is required.
  • Ability to accurately identify, document and recommend solutions to business problems.
  • Advanced MS Office skills with strong focus on Excel is required.
  • Experience creating and presenting ad hoc date related analysis.
  • Experience or understanding of SQL and ability to create queries to extract data is preferred.
  • Experience extracting data from an enterprise data warehouse and core operating systems.
  • Understanding of different data visualization tools with a strong focus on Tableau is preferred.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively both verbally and in writing to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Experience in P&C insurance industry is preferred.
Western National Insurance is a growing, A+ rated (A.M. Best) group of property-and-casualty insurance companies serving individuals, families, and businesses in 20 states across the Midwestern and Western U.S. plus Alaska. Currently ranked as the 57th largest private company by revenue in Minnesota (Minneapolis-St. Paul Business Journal), Western National has consistently earned accolades as an employer of choice, including as a Star Tribune Top Workplace (2011 \xe2\x80\x93 2016), and previously as a recipient of the Minnesota Business Ethics Award, as a Minnesota Business Magazine Top 100 Workplace, as a Principal Financial \xe2\x80\x9c10 Best\xe2\x80\x9d Company, and as a finalist for the Alfred P. Sloan \xe2\x80\x9cWhen Work Works\xe2\x80\x9d Award.

Western National is known as \xe2\x80\x9cThe Relationship Company\xc2\xae\xe2\x80\x9d, and caring for employees is a key part of that relationship commitment. Western National offers competitive pay, advancement opportunities, a generous benefits package, a robust wellbeing program, and a healthy work/life balance (including three weeks of paid time off, nine paid holidays, and eight hours of paid volunteer time as a starting point for new employees). These attributes are just some of the reasons why nearly half of our employees choose to stay on the Western National team for 10 years or more.

Our benefits package includes:
  • 401(k) company match
  • Medical insurance \xe2\x80\x93 We offer affordable (thanks to a strong employer subsidy), above-average coverage and the choice of either a traditional Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) option OR a High-Deductible Health Plan (HDHP) option
  • Western Wellbeing program \xe2\x80\x93 Including on-site massage, yoga classes, salad and healthy snack days, sit/stand workstations, nutrition seminars, and more
  • 100% company-paid tuition reimbursement for approved, job-relevant coursework
  • Discounts on automobile and homeowner's insurance
  • Other standard employee benefits \xe2\x80\x93 Including dental insurance, vision benefits, life insurance, disability insurance, and more

We could continue to list the things that we think make Western National a great place to work, but why not hear it instead from actual current and former employees? Here are some quotes that Western National employees have posted to the Glassdoor public review site:
  • \xe2\x80\x9cExcellent company which prioritizes customer service and community service.\xe2\x80\x9d
  • \xe2\x80\x9cJust a great place to come to work, and stay for a career. I love the personal touch from [the] executive suite on down. [The] CEO is on a first-name basis with everyone.\xe2\x80\x9d
  • \xe2\x80\x9cAbove-average benefits, especially on the health insurance front.\xe2\x80\x9d
  • \xe2\x80\x9cI have felt welcomed here and I feel like the Senior Management cares.\xe2\x80\x9d

(For more reviews from current and former Western National employees, you can visit the company\xe2\x80\x99s Glassdoor page here: http://bit.ly/2qXtl4A .)

***Western National is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.***

'
title: JR Data Analyst

description:
b'
Internship
The long term growth and health of Wish depends strongly on our ability to fight fraud and abuse while keeping a sharp focus on the bottom line. As a Risk Data Intern, you will be responsible for collecting and organizing large data sets, performing data analyses and reconciliation, and assist the team in making strategic recommendations and decisions effecting thousands to millions of users and supporting constant improvement of the various processes across the Risk organization.

What You'll Do:

  • Perform analyses on large data sets to discover trends, drive business insights and protect Wish against fraud and abuse while delivering an excellent user experience.
  • Create metrics for understanding our anti-abuse, anti-fraud and user trust efforts.
  • Investigate sophisticated abuse, fight fraud and close exploitation loopholes
  • Be part of building out a world class anti-fraud system from the ground up.

Who You Are:

  • Graduating summer 2019 or recent new grad
  • Able to work full-time internship as soon as possible or for summer term
  • Strong interest in data analysis
  • Working knowledge of R or Excel
  • Advanced SQL abilities are a must
  • Strong attention to detail and organization
  • Ability to multitask and thrive in a fun, collaborative and fast-paced environment
Why Wish: Wish is transforming the way the world shops by offering a convenient and personalized mobile shopping experience. Our mission is to offer an unlimited selection of affordable quality goods to be accessible for everyone on a global scale. We bring together world-class technical talent with a passion for connecting relevant products to relevant people.

Wish values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
'
title: Intern - Risk Data Analyst

description:
b"

What You'll Do

  • Support UMB\xc2\xbfs protection against card fraud loss (POS/ATM/PIN debit card transactions, Healthcare debit cards, consumer, commercial, private label, mutual fund, and other credit card products).
  • Research and analyze customer accounts for possible cases of fraud and to identify ways to prevent future fraud.
  • Assist in identifying valid or fraudulent transactions.
  • Provide data to help identify areas that need increased security procedures or software to protect customer accounts.
  • Provide data to assist in review of daily, weekly, and monthly fraud reports to identify emerging fraud trends and UMB\xc2\xbfs overall fraud performance.
  • Analyze fraud trends using statistical modeling including decision tree analysis and recommend actionable solutions to leadership.
  • Work closely with leaders to provide appropriate data and ensure reports are being produced to accomplish overall business needs and expectations of the fraud unit.
  • Stay current with UMB\xc2\xbfs fraud policies and procedures.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Additional Information

Will report directly to the Card Fraud Operations Manager, supporting UMB\xc2\xbfs protection against card fraud loss (POS ATM PIN debit card transactions, Health Care debit cards, consumer, commercial, private label, mutual fund, and other credit card products). Will research and analyze customer accounts for possible cases of fraud and to identify ways to prevent future fraud. Will assist in identifying valid or fraudulent transactions. Will provide data to help identify areas that need increased security procedures or software to protect customer accounts. Will provide data to assist in review of daily, weekly, and monthly fraud reports to identify emerging fraud trends and UMB\xc2\xbfs overall fraud performance. Will analyze fraud trends using statistical modeling including decision tree analysis and recommend actionable solutions to the Card Fraud Operations Manager. Will work closely with the Card Fraud Operations Manager to provide appropriate data and reports are being produced to accomplish overall business needs and expectations of the fraud unit. Must be familiar with principles of project management. Must stay current with UMB\xc2\xbfs fraud policies and procedures. Must be able to deliver to stringent timelines confidently. Other duties as assigned.

Who You Are

  • High School education
  • Some College completed
  • Two (2) years Card or other fraud experience
  • Two (2) years data analyst experience

Preferred Requirements

  • College degree
  • Analytics experience
  • Applied statistics experience

In this Role, You will Need

  • Must be familiar with principles of project management. Must be able to deliver to stringent timelines confidently.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of data mining and analysis
  • Demonstrates knowledge of report building and presentation of analysis results

title: Card Fraud Data Analyst

description:
b"

POSITION SUMMARY:


Responsible for HIM chart reviews, physician suspension process, transcription issues, analysis and timely data collection and reporting. Working with STAR & Patient Connect to merge duplicate medical record numbers. Coordinates with systems to reduce/eliminate MPI duplicates and performs merges/ unmerges. Provides follow-up information to registration staff and leaders to reduce errors and improve registration process. This person will be responsible for making decisions based on documentation to determine to whom clinical and demographic information belongs. The MPI must contain accurate and complete data that includes a single identifier for each patient registered.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
    AND

  • Two years Health Information Management experience in acute care facility


Licensure/Regulation/Certification:N/A


POSITION EXPECTATIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Have knowledge of medical terminology, disease processes, medical records, HPF, STAR, Physician Portal, Patient Connect and Greenway
  • Expected to have knowledge of Microsoft Office and basic mathematical skills.
  • Have the ability to read analyze and interpret general business correspondence.
  • Expected to be responsible for monthly chart reviews (inappropriate abbreviations, verbal order/telephone order read backs and release of body data).
  • Complete HIM chart review and data entry of IP, Surgical and Ambulatory chart review which are all due the first of the month immediately following the month prior.
  • Will be responsible for doctors' deficiencies and suspension process and training doctors on how to sign their records online in the Portal.
  • Process transcription site review file and assist with transcription issues.
  • Work Missing Discharge summary, Missing H&P, Physicians Decline, Transcription, Signature Exception and Unable to Identify Doctor queues in HPF.
  • Identify accounts that need to be sent to the ADI Correction queue.
  • Work the Missing Physician Documentation list in Stockamp.
    Assist with Analysis as needed and log Release of Information requests.
  • Support efforts to migrate to a MPI, including clean-up of existing identified duplicate records in multiple BRRH systems;
  • Provide ongoing management of duplicate intra-facility and inter-facility MRN's;
  • Provide follow-up trend information on duplicates, changes, and trends to leadership;
  • Support reduction/elimination of duplicate creations through coordination with local system leadership and suggested improved practices;
  • Responsible for the development of MPI cleanup and maintenance policies and procedures.
  • Contributor to design of MPI maintenance organization
  • Assist as needed with the identification, development and validation of training curriculum as it pertains to ongoing MPI cleanup activities; supports integration with scheduling and registration functions, etc.

  • Maintain the confidentiality of patient and department information with no infraction.
  • Recognize the influence of beliefs and cultures on behaviors and accept strengths and limitations in others.
  • Exhibit adaptability, flexibility, self-control and maturity in work and behavior.
  • Job duties of this position may require access to protected patient information (PHI). The team member will be accountable for appropriate use of the record and compliance with all confidentiality and security policy and procedures related to use, access, and disclosure of PHI
  • Exhibit calm responsiveness to emergency or stressful situations.
  • Recognize situations which require notification of a supervisor
  • Communicate regularly with the Medical Staff department regarding physicians whose records are delinquent.
  • Expected to handle calls and customer issues.
  • Utilize strong customer service abilities to assist adult patients, patient advocates, physicians and their staff, the Medical Staff Department employees and all other customers.
  • Expected to keep Manager and Director informed of problems or issues.
  • Communicate regularly with the leaders in various departments regarding duplicate medical record creation.
  • Complete assignments with promptness and accuracy; meet deadlines for all tasks assigned.
  • Prioritize work assignments and complete tasks in a timely fashion.
  • Patient Connect; Merging Boca Care patients to Boca Raton Regional Hospital patients by checking both Greenway and HPF documentation to validate it is the same patient.
  • Linking patients to Boca Raton Regional Hospital for those that manually add BRRH as a provider.
  • Merging Boca Raton Regional Hospital patients with duplicate Medical Record numbers doing research in HPF.
  • Merge patients in STAR with all email request send daily from multiple departments.
  • Manage the merge MPI Tool within STAR to proactively merge patients in our MPI database.
  • Expected to be an active contributor in all customer service initiatives.
  • Serve as a proactive in providing hospitality to all BRRH's patients, families, visitors, employees and physicians.
  • Incumbent may be required to perform emergency duty before, during and/or beyond normal work hours or days in the event of an emergency, crisis situation or disaster (man-made or natural) including evacuation sites.
  • The person in this position will work in a smoke-free location, and is expected to adhere to all smoking restrictions.
  • In the spirit of wellness for both our employees and patients, Boca Raton Regional Hospital has instituted a mandatory influenza prevention vaccination program. Current employees must receive the influenza prevention vaccination free of charge during the recognized flu season. As a condition of employment, new hires will be required to comply with all program rules. This is a mandatory program with the exception of documented medical or religious reasons for not receiving the vaccine. For further information on this progressive program, please contact Boca Raton Regional Hospital's Human Resources Department at 561-955-4075.
"
title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Description:

As part of a small, passionate and accomplished team of experts, you will work the full spectrum of Master Data Management from establishing policy, procedures and standards, to implementation of tools for executiion and documentation. You will work directly with Data Owners and Data Stewards to define Master Data entities and attributes, and construct processes for ensuring data validity and consistency across authoritative systems and other data consuming and data producing systems. Ensuring the business has the most accurate and reliable core information will play a key role in the progressing our technology and shaping future of human spaceflight.

Responsibilities:

  • Facilitating and driving strategic decisions regarding Master Data policy, procedures, and standards
  • Executing Master Data related projects and initiatives
  • Performing audits and data validation against Master Data definitions
  • Ensuring and enforcing compliance with Master Data policies and procedures
  • Maintaining Metadata stores for Master Data Attributes, Definitions and Usages

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years' experience in Master Data Management activities
  • Proficiency in interrogating SQL and NoSQL Databases
  • Demonstrated effectiveness in leading/directing small project teams
  • Strong ability to self-manage and drive toward high quality results
  • Experience in complex and fast pace environments
  • Strong analytic skill set and a high degree of proficiency in data profiling
  • Excellent written communication and presentation skills
  • Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Desired:

  • Experience implementing Master Data Management Tools
  • Experience in Manufacturing (specifically Aerorspace) Processes
  • Experience in Integrated Supply Chain, Supplier Management and Product Management

Blue Origin offers a phenomenal work environment and awesome culture with competitive compensation, benefits, 401K, and relocation.

Blue Origin is an equal opportunity employer . In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with Blue's principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. Blue Origin prohibits any form of workplace harassment.

title: Master Data Analyst

description:
b'
  • Please note that we are not able to take on Visa sponsorships and will only be considering applicants legally able to work in the United States. Thank you.
Data Analyst
Victorious is seeking an experienced Data Analyst that can thrive in a company culture which values autonomy, work-ethic, and collaboration. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for talented Data Analyst to continue to drive decisions company-wide through the use of statistical modeling and data processing, who are passionate about using data to help drive informed product and business decisions for the company.

You enjoy digging through data sets to find insights that can improve the way Victorious does business \xe2\x80\x93 all with the goal of improving how Victorious services its current customers and future customers. You can also \xe2\x80\x9ctranslate\xe2\x80\x9d analytics into easy to understand insights for non-technical audiences. You should have an extensive background in a quantitative field, a strong research background, and experience working with large data sets. Experience interpreting data into simplified presentations (or results or analyses) with actionable insights and the ability to present. You should be results-driven, highly motivated, and have a track record of using data analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and the success of a product. This person will collaborate closely with other departments, including but not limited to Sales, Customer Success, and Business Operations.

Responsibilities:
  • Analyze and mine both structured and unstructured data to drive product-centric as well as user-centric insights.
  • Create insightful automated dashboards and data visualizations to track key business metrics from an internal and external perspective.
  • Develop and test analytical solutions to be leveraged by both internal and external perspectives.
  • Recommend key business decisions such as A/B testing of varying performance models based on historical data and trend-lines.
  • Craft compelling stories, make logical recommendations and drive informed actions through data insights
  • Develop and maintain dashboards for customer success, sales, strategy, marketing, operations, and other teams.
  • Help manage and integrate data from a wide variety of sources.
  • Work closely with internal and external partners to develop insightful reports
  • Handle web analytics implementation and conduct QA utilizing tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and Google Tag Manager, Google Search Console
Required experience:
  • Bachelor or Masters degree in Math, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance or another quantitative related field
  • Experience migrating data pipelines and dashboards is also a plus
  • A/B testing, multivariate testing
  • Keen attention to detail for data quality assurance.
  • Strong Excel skills \xe2\x80\x93 familiarity with pivot tables a must
  • Dashboard and data visualization (Google Data Studio & Grow) experience preferred
  • 1-3 years of experience as a data analyst
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Experience building interactive dashboards and enabling self-service for a non-technical audience
  • Experience with SQL
  • Strong communication skills and ability to build relationships with technical and non-technical colleagues
  • Relentless curiosity
Key culture traits:
  • Giving a**** about the work. Victorious values and upholds the inherent value of the work we do, and as such we care deeply about the quality and results of the work we do. Our ideal candidate will have a proven record of demonstrating this trait in previous positions.
  • Radical integrity horizontally and vertically within the company. Victorious\xe2\x80\x99 culture does not micro-manage - rather we foster integrity between teammates and from management so that all teammates are empowered to do their best work. For this to work well, our ideal candidate can operate with radical integrity and transparency.
  • Empowering of other employees and management. Victorious is hyper-collaborative, and as such the Data Analyst will be working closely on an ad-hoc basis with various employees in different departments. As such, our ideal candidate thrives in an open, ever-changing \xe2\x80\x9cit takes a village\xe2\x80\x9d environment.
  • Commitment to excellence and perfecting the craft. Our ideal candidate is obsessed with becoming the best data analyst professional in the world. This person devours data, daring ideas, and fresh strategies while simultaneously demonstrating a high level of data-driven discernment to drive the strongest results.
Benefits and Perks:
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Paid Bank Holidays
  • 401K Company Matching
  • Work from Home Fridays
  • Paid Team Lunches
  • Team Outings
  • Escape the tech startup rat race
  • Company Sponsored Health / Dental / Vision / Life Insurance
About Us:
Victorious is the 2018 SEO Agency of the Year as selected by the two industry-leading publications - Search Engine Land & U.S. Search Awards. Located in historic Showplace Square building in the Design District of San Francisco, we\xe2\x80\x99re a hard-working group of professionals looking for long-term teammates to join our mission.

Victorious is not the typical San Francisco startup. We are not funded by Silicon Valley venture capitalists. Our days are not consumed with increasing \xe2\x80\x9crunway\xe2\x80\x9d or launching an \xe2\x80\x9cMVP\xe2\x80\x9d. We\xe2\x80\x99re not hungry for acquisition and exit. If not these, then what are we? We\xe2\x80\x99re a profitable, efficient, sustainable company scaling at a strong pace due to natural growth. Our product is market-proven and is being sought out by some of the largest technology companies in San Francisco and beyond. If you\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a place to call home without worrying about your employer shutting its doors for a myriad of reasons, then we may be the place for you.

We\xe2\x80\x99re located near Caltrain, Muni, Michelin-starred restaurants and world-class nightlife. The Design District is strategically placed between SOMA, The Mission, and Mission Bay for an easy commute. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, 401(k), work from home Fridays, and more! We offer the opportunity to be part of a successful, fast growing company. To learn more about us, please visit our website at
victoriousseo.com
[http://victoriousseo.com/]
If you are interested in applying for this opportunity, please submit your resume. All submissions will be evaluated and interviews will be conducted for those applicants who most strongly fit our needs. To apply, please send an up-to-date resume and a cover letter explaining your interest.

No phone calls please, no agencies and no recruiters.'
title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
Internship

Overview

We are CONNECTING HEALTH AND WEALTH. Come be part of remarkable.

How you can make a difference
The HealthEquity Intern program aims to provide accomplished students the opportunity to develop their skills while supporting the Company\xe2\x80\x99s strategic objectives. Candidates are assigned to a department for the entire 13-week program and gain real-world experience applying their classroom learnings in a dynamic business environment. They receive coaching and mentoring from an experienced people leader who directs their work and helps ensure their success.

We are seeking a data driven intern to assist the Fraud Strategy and Analytics team in driving actionable insights pertaining to preventing fraud in the payments, card and enrollments space. This person will also help support the team in development of reporting and metrics, specifically surrounding KPI, KRI, and CEI\xe2\x80\x99s for department leadership and our executive leadership team here at HealthEquity. This internship will provide exposure into the world of fraud prevention in identifying risky trends. You will also be interacting daily with risk and security professionals giving you access to a wealth of knowledge you will be able to be leverage for success in your internship and career!

What you\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing
  • Utilize large amounts of data to proactively identify fraud trends/issues and drive risk mitigation
  • Analyze transaction patterns for abnormal behavior
  • Identify system and process gaps that lead to increased fraud risk and propose solutions to remediate
  • Assist in creating and maintaining reporting metrics
What you will need to be successful
  • Highly adaptable, with the ability to rapidly assimilate new information and articulate consequential process implications
  • Familiarity with statistical terms and model creation/ maintenance
  • Strong quantitative analytical aptitude in extracting key information from data
  • Experience with SQL
  • Proficient in Excel, MS PowerPoint and Outlook
  • Understanding of financial services, banking, and/or payment related processes, regulations, and systems is a plus
  • Comfortable working in an ambiguous, changing environment
Why work for HealthEquity
HealthEquity has a vision that by 2030 we will make HSAs as wide-spread and popular as retirement accounts. We are passionate about providing a solution that allows American families to connect health and wealth and build health savings for life. Through our innovative technology and superior service delivery, our members gain valuable insights to better save and spend their healthcare dollars.

We firmly believe that our team members drive the success of this company. We hire passionate contributors who enjoy the thrill of pioneering their positions to their full potential. Join us and discover a work experience where the person is valued more than the position, and where are our purple culture drives a remarkable experience.

Our advice to you
HealthEquity is fiercely focused on hiring passionate individuals to contribute to our purple culture. If you speak passion, excellence, service, ambition, fun\xe2\x80\xa6 we want to speak with you! We believe that your personality is as important as your experience and qualifications so when we do have the opportunity to speak together, be authentic, be genuine, be you! Showcase your experience and your passion.

HealthEquity, Inc. is a proud promoter of equal opportunities for training, compensation, transfer, promotion, and other aspects of employment for all qualified applicants and employees. HealthEquity, Inc. support Equal Employment Opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation or veteran status when hiring \xe2\x80\x93 under federal, state and local laws.

description:
b'
$24.34 - $28.23 an hour
Purpose

The job of the Educational Data Analyst II is done for the purpose/s of planning, organizing, and

coordinating services and activities related to data collection, and analysis; providing useful and

relevant data reports and displays; and serving as a resource to county office and district staff.

This job reports to the Assigned Administrator/Supervisor.

Essential Functions

  • Provides technical expertise in the areas of California Assessment for Student Performance
and Progress, California School Dashboard, Ed Data, CALPADS, DataQuest, student

management systems (AERIES) and other data management systems; grant applications, and

planning to improve services.

  • Creates, maintains and updates, as necessary tutorials for the purpose of building capacity in
the above mentioned areas.

  • Works closely with Differentiated Assistance / Geographical Lead team members to support
both grant writing and program evaluation functions.

  • Coordinates with districts on data Memorandum of Understanding and support districts in
reconciling inaccuracies in the data.

  • Compiles and analyzes statistical data as needed for department reports, district and school
reports and state or federal mandated reports.

  • Maintains data integrity and provides frequent data validations.
  • Participates in collaborative meetings; consults with county office department, district and
school personnel in the areas of LCAP, Differentiated Assistance and federal plan

development and implementation.

  • Provides research information as needed and requested for instructional program areas.
  • Serves as a member of the Instructional Services team and provide leadership in the area of
data collection, analysis, and research to support the development of programs and grants.

  • Identifies and/or develops information management systems to increase efficiency in data
collection.

  • Serves as resource to administrators, personnel and LEAs in Shasta County, as directed by
supervisor: respond to inquiries and provide information concerning analysis findings and the

effectiveness of educational programs; train others in the collection and interpretation of test

data.

  • Collaborates with Instructional Services team to identify key questions and to analyze data in
order to develop and implement methods and procedures to increase student test performance

and meet established goals.

  • Researches, investigates and resolves problem errors and discrepancies in data collections.
  • Prepares and maintains a variety of narrative and statistical reports, records and files related
to research, and data collection findings and results; compose documents concerning

information and analysis of results for distribution to the public.

March 2019

Educational Data Analyst II \xe2\x80\x93 Continued

  • Communicates with other administrators, personnel, and outside organizations to coordinate
assigned activities and programs, resolving issues and conflicts, and exchanging information.

  • Provides technical assistance to coordinators and directors relative to the effective and
efficient use of data in the departments providing direct support to districts with low

performing schools.

  • Identifies and promotes the use of efficient systems to manage multiple sources for
countywide data related to schools and students for use by SCOE personnel.

  • Maintains confidentiality.
Other Functions

  • Operates a computer and other office equipment as assigned; drives a vehicle to various sites
to conduct work.

  • Attends and conducts a variety of meetings as assigned.
  • Conducts inservices for administrators and personnel.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned for the purpose of ensuring the efficient and
effective functioning of the work unit.

Job Requirement: Minimum Qualifications

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities

SKILLS are required to perform multiple, technical tasks with a need to occasionally upgrade

skills in order to meet changing job conditions. Specific skill based competencies required to

satisfactorily perform the functions of the job include: utilizing conflict resolution

techniques; operating standard office equipment including pertinent software applications;

planning and managing projects; preparing and maintaining accurate records; public

speaking; and facilitating meetings.

KNOWLEDGE is required to perform intermediate math, including calculations using

fractions, percents, and/or ratios; read technical information, compose a variety of

documents, and/or facilitate group discussions; and solve practical problems. Specific

knowledge based competencies required to satisfactorily perform the functions of the job

include: concepts of grammar and punctuation; community resources; district policies and

procedures; accounting practices; age appropriate activities; business telephone etiquette;

health standards; codes/laws/rules/regulations/policies; practicing cultural competency while

working collaboratively with diverse groups and individuals; and stages of child

development.

ABILITY is required to schedule a number of activities, meetings, and/or events; often

gather, collate, and/or classify data; and use basic, job-related equipment. Flexibility is

required to work with others in a wide variety of circumstances; work with data utilizing

defined but different processes; and operate equipment using defined methods. Ability is also

required to work with a significant diversity of individuals and/or groups; work with data of

varied types and/or purposes; and utilize specific, job-related equipment. Problem solving is

required to analyze issues and create action plans. Problem solving with data frequently

requires independent interpretation of guidelines; and problem solving with equipment is

limited. Specific ability based competencies required to satisfactorily perform the functions

of the job include: adapting to changing work priorities; communicating with diverse groups;

March 2019

Educational Data Analyst II \xe2\x80\x93 Continued

setting priorities; building collaborative relationships; working with constant interruptions;

maintaining confidentiality; meeting deadlines and schedules; and working with detailed

information/data.

Responsibility

Responsibilities include: working under limited supervision following standardized practices

and/or methods; leading, guiding, and/or coordinating others; operating within a defined budget.

Utilization of resources from other work units is often required to perform the job\xe2\x80\x99s functions.

There is a continual opportunity to have some impact on the organization\xe2\x80\x99s services.

Work Environment

The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following

physical demands: some lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling, some stooping, kneeling,

crouching and/or crawling and significant fine finger dexterity. Generally the job requires 80%

sitting, 10% walking, and 10% standing. This job is performed in a generally clean and helathy

environment.

Experience with various software products used for data analysis, integration and

title: Educational Data Analyst II

description:
b'
Part-time, Internship

Element Data is looking for a part-time Data Analyst Intern to help drive analyses, generate insights, and influence decision making. Element Data is in the business of generating 360 degree customer views for fortune 1000 companies. So, this job is an opportunity to get work experience on real world challenges. The ideal candidate is intellectually curious, has strong analytical skills, some statistical background, and has the ability to communicate key insights effectively. This individual will work closely with our data enrichment engineering team, and with the customer delivery team. This flexible part time position reports to the Sr. Director of Customer Success and is based in Element Data\xe2\x80\x99s corporate offices in Bellevue, WA.

Responsibilities

  • Mine large datasets and draw actionable insights & identify areas for further investigation.
  • Present discoveries and insights to internal teams and give recommendations on how to represent the analysis to the customer.
  • Partner with engineering on best way to build self-service analytics tools that will go into our platform.

Requirements

  • Two year\xe2\x80\x99s (or more) college work in: Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Informatics, Physics, or other technical field.
  • Strong business judgment and an ability to present analysis in a clear and compelling manner.
  • Proficient in implementing various statistical models and data mining tools (predictive modeling, clustering, logistic regression, multivariate regression, decision trees, neural networks).
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as Data Probability distributions, Estimation techniques, Hypothesis testing, etc.
  • Hands on experience in executing analysis using tools such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Tableau.
  • Ability to research and learn new technologies, tools, and platforms.
  • Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions.
  • Ability to thrive in an unstructured environment, working autonomously on a strong team to find opportunity and deliver business impact.
  • A self-starters who can, with minimal guidance, drive projects from concept through completion.
  • Smarts to pick up new concepts at light speed.
  • Agility to quickly adjust priorities and shift direction.
  • Flexibility to contribute to other projects as required.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"

The United States Strategic Command (USSTRATCOM) Commander is designated as the Nuclear Command, Control, and Communication (NC3) enterprise lead with increased responsibilities for operations, requirements; enterprise systems engineering and integration (SE&I); assessment and analytics, to include data management, and modeling and simulation; intelligence liaison; and inspection and compliance. The NC3 Enterprise Center (NC3 EC) has been established to execute the new roles and responsibilities and enabling functions.

  • The NC3 EC requires Advisory and Assistance Services (A&AS) in support of the following activities:Assist in developing NC3 Enterprise analytic requirements, establish data collection strategies, and identify NC3 modeling needs. Define and utilize a common framework to ensure analysis is based on cohesive methodologies and processes. Leverage standards to establish NC3 Enterprise Data Management strategy and Risk Management strategy to support NC3 EC in conducting NC3 enterprise-related assessments and analytics.

  • 3+ years' experience conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design; developing analysis and reporting capabilities; monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements; use statistical methods to analyze data and generate reports; create models to depict trends in the customer base and identify specific data needs for analysis projects.
  • Active/current Top Secret+ clearance with eligibility for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI), Nuclear Command and Control-Extremely Sensitive Information (NC2-ESI), NATO, and Special Access Required (SAR) classified material access.

title: A &A Division /NC3 Data Analyst

description:
b'
    Responsible for analytic data needs of the business unit.

  • Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes, as well as mass data entry, maintenance, and update projects.
  • Complete data audits and evaluations within core systems.
  • Identify and resolve complex issues, including mass change updates, reconciliation projects, and the operationalization of data from various sources.
  • Analyze and advise management of workflow issues and data integrity problems and offer recommendations on resolution.
  • Develop and submit internal and external status reports.
  • Create report and data reconciliation through Access, Excel, Business Objects and other reporting tools, to include provider data, claims data, membership data.

    For New Hampshire Healthy Families Only:
  • Aid with project implementation and project management for medical management and health plan initiatives.
  • Design, plan and implement process improvement within medical management functions.
Qualifications:

Education/Experience: Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 0-2 years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access. Experience with Business Intelligence and SQL tools preferred.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Data Analyst I

description:
b'

This person is responsible for helping the entire Marketing Organization to understand their performance, and identify opportunities for increased efficiency. Equal parts data analyst, reporting guru, and data strategist, this role will be an instrumental part of our strategy and operations team.

The ideal candidate brings a deep understanding of B2B go-to-market, fluency working with data and quantitative reasoning, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and most importantly, a passion for teamwork and collaboration. The ideal profile will have experience in a fast paced high growth environment with technology companies, SaaS or enterprise software.

Duties And Responsibilities

  • Metrics and Reporting: Take ownership of the Marketing organization\xe2\x80\x99s Tableau instance and serve as the product manager for all things reporting. Develop and maintain standard Tableau Dashboards for Marketing leadership. Be able to not only pull the data, but also tell the story. Make sure that every stakeholder understands their performance and can access the data they need to optimize their motion.
  • Data Strategy : Work with other functions on data definitions and processes within various systems to create consistency in reporting and metrics. Work with Business Partners within the Nutanix Organization to ensure that all Marketing Data is accurately available.
  • Insights and Analysis: Be the go-to person for big challenging, strategic questions on metrics. Develop insightful analyses that guide decision making for your business partners.
  • Collaboration: Collaborates across departments to understand the business problem, define requirements with stakeholders and lead the implementation phase projects involving data compilation & analysis, dashboard generation and queries to monitor and improve business performance.

Qualification

  • \xe2\x80\xaa\xe2\x80\xaa4+ years experience in data analysis
  • Experience working with Salesforce and Tableau
  • \xe2\x80\xaa\xe2\x80\xaaDemonstrated ability to dig in and understand data integrations between systems (primarily SFDC and Marketo), field mappings, data flows, etc.
  • Experience retrieving, cleaning and manipulating data to build datasets.
  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related technical field is required

title: Sr Marketing Data Analyst

description:
b'
Contract

Overview

Northwest Permanente, P.C. is a self-governed (physician led), multi-specialty group of over 1500 physicians, surgeons, and clinicians, caring for over 600,000 members in Oregon and Southwest Washington. Kaiser Permanente is one of the nation's pre-eminent health care systems, a benchmark for comprehensive, integrated and high quality care. We are seeking a Data Analyst III for our Care Delivery Analytics department. The Data Analyst III position provides the opportunity to learn different operational areas of Kaiser Permanente, help drive key business decisions and impact how health care is delivered. Analyze business information and reporting needs, assess existing data sources and translate into logical and physical information and domain data marts.


Major Accountabilities and Responsibilities:

  • In collaboration with KPIT and business clients define, design, document and build domain level information marts for purposes of supporting end user reporting and consistent business rule definitions.
    • Defines meta data structures for information repository and performs model management.
    • Develops data definitions consistent with data management standards and conventions.
    • Documents and maintains information and data needs commensurate with standard documentation protocols.
    • Maintains content and documentation of current data marts.
    • Maintains and monitors quality of data into and out of data marts.
    • Populates information repository and deploys updates.
    • Collaborates with physical database designers to develop alternative solutions for meeting complex and conflicting requirements.
    • Develops data definitions consistent with data management standards and conventions.
    • Participates in model integration and convergence activities.
  • Develop applications that combine data from existing sources, tailored to specific user groups and business needs. Work with key system users to identify user requirements and continuously improve their ability to access information easily and efficiently. Ensure consistency with established data and application standards.
  • Report analyst duties, e.g. design and develop automated actionable reports to inform managers in a timly fashion.
  • Information analyst duties, e.g. conduct analysis and make recommendations to business unit based on findings of analysis.

Minimum Qualifications:
  • Masters Degree in analytical or technical discipline or equivalent technical certification training & experience.
  • Proven skills in project management, including the following attributes: efficient, collaborative, candid, open, and results-oriented. Establish clear performance contracts and project workplans.
  • Strong proficiency in the use of current software, including SAS/SQL, Oracle and Teradata, and Microsoft Office.
  • Strong logical data modeling and use of data modeling tools.
  • Advanced ETL experience.
  • Proactive issue avoidance or opportunity discovery.
Minimum Required Experience:
  • Three years in data analytics or
  • Five years in analytical position

At Northwest Permanente, P.C., we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Northwest Permanente, P.C. believes that diversity, inclusion, and equity among our employees is critical to our success and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

title: Data Analyst 3 (Tech)

description:
b"

The Palo Alto Veterans Institute for Research (PAVIR) is seeking a Life Sciences Research Data Analyst to work with the Principal Investigator (PI), Eugene Butcher, M.D. in the Butcher Laboratory http://butcherlab.stanford.edu/, part of the VA Palo Alto Healthcare System and Stanford University.

The Research Data Analyst will manage and analyze large amounts of bioinformatics information including single cell transcriptomics under the direction of project researchers, investigators, and managers. The labs work in the areas of vascular biology, immunology and tumor biology with translational relevance.

The Research Data Analyst will maintain and organize bioinformatics databases, assist the lab in processing and analyzing genomic and single cell transcriptomic data sets, and will help develop algorithms and process to integrate and interpret high dimensional biological data. The candidate should have excellent interpersonal communication and coding skills.

This is a regular, full time (40 hrs/wk), exempt (Salary-paid) position.

Benefits:

  • Medical Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vacation
  • Sick Pay
  • Holidays
  • Life Insurance - paid by PAVIR
  • Long-term Disability Insurance - paid by PAVIR
  • Short-term Disability Insurance - paid by PAVIR
  • Flexible Spending Account
  • 401(k) Retirement Plan with Company Match and Profit Share
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Commuter Benefit

PAVIR is a nonprofit foundation affiliated with the Veterans Affairs Palo Alto Health Care System (VAPAHCS). As a condition of employment, all PAVIR employees are required to have an approved appointment with VAPAHCS and complete a background check before they can commence work.

Duties:

  • Perform programming and statistical analyses using Python, Matlab, JSL and/or R.
  • Create databases and reports, develop algorithms and statistical models, and perform statistical analyses appropriate to data and reporting requirements;
  • Develop reports, charts, graphs and tables for use by investigators and for publication and presentation;
  • Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially problematic data, make corrections, and determine root cause for data problems from input errors or inadequate field edits, and suggest possible solutions;
  • Employ new and existing tools to interpret, analyze, and visualize multivariate relationships in data.
  • Collect, manage and clean data sets. Organize and analyze the single cell transcriptomic data using statistical and computational methods.
  • Collaborate with faculty and research staff on data collection and analysis methods.
  • Provide documentation based on audit and reporting criteria to investigators and research staff.

Requirements:

EDUCATION:

Required: Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, or quantitative field (e.g. Engineering, Applied, and Computer Science).

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION: Valid Driver License is required.

WORK EXPERIENCE:

Required:

  • 2 years of related experience in research data analysis;
  • Experience with programming and statistical analyses using Python, Matlab, JSL and/or R;
  • Experience using cloud or cluster computing.

KNOWLEDGE/ SKILLS/ ABILITIES:

  • Substantial experience with MS Office (Excel, Powerpoint, and Word);
  • Experience with data analysis and analytical programs (Matlab, Python, JMP, SAS, R);
  • Experience with use of cloud or cluster computing;
  • Strong writing and analytical skills;
  • Ability to prioritize workload;
  • Strong programming skills;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Good organization skills and attention to detail.

Environmental Conditions / Physical Demands:

Physical: Lifting up to 20 lbs. occasionally, standing, bending, repetitive movement, manual dexterity, etc.

Environmental: Exposure to a wet lab environment, research animals, blood borne pathogens, toxic/caustic chemicals or reagents, and radiation. Occasional travel may be required to Stanford.

PAVIR engages in nonprofit medical research and works with sponsors and the Veterans Affairs Palo Alto Health Care System (VAPAHCS) in administering funds for conducting research to find new and improved ways to combat human disease and help people with disabilities. Please refer to our website for additional information: www.pavir.org

PAVIR is pleased to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities, Women, Veterans, and Individuals with a Disability are encouraged to apply. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to apply for a posted position, please contact our Human Resources department.

"
title: Life Sciences Research Data Analyst I (BUT1903.19)

description:
b'
Part-time, Internship
The Data Analytics team influences how Catholic Financial Life does business, one data-driven decision at a time! As a data analyst intern, you may assist business units with casual inferences and observations with finding patterns, relationships in data, perform large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models to translate data into intelligence. You will also solve a variety of business problems and enable business strategy, inform, influence, support, and execute business decisions and product design, analyze and explore data to help discover hidden business insights in the data.

An ideal candidate would exhibit behavioral traits that indicate:
  • Strong analytical mind with problem-solving skills
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity in defining activities and direction
  • Passion for the job
  • High motivation with a strong work ethic
  • Good planning skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
You must meet the qualifications to be considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work, class course work, research, relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Qualifications
Working towards a degree in Computer Science or any related fields (i.e. Statistics, applied Mathematics, Data Science). Only full time students who are available during the summer and the school year will be considered.
Solid understanding of Microsoft Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Domo ext\xe2\x80\xa6)
Candidates must show initiative, be able to jump right into a project, be able to take direction and accept constructive criticism. If you have these traits, you will fit in well and we encourage you to apply.

Internship hours during the school year will be 10-15 hours/week. During the summer the internship will be up to 24-29 hours/week.
ABOUT CATHOLIC FINANCIAL LIFE

From Life insurance to retirement planning, education savings, and more, Catholic Financial Life has been helping individuals protect their financial lives for 150 years. With assets of $1.64 billion and 143,000 members across the United States, Catholic Financial Life's strength comes from being a different kind of financial community. As a member-owned organization, we are accountable to our members. Our longevity is a testimony to their loyalty, and our success is a result of being a trusted financial partner.

Catholic Financial Life is the second largest Catholic fraternal benefit organization in the United States. For five consecutive years, Catholic Financial Life has been named a Top Workplace by the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel. We offer a friendly culture with many soft benefits that make us unique, such as on-site parking and a rooftop pool!

Our Mission...
We're a faith-based membership organization that puts Catholic values in action by:

  • Serving God through serving others;
  • Providing financial security; and
  • Enhancing quality of life

title: Internship - Data Analyst

description:
b'
Internship
Joseph T. Ryerson & Son, Inc., is one of the largest metals distributors in the US, and recently celebrated its\xe2\x80\x99 176th anniversary. We operate approximately 100 locations with 4,000 employees in North America, Canada and China. We are currently seeking a bright, energetic individual to fill our 2019 internship position and to contribute as an essential member within the Ryerson IT Analytics team in Lisle, IL. The Ryerson IT Analytics team is part of the Office of the Chief Data Officer and supports key decision makers throughout all functional areas and management levels of Ryerson.

title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b"Our client is seeking a qualified Data Analyst who can create and maintain a large collection of reports and dashboards. The Analyst must have knowledge and experience in data discovery and analysis to create standard and ad-hoc reports and dashboards, as well as being able to determine trends that result in actionable insights.

Responsibilities

_____________________________________________________________________

Six Foot Staffing was conceived as a solution to a challenge that traditional staffing agencies don't understand - the intricacies and staffing demands of the games industry. title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b'
The Research Data Analyst will join a collaborative and exciting team of researchers at the F.I. Proctor Foundation studying prevention of child mortality in West Africa. Researchers at the F.I. Proctor Foundation conduct randomized controlled trials and large epidemiological studies on ocular diseases that can cause blindness and child health. The epidemiological studies involve large administrative databases and the trials involve domestic and international collaboration.

This position requires an employee with excellent communication and organizational skills who can be relied upon to play an integral role in implementing research studies (including international trials). The individual will be asked to contribute to study design from a methodological standpoint, help with database creation, management and analysis, as well as to assist in the writing of grants, progress reports, and manuscripts. Responsibilities will also include communication with and coordination of collaborating sites, training investigators and study personnel, and being responsible for regulatory approvals. Travel to study sites will also be required for study implementation and monitoring.

The employee should show a strong interest in clinical research and a desire to contribute to the state of knowledge on the prevention, treatment and correlates of disease. The individual must be able to multi-task, problem-solve, and apply creative solutions to new and unexpected situations at first with substantial supervision but gradually with more limited supervision.

PROCTOR FOUNDATION FOR RESEARCH IN OPHTHALMOLOGY
The F.I. Proctor Foundation for Research in Ophthalmology at UCSF is committed to engaging in research activities and providing state-of-art patient care that address infectious and inflammatory disease that cause blindness. The mission is the prevention of blindness worldwide through research and teaching focused on infectious and inflammatory eye disease.

ABOUT UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences, health professions and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

title: Research Data Analyst

description:
b"
This role will primarily support key sales, underwriting, and operations activity reporting, analysis, and business insights within the Finance team. The individual will have opportunities to work with associates in other areas of the company including sales, underwriting, operations, actuarial, data and analytics, marketing, and EB leadership on various projects and report deliverables.

This is an individual contributor position requiring strong collaboration skills, time management skills, strong reporting and analytics capabilities to regularly update, reconcile, complete, improve, interpret, and distribute reports. Some reports are routine and others are ad hoc. This role will be expected to perform complex analysis and provide business insights to help drive optimal business decisions. This position is responsible for:
  • Ensuring a timely and accurate delivery of reports containing key metrics analysis pertaining to sales, underwriting, and operations activities.
  • Creating efficiencies in, or redesigning, standard reporting deliverables while maintaining accuracy in order to spend more time analyzing and communicating the results and recommendations.
  • Collaborating well with others to ensure accuracy, obtain feedback, and make changes necessary to improve the ongoing maintenance and development of reports.
  • Developing a thorough understanding of the company, group products, data resources, available software, and relevant industry information.
  • Performing other duties, including team and/or departmental projects as assigned.

This is a non-actuarial position and is not part of the actuarial student program.

A Bachelor's degree and 4+ years of full-time experience is required. For success in this role, the candidate needs to have a strong knowledge of high-level mathematics and experience using programming languages, spreadsheets, and other databases to perform technical work. The ideal candidate will be an excellent creative problem solver with exceptional interpersonal skills, responsiveness, and a desire to learn and continuously improve processes. This individual is expected to exhibit energy, be energizing to others, be execution focused, and have demonstrated passion and intellectual curiosity for both their work and that of their team.

title: Business Data Analyst

description:
b'
Contract
Provider Data Management (PDM) Analysts are responsible for ensuring the integrity and accuracy of provider data in all applications. PDM Analysts are expected to work collaboratively with all internal and external stakeholders in an effort to meet and/or exceed all regulatory and industry provider data quality and accuracy standards. PDM Analysts are responsible for the installation of assigned accounts, including, but not limited to: structure building and billing set up, structure revisions, researching & resolving structure issues, database loading, and preparation of plan materials such as administrative documents and customer education materials.

  • Monitor and coordinate additions, changes and terminations for affiliated contracts from the Health Plan
  • Manage and resolve complex provider data issues, such as mass change updates, limited reconciliations and direct submissions of urgent requests

  • Excellent communication, time management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills

Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

title: BI Data Analyst I Job ID: ADD19-51-407-002

description:
b"ezCater ( https://boards.greenhouse.io/embed/ezcater.com ) is the #1 online - and the only nationwide - marketplace for business catering in the United States \xe2\x80\x93 a $23.9 billion market. Our 3.8M+ on-time ratings and reviews, our 60K+ caterers and restaurants, and our 5-star customer service make it superbly easy for business people to find and order great food for their meetings. We're backed by Insight Venture Partners, Iconiq Capital, and Wellington Management, we're on a path to $1B in 2019 and $2B in 2020, and we'll get there \xe2\x80\x93 even more surely if you come help us.

Do you know SQL? Do you love data analytics and learning new skills? Then we'd love to hear from you! The role of Junior Data Analyst will be instrumental in elevating ezCater's ability to be a data driven product organization.

We are hiring for two roles, one analyst working with our Product Department and one analyst working with our Customer Service Department.

The Junior Data Analyst - Customer Service will work cross functionally with customer service leaders, supervisors, product managers, and engineers, providing key insights and suggestions to better serve our customers. This position will be focused on analysis and reporting related to improving our customer service efficiency.

The Junior Data Analyst - Product will work cross functionally with product managers, engineers, and designers in Product (with an emphasis on the ezDispatch product). This position will be focused on analysis and reporting related to improving ezCater's core products.

Both roles will function very similarly, but if you have a preference between the two, please let us know in your cover letter- if you're not sure, that's fine too!

What you'll do:
---------------------

  • Support various product teams by providing them with the data related tools and dashboards they need to monitor key metrics related to experiments and initiatives.
  • Dive into ezCater's order, customer service, and product data and be familiar with all the facets of the business and how they tie together.
  • Perform ad hoc analyses and data extractions. We all clamor for these constantly, but sometimes you'll be testing your own hypotheses.
  • Quantify potential efficiencies and develop monitoring for any implemented.
  • Add to our ranks of 'data champions' across the company, by making our data accessible and your conclusions useful.
  • Acquire invaluable experience with hands-on data analysis and solving very real and very impactful business problems.
You are:
--------

  • In the early stages of your analytics career but love diving deep into the data weeds and learning as much as you can in the process.
  • SQL proficient and are passionate about self improvement.
  • Analytically Minded: You're rigorous in taking a data driven approach to problem solving.
  • Communicative: You're able to explain your analysis and findings in straightforward and actionable business terms.
  • Collaborative: You have demonstrated experience working with others and understand how to effectively help them meet their needs.
  • A Proactive Learner: You might not know all the answers, but you understand how to do your own research and ask the right questions to get to what you need to know.
  • Experienced with data manipulation and/or visualization (R, Python, Excel), experience with A/B testing & experiment design, basic knowledge of applied statistics. (Nice to have, not necessary)
Please include a cover letter telling us why you are a great fit for ezCater and why ezCater is a great fit for you.

What you'll get from us:
------------------------------

You'll be in a great environment to kick off or accelerate your career as an analyst and become proficient with all the tools of the trade. The DSA team has no shortage of high impact projects and research that will constantly hone your skills, and you'll be surrounded by knowledgeable and friendly teammates eager to share their wealth of experience with you.

Also importantly, you'll get sane working hours and a huge amount of flexibility around work/life balance. Have people in your life \xe2\x80\x93 of any age \xe2\x80\x93 who always, often, or sometimes need your help? We make room for that. Have a bad thing or a good thing happen to you? We make room for that, too.

Oh, and here's what else you'll get: Market salary, stock options you'll help make worth a lot, the usual holidays, all-you-can-eat vacation, 401K, health/dental/FSA, long-term disability insurance, subsidized T-passes, a great office smack-dab in the heart of Boston, a tremendous amount of responsibility and autonomy, wicked awesome co-workers, cupcakes (and many more goodies), and knowing that you helped get this rocket ship to the moon.

ezCater is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace humans of every background, appearance, race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, and disability status. At the same time, we do not employ jerks, even brilliant ones."
title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
b'
Part-time, Temporary

How to Apply

A cover letter is required for consideration for this position and should be attached as the first page of your resume. The cover letter should address your specific interest in the position, include your salary requirements, and outline skills and experience that directly relate to this position.

Job Summary

The Office of Undergraduate Programs in the Ross School of Business seeks a part-time Data Analyst to assist in the evaluation of information relative to the undergraduate student experience of various programs reporting to the Managing Director. Additional responsibilities may include the development, design, and execution of new survey and assessment tools and processes.

Responsibilities*

This position involves a wide range of tasks including data management, statistical programming, and analysis supporting the undergraduate student experience. Specifically, the position involves providing independent and collaborative support including the following responsibilities:

  • Collect, analyzes, and interprets assessment from a variety of programs
  • Support the transformation of data into information by developing and designing visualizations and standard reports
  • Develop customized reports from databases to extract data according to defined business requirements
  • Provide guidance for study design issues
  • Participate as a team member in discussions on data collection, management, and analysis.

Required Qualifications*

Minimum qualifications

  • Masters degree and 3 years of experience in data management, statistical analysis, and computer programming.
  • Proficiency with Excel, Qualtrics, and additional software applications such as Strata or SAS, and query tools such as data warehouse repositories, Business Objects, etc

Additional Information

This is a temporary appointment, with a part-time designation.

Application Deadline

Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven days. The job may be removed from posting boards and filled any time after the minimum posting period has ended.

title: Data Analyst Contractor

description:
b'
Internship

Chicago\xe2\x80\x99s Office of Inspector General (OIG) is a watchdog for the taxpayers of the City of Chicago, and it has jurisdiction to conduct independent inquiries into most aspects of City government. The mission of OIG is to promote economy, effectiveness, efficiency, and integrity in City government by rooting out corruption, waste, and mismanagement. OIG is organized into five operational units, three mission units\xe2\x80\x94Investigations, Audit and Program Review, and Hiring Oversight\xe2\x80\x94and two support units\xe2\x80\x94Legal and Operations.

OIG is seeking an Unpaid Data Analyst Intern to work in its Center for Information Technology and Analytics (CITA). CITA team members work directly with office units to define needs and compile large data sets to provide statistical models, trends, predictions, and analyses that enables investigators to develop cases, performance analysts to conduct citywide program reviews and audits, compliance officers to monitor citywide hiring practices, and managers to make informed business decisions.

This internship offers the experience of developing foundational knowledge of data warehousing and analytics best practices with hands-on experience with tools like Tableau, Pentaho, and SQL. The Data Analyst Intern assignments will vary but includes working closely with team members on data validation, dashboard development, dashboard usability testing, and statistical modeling.

NOTE: APPLICATIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY THE INDIVIDUAL APPLYING. NO SECOND PARTY APPLICATIONS WILL BE ACCEPTED. THE OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL REQUIRES THAT ITS EMPLOYEES BE NONPARTISAN AND FREE FROM CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

ANNUAL SALARY: Unpaid Intern

HOURS: Negotiable

QUALIFICATIONS:

Academic Standing:

  • Must be a current college senior or graduate student majoring in data analytics, statistics, or mathematics at an accredited four-year college or university.
  • Must have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 grading scale or a 4.0 on a 5.0 grading scale.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Graduate student in good academic standing

Knowledge, Skills, Ability and Experience:

  • Experience using programming languages such as R, Python or Penatho.
  • Experience using business intelligence visualization tools such as Tableau.
  • Ability to work with large data sets.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills with knowledge of technology tools that support this work.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills and the ability to deal with stressful situations.
  • Knowledge of data analytics, data base management, summarized data (dashboards, visualizations, trending graphs), statistical modeling and/or workflow analysis.

INSTRUCTIONS:
To apply for this job title, do NOT use the City of Chicago online application. Follow these five steps:

  • Submit to e-mail address jobs@chicagoinspectorgeneral.org;
  • In the subject line, type in the job title for which you are applying;
  • Attach your cover letter for this job title;
  • Attach your resume; and
  • Attach your transcript.

NOTE: To be considered for this position you must provide all the information listed above. If you fail to provide this information at the time you submit your application, your submission will be incomplete and you will not be considered for an interview. Application materials will only be accepted by e-mail at jobs@chicagoinspectorgeneral.org. If there is more than one open position in which you are interested, you may apply for more than one title by submitting an individual e-mail for each title. Repeat instruction steps one through six with each e-mail.

THE CITY OF CHICAGO IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY AND MILITARY FRIENDLY EMPLOYER

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. The City of Chicago does not participate in E-Verify (Employment Eligibility Verification System). In addition, employment at the Office of Inspector General is contingent upon a satisfactory criminal background check.
