title: Data Analytics or Statistics Intern

description:
b'DescriptionAlphaWise is leading the charge on data strategy and management in Morgan Stanley Research. Given the growing strategic importance of data, AlphaWise a key enabler to both the \xe2\x80\x9cOffense\xe2\x80\x9d (generating new commercial opportunities) and \xe2\x80\x9cDefense\xe2\x80\x9d (ensuring proper data use and risk management). The group is seeking a Data Analytics Analyst with experience in financial services/banking to create data related offerings. The role is dynamic, fast paced and interacts with multiple stakeholders. The Data Analytics Analyst will work closely with SMEs and product owners analyze and transform data, establish data quality standards, look for efficiencies in the business process and work with our technology partners to implement solutions:
  • Partner with product teams and quants/data scientists to create and enhance Research data products\xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze data inputs and outputs for new products, develop transformation scripts, remediate quality issues, and work collaboratively with SMEs to implement scalable data products\xe2\x80\xa2 Guide and implement strategic and tactical approaches to support data analysis activities through collaboration with technology teams\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide financial services expertise to product teams \xe2\x80\xa2 Create efficient and reusable code meant for the improvement, manipulation, and analysis of data\xe2\x80\xa2 Create and maintain standards and documentation (mapping, rulebooks, etc.)\xe2\x80\xa2 Work with off-shore team members on product development efforts
Technical Qualifications\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with using data profiling tools to query the data, identify anomalies, gaps and issues \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in Python and/or R (other modern programming languages such as Perl, JavaScript are a bonus) and statistical packages\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience configuring technical architecture to support data analysis activities\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in data quality management\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in working with data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data environments/PIG,HIVE, Impala)\xe2\x80\xa2 General awareness of data management practices, emerging trends, and issues
Required\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree from an accredited higher learning institution required or equivalent combination of experience and education (preferred area of study: Economics, Financial Engineering, Quantitative Analysis, Business, Mathematics, Computer Science or other similar fields)\xe2\x80\xa2 3-5 years experience as a data analyst, data scientist, or related quantitative \xe2\x80\xa2 2 years experience in banking/financial services\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong analytical and reasoning skills; able to decompose complex problems and projects into manageable pieces; comfortable suggesting and presenting solutions\xe2\x80\xa2 Comfortable working in a large organization with a broad set of stakeholders across various functions (i.e., Business, IT, Operations)\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent verbal and written communication skills presenting complex analytical results to technical and non-technical audiences\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability and desire to work in a start-up paced environment and culture'

title: Associate, Data Analyst

description:
b"

Description/Job Summary

Brooks Instrument is an industry leader in flow measurement and flow control products for critical applications, and a division of ITW (A Fortune 150 Company) is seeking candidates for an Quality Data Analyst. This highly visible position will be based out of our headquarters facility in Hatfield, PA (Suburban Philadelphia). In addition to our Hatfield, PA facility, Brooks maintains manufacturing locations in, Hungary, France and Japan. The Company maintains sales offices throughout the world and its products are used in laboratory and process applications in end markets such as: life sciences, chemicals, semiconductor, analytical instruments, nuclear, and solar cells.

Basic Function

Under supervision, performs a wide variety of duties to support the Quality Department. In this role, the Quality Analyst will interface with various departments to assist in the development and maintenance of the Quality System Metrics.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Maintain and collect data for tracking various Quality and Operational performance trends.
  • Write queries and prepare regular reports from the database/business system as directed.
  • Perform data analysis using MS Excel and prepare charts, pareto, histograms, etc.
  • Prepare and present analysis results/charts in Power-point/presentation format.
  • Prepare slides for regular Quality review meetings
  • Administer, maintain web-based Quality Management System program (Trackwise)
  • Write queries and prepare reports from Trackwise data.
  • Track and follow-up corrective and preventive action (CAPA), customer complaint (CC), failure analysis (FA) and similar cases in Trackwise.
  • Administer, maintain web-based Training Records management program (Traintrack).
  • Support resolution of Quality issues by working with quality and engineering teams.
  • Support completion of customer responses, CAPA forms for quality issue resolution
  • Support audit processes to identify and correct deficiencies or non-conformances
  • Support quality and/or process improvement teams when requested.
Education & Experience
  • Associate Degree or Technical Diploma/Certificate with strong data analysis skills
  • 1-2 years' experience analyzing data using Excel
  • Strong MS Excel skills required.
  • Minitab experience is helpful
  • Experience in manufacturing or test environment preferred
  • Experience in MS Office - Word, Excel, Power Point, Access
  • Attention to detail and ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment

Our employees enjoy competitive, merit-based salary plus excellent benefits including:

  • Health and dental insurance
  • Company Paid Life Insurance / Short and Long Term Disability
  • 401K plan with generous company match
  • Vacation, personal days and holidays
  • Continuing education reimbursement program
  • Flexible spending accounts

The opportunity to join a well established (70 + years in business) yet dynamically changing organization that works together as a team to meet the challenges of satisfying customers' needs and managing rapid growth to better compete in a global marketplace.

ITW Company Overview

ITW was built on innovation and the strength of new ideas. These values have helped us expand into multiple platforms in nearly 60 countries. But at each of our businesses, the independent entrepreneurial spirit and freedom to innovate remain strong. It's the highly talented people at ITW businesses all over the world who drive our success through new products and customer driven solutions. Together, we are ITW-a Fortune 150 company that has prospered for 100 years, and changed the way people live and work, all over the world.

title: Quality Data Analyst

description:
b'
Part-time, Internship

Job Description

The Transwestern family of companies together comprise a privately held, diversified real estate services, investment and development organization.

A unique approach underlies our success. We do business differently by empowering our team members with the resources and independence to deliver extraordinary results to our clients. It\xe2\x80\x99s simple. We start with hiring hard-working, smart, genuinely good people, and organize them in collaborative cross-functional teams. We give them the support to outperform and the freedom to take ownership as they work to exceed our clients\xe2\x80\x99 expectations. We do business differently, and that makes us Transwestern.

The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Transwestern research team on collecting, maintaining, and analyzing data on the commercial real estate market in the Washington/Baltimore region.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collects, inputs, and manages data in company databases and spreadsheets.
  • Ensures data quality and accuracy.
  • Tracks and updates all changes to various data points on sales, leases, construction projects, proposed projects, vacancy, and tenant movement.
  • Assists in the quarterly market statistics process, including collection and verification of data.
  • Recommends and expands the research platform including changes in methodology and products.
  • Promotes data resources to local brokers and management.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s level coursework (business, economics, statistics, or related field not required, but is preferred).
  • Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
  • Knowledge of the following programs desired, but not required: InDesign, Access, and CoStar.
  • Strong attention to detail, analytical skills, problem solving skills, and ability to process and analyze data.
  • Solid written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to multi-task, succeed under pressure, manage time and workload, and complete projects independently and collaboratively with minimal supervision and guidance.

Paid internship for the 2019 calendar year. The weekly schedule is flexible and budgeted for 10 to 15 hours per week.

LOCATION

Washington, District of Columbia

APPLY TODAY to be a part of an energetic and motivated team of professionals!

Transwestern offers an exciting work environment, competitive salary and excellent benefits, which include medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as a 401(K) plan. Transwestern is an equal opportunity employer. No agencies or phone calls please.

title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b'
Avvo is changing what it means for consumers to find professional legal help. Every year millions of people seek professional legal assistance and Avvo has profiles for nearly all 1.3 million US registered lawyers on our platform. We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst with a track record helping consumer-focused companies grow.

You are an organized self-starter with a keen business sense who loves digging into data to understand trends and performance. You have a passion for translating data into insights to find opportunities for growth and can effectively communicate them internally.

You are a creative thinker who can recommend, plan, and execute an analytical approach that results in actionable business improvements. You\xe2\x80\x99re also a great teammate who likes a rapidly changing environment and wants to join a company that offers a ton of opportunity to build your skills.

In this role, you will:
  • Serve as a subject matter expert and mentor around data analysis and related best practices to business partners.
  • Provide guidance, mentorship, and technical expertise to a junior analyst.
  • Collaborate with agile engineering teams to design flexible solutions to support analytic needs.
  • Produce recommendations and insights for key partners that will help shape business decisions.
  • Apply a broad range of analytical approaches, from back-of-envelope approximations, to what-if scenarios, to deep dives, uncovering patterns in order to identify trends and new opportunities.
  • Develop visualizations and other methods for conveying key insights and reports.
  • Deliver presentations to senior leadership, including C-level executives, to explain and illustrate complex analytical findings.
  • Simplify and automate reporting, audits, and other data-driven activities; build solutions to have maximum scale and self-service ability by partners.
  • Support the business with time-critical data analyses.

Required Qualifications:
  • 2+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in a hands-on analytical role with a focus on analyzing business problems.
  • Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Highly proficient in tools used for data analysis and reporting (SQL, Excel).
  • Ability to communicate complex quantitative analyses and business needs in a clear, precise, and actionable manner to diverse audiences.
  • Strong Communication skills, able to simplify complex topics for a variety of audiences and present in person as well as virtually.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience with web analytics.
  • Experience with data modeling and KPI definition.
  • Experience working with Marketing, Product and Sales teams.

Success starts with having the right people. At Internet Brands, we value and mentor each member of our growing team. We seek out talented, goal-oriented professionals who live and breathe the Internet and thrive in a flexible but challenging work environment. Our team of innovators has enabled Internet Brands to sustain high levels of profitability and success while evolving along with the Internet for over 20 years.

At IB, we promote an entrepreneurial, friendly culture that applauds innovation and results while embracing change and independence. Our employees are intensely driven and constantly encouraged to reach higher and use creativity to achieve success \xe2\x80\x93 all the while enjoying high levels of collaboration and the luxury of coming to work in jeans and sneakers. We are proud to offer a unique blend of the innovation of a start-up with the history, stability, and benefits of an established corporation.

Internet Brands and its wholly owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
Contract
Job Description

Job Summary

This is an insight generating role for an experienced data analyst. You will conduct robust analysis, create innovative data visualizations and design, improve and manage the data collection and tracking system. Under the supervision of the Director of Impact & Evaluation, the Data Analyst will provide business analysis expertise to help St. Joseph Center manage various information systems and measure program effectiveness to help us better serve our target population. You will have experience in SQL and be an integral part in bringing thorough analysis to our decision-making process.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Key Areas of Responsibility & Essential Duties:

  • Conduct data analysis to generate insight and measure agency and program effectiveness.
  • Create data models and compelling visualizations that depict agency and program wide outcomes and trends.
  • Monitor and improve key performance indicators (KPIs) to aid in decision making and overall strategy.
  • Build and manage an interactive dashboard through Tableau.
  • Create and improve the data collection, management and analysis process.
  • Support in drafting a monthly outcome report.
  • Help ensure that data development is in compliance with grant requirements.
  • Support with identifying data sources, calculating baselines, setting targets, benchmark goals, etc.
  • Ensure data collection and reporting methods are accurate, effective and efficient.
  • Work with programs to ensure data collection and monitoring practices are understood and in compliance with contractual requirements.
  • Support in designing and assisting with program evaluations.
  • Maintain knowledge on current HUD data elements and requirements.

Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned. The duties and responsibilities listed are designed to provide typical examples of the work performed; not all duties and responsibilities assigned are included here, nor is it expected that all similar positions will be assigned every duty and responsibility.


Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Excellent data analysis skills
  • Proficiency in SQL, including ability to write queries
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Fluent in Excel and creating data visualizations
  • Experience with creating dashboards, preferably in Tableau
  • The ability to make recommendations on database software and work with IT for implementation
  • Knowledge of both qualitative and quantitative research and analysis tools
  • Proficient in data modeling and presentation
  • Strong commitment to applying numerical data KPIs to achieve enhanced performance
  • Ability to generate key insights and perspectives from data sets and outcomes
  • Ability to recommend course corrections and actions based on findings

Experience:

  • Two-plus years running data analysis and reporting in an insight-generating role
  • Experience working with HMIS/EHR systems, i.e. Service Point; Clarity; Exym; CHAMP; Zoho; AWARDS (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited college or university, preferably in a math, science, or related field. Will consider equivalent work experience.

Direct Reports:

  • This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

Computer Skills:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Programs (Word, Excel, Access, Powerpoint)
  • Ability to use widely supported internet browsers.

Certificates, Licenses and Registrations:

  • Valid California Class C Driver License or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions.
  • Valid automobile liability insurance.

Additional Information

Status: Full-Time/Exempt

Salary: DOE

Employment with St. Joseph Center is contingent on completion of satisfactory background check.

St. Joseph Center endorses and supports the intent of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA) and the California Fair Employment and Housing Act (FEHA) and is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities who are applicants or employees who need accommodations. If you require an accommodation due to a disability to complete this application OR you are experiencing issues submitting your application and accompanying materials please contact Human Resources at 310-396-6468.

For consideration, please submit cover letter and resume. St. Joseph Center is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. All applicants for employment are invited to voluntarily self-identify their gender, race, ethnicity, and veteran status, by completing the EEO Information. Providing your EEO Information is voluntary and refusal to self-identify will not subject applicants to any adverse treatment. Similarly, applicants who do self-identify will not be subject to any adverse treatment based on the information they provide.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

A few benefits of working for Ayima:

Competitive Salary

Health and Dental care package

25 days paid vacation + we close for a week in December

Summer Fridays \xe2\x80\x93 get out early and enjoy the New York sun while its here

A relaxed and welcoming work environment

Opportunities for travel, conferences, training, and career growth

Flexible hours

The Role

Junior Data Analyst (Web)

We are looking for someone with a passion for the internet, technology, web analytics and digital marketing to join our New York team. We will train you on advanced analytics and search engine optimization and immerse you deep into exciting client projects while supporting your growth and learning.

What are we looking for?

We can teach digital marketing and advanced Search Engine Optimization so we look for the skills that we cannot teach. Motivation, passion, determination and attention to detail are key skills. But the following are also highly sought after:

  • A love of data and digital marketing
  • Ability to code / script / understanding of HTML
  • Great Sense of humor and ability to fill a room with energy
  • Self Confidence / ability to speak
  • Self Starter / Self Learning / Knowledge Sharer
  • Initiative

What will you be doing?

  • Analyzing client websites
  • Client reporting using Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics and Ayima\xe2\x80\x99s in-house tools.
  • Developing client presentation skills
  • Gaining valuable experience working on some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s biggest brands and training to become an effective data analyst

Skills

  • Experience with Google Analytics and or Adobe Analytics (Omniture SiteCatalyst)
  • Basic knowledge of UTM parameters and website tracking

title: Master Data Analyst

description:
b'

Analytics & Cognitive \xe2\x80\x93 Project Delivery Specialist \xe2\x80\x93 Big Data Analyst/SQL Developer -USDC


Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology \xe2\x80\x93 a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center \xe2\x80\x93 we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.


Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below \xe2\x80\xa6


Qualifications

Required

  • Advanced knowledge of SQL/Hive

Preferred

Additional Requirements:

How you\xe2\x80\x99ll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there\xe2\x80\x99s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.


Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.

Deloitte\xe2\x80\x99s culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives.


Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte\xe2\x80\x99s impact on the world.


Recruiter tips

To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you\xe2\x80\x99re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

title: Big Data Analyst/SQL Developer

description:
b'

Data Sciences International (DSI) provides a complete preclinical platform to assess physiological data for a variety of research projects. DSI is the leading provider of telemetry systems, pulmonary solutions, associated software platforms, and services. Our technology is used for preclinical research allowing scientists to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of treatments before they move on to clinical trials. Ultimately, the knowledge gained using DSI technology helps improve human lives.

At DSI the working environment is focused on excellence in everything we do and the basic values of inspiration, innovation, and integrity. Information is openly shared and political behavior found in many other organizations is shunned. Success is also shared. DSI is proud of its employees. This is why we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits program.

A DAY IN THE LIFE AS A DATA ANALYST

As a Data Analyst, you provide the Executive Leadership Team and sales/marketing with the information and insights to make better decisions and grow revenue. This position will be responsible for extracting, manipulating and presenting large amounts of data from our customer facing systems, and other available data sources, in order to provide actionable and data driven recommendations.

QUALIFICATIONS

Skills and Abilities Required:

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, including experience in data modeling, analysis, and visualization
  • Strong background and knowledge of Customer Relationship Management, Sales Automation, Content/Website and Enterprise Resource Management systems
  • Strong technology and systems background including Excel, databases, Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) tools, etc.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills with all levels of the company, including team members and leadership
  • Ability to work under minimal supervision with wide latitude for independent judgment

Bonus Skills & Experience:

  • Experience with Microsoft CRM, MS SQL Server Reporting/Analysis, Power BI
  • Passionate learner with a desire to stay current with analytics technologies and best practices
  • Professional certification such as CBAP, PBA, CMA, etc.

title: Data Analyst - Sales/Marketing

description:
b'
Business Insights Data Analyst - (00011236)
Description
Summary Description: This position focuses on analyzing online & offline data sets that inform and improve the effectiveness of the planning, execution and optimization of advanced analytics and research. This position acquires data from primary or secondary data sources and maintains database systems. This position develops a thorough understanding of our data environment and uses enterprise tools to extract and manipulate data from operational databases for ad hoc or on-going, periodic reporting and analyses. This position takes a systematic and meticulous approach in analyzing diverse data sets that yield useful business insights and actionable recommendations.

Responsibilities:


  • Gathers relevant research data in support of the analytics team and all Business Segment efforts to provide in-depth analyses.
  • Utilizes advanced data mining techniques to solve for various algorithmic problems. Generates new solutions leveraging skills and knowledge. Manages and maintains existing solutions.
  • Reviews, analyzes and presents qualitative and quantitative analyses and data to business partners.
  • Extracts, analyzes, and applies data-mining and machine learning techniques to large structured and unstructured datasets
  • Designs and analyzes experiments to test new features & products
  • Works with product managers, designers, and engineers to build new data warehouse structures, features, and products
  • Identifies gaps in the data-capture strategy and implements enhancements across the organization
  • Establishes scalable, efficient, and automated processes for large scale data analyses, and model developments, validations, and implementations
  • Collaborates across the organization to generate ideas and strategies based on data-driven insights and recommendations
  • Participates in the data ingestion process from source to Hadoop and other platforms.
  • Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned

Qualifications
Education:
  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent work experience required with emphasis in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance or Quantitative Research
  • Advanced degree in a quantitative field preferred (business, math, economics, finance, statistics, science, engineering)

Experience:
  • Experience in contributing to the management of projects is preferred
  • Proven ability to perform in-depth analysis using diversified and complex data sets, compile and interpret results
  • 2+ years structuring and querying data in SQL databases
  • 2+ years of experience with data modeling, ETL, and reporting tools
  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis with 2+ years focused on web analytics tools (SiteCatalyst / Google Analytics)
  • Prior experience working with the web technology stack (Python, HTML, JavaScript, C++, Perl, Rudy, C#, API programming)
  • 1+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience preferably in restaurant industry

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Proficiency in MS Office Word, Excel, Outlook, Power Point and Visio (as applicable)
  • Proficiency in JD Edwards (as applicable)
  • Displays an aptitude for continuous learning and leadership potential
  • Ability to communicate well with the general public and experience in establishing and maintaining an effective working relationship with management, vendors, and co-workers
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • dvanced professional or theoretical knowledge and fundamental concepts, practices and procedures of a particular field of specialization in the execution of assigned duties and responsibilities
  • Basic understanding of budgetary concepts and procedures
  • Advanced understanding of departmental structure and policies with basic understanding of the cross-functional structure and policies of Whataburger Restaurants LLC
  • Advanced ability to delegate tasks and get work done through others
  • Ability to prepare and present information to guests, more senior associates, vendors and management

Working Conditions/Travel Requirements:
  • Expected to work the necessary time to satisfactorily fulfill job responsibilities
  • Must be able to report to work timely and as required by operational/business needs
  • Must be able to work a full-time schedule and work outside of normal business hours when necessary
  • Must be able to travel occasionally both locally and long distances (including air travel), to worksites, meeting sites, and other locations
  • Must possess a valid driver\xe2\x80\x99s license, submit to releasing a Motor Vehicle Record that adheres to the Whataburger standards and maintain current automobile liability at minimum levels in their state of residence

Work Locations: 300 CONCORD PLAZA DR 300 CONCORD PLAZA DR SAN ANTONIO 78216-6903

title: Business Insights Data Analyst

description:
b'

The Neuroimaging Data Analyst Junior provides support for managing and analyzing data. Responsibilities will include managing and cleaning data, querying databases to create reports and determine the accuracy of data entered; exporting/importing data between different sources; writing and editing existing code to organize data for analyses; assisting with basic statistical analyses using R and other tools; checking incoming neuroimaging data for completeness and accuracy and processing it with available scripts; communicating with other researchers to obtain missing information; and writing technical and user documentation. The successful candidate will need to develop a good understanding of neuroimaging methods and hypothesis described by various funded imaging grants in the Lab. Additional responsibilities will be assigned based on the successful candidate\xe2\x80\x99s skills and interests. Opportunities for participating in publication or presentation of data are available. Position contingent of funding.

Qualifications

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with major in Psychology, Statistics, Computer Science or related field, and 0 to 1 year of experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience required. Experience in biomedical or psychological research or data management preferred. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Experience with linux/unix/bash scripting is preferred; extensive knowledge of tools useful in manipulating and converting data; facility with numbers and meticulous attention to detail; experience with statistics and statistical programming (R preferred); programming experience with one or more general-purpose programming languages preferred; capacity for learning new technical skills independently; experience with neuroimaging tools (SPM, AFNI, FSL) preferred.

Affirmative Action Statement

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"

Summary

Posted: Mar 21, 2019
Role Number: 200046821
At Apple, new ideas become great products, services, and customer experiences. Apple is seeking a Core Data - data analyst/ data architect to join the Apple Media Products Analytics and Data Products group. AMP (home to Apple Music, App Store, iTunes and more) has some of the most compelling data in the world. We seek a hardworking data analyst with experience in building pipelines, who is motivated by meaningful problems and well versed with big data environment. This is a unique opportunity to join a focused team and work collaboratively with other groups to make a significant impact.
Key Qualifications
  • You have 4+ years crafting and building data pipelines
  • At least 8+ years of SQL experience with the ability to write ad-hoc and complex queries to perform data analysis
  • You possess strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
  • Relevant and substantial work experience with business requirements definition and management (end to end), structured analysis, process design, use case documentation, UML process and use case definition
  • At least 2+ years of Spark SQL, Linux, Hadoop experience
  • 2+ years of experience in data modeling (conceptual, logical models)
  • You have solid grasp of advanced data warehouse concepts (Factless Fact tables, Temporal \ BI-Temporal models, etc.)
  • Experience with both Waterfall and Agile development methodologies
  • You have ability to identify where focus is needed and bring clarity to business objectives, requirements and priorities
  • You have strong facilitation and communication skills (both verbal and written). Capable of collaborating effectively across a variety of Engineering and Data analyst groups
  • Overall technical understanding of data warehousing, business intelligence, web and other multi-tiered, distributed applications/systems.
Description
As a member of the Core Data team, you will have significant responsibility and influence in shaping the future of core data landscape. This role is inherently cross-functional and the ideal candidate will work across disciplines. We are looking for someone with a love for data and ability to iterate quickly through capturing data needs from the partners, analyzing source data and data needs, creating data models and working in close collaboration with engineering, QA, analysts to deliver core datasets that support data integration, analytics and reporting. Successful candidates will have strong analytical skills and communication, as well as, a belief that data driven processes lead to great products. Key Responsibilities: Capture and manage business data needs from various stakeholders Develop data models (conceptual, logical) in support of integrated analytics, business reporting and data exchange Perform data profiling on source system data to ensure that source system data can be integrated and represented properly in our models Assist downstream consumers and report developers, analysts with best usage of the models Partner with Engineering and EPMs to develop core datasets as per the specification (includes data model definitions) Provide assistance and guidance during the QA phase to quickly confirm the validity of potential issues and to determine the root cause and best resolution of verified issues Perform UAT to confirm core datasets satisfy the business needs Partner with EPMs to review projects status, risks and enable mitigation plans
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Information Systems.
"
title: Core Data - Data Analyst/ Data Architect

description:
b'
Contract

Company Overview:

Critical Signal Technologies, Inc. (CST) is a health services company with an innovative approach to remote patient monitoring. CST helps patients live independently, avoid unnecessary hospital visits, manage chronic conditions, and coordinate care. CST has turnkey solutions to increase patient engagement and improve outcomes. The number one priority of the entire team at CST is facilitating an ideal patient experience. CST utilizes customized monitoring protocols built around individual care plans and needs. As a B2B provider, CST has active partnerships in place with some of the most elite health plans, health systems, and post-acute care organizations throughout the United States.

Mission Statement: Critical Signal Technologies is a Health Services Company committed to offering innovative, cost-effective patient monitoring strategies for homes, hospitals, and senior independent facilities in the U.S. and Abroad. We seek to empower and support older adults, people with disabilities, and those battling chronic illness to live independently, with dignity. We aim to make person-centered care scalable and sustainable for all the healthcare stakeholders.

Description:

The Junior Data Analyst is responsible for generating/maintaining reports and providing the Information Systems department with technical and administrative support. The entry level role will be primarily responsible for making changes and updates to internal and external reports, as well as developing new reports and data processes based on requests received.

This position also requires frequent interaction and collaboration with non-technical users, ranging from front-line staff to executive level management, to develop and maintain meaningful reporting according to business needs.

Required Qualifications:

  • Proficiency in SQL and understanding of RDBMS principles, especially Sybase or Microsoft SQL Server
  • Experience using Crystal Reports, Power BI, or other business intelligence programs
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel
  • Ability to analyze and interpret large datasets
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent organization skills and the ability to manage/prioritize multiple assigned tasks
  • Attention to detail
  • Effective in translating complex business needs into technical specifications, while also conveying capabilities and limitations to non-technical users
  • Ability to work from headquarters in Novi, MI

Desired Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of ETL and data warehouse design methods
  • Knowledge of query tuning and optimization best practices
  • Experience developing stored procedures/triggers and enforcing data integrity constraints
  • Efficiency in data modeling and linking datasets across disparate sources

**This is a 6-month contract position with the ability to become full-time at the end of the contracted term.


CST practices equal opportunity employment with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, training, and all other terms and conditions of employment. CST does not discriminate against nor make decisions based on an individual\xe2\x80\x99s race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, gender identity, results of genetic testing, or service in the military.

Job Summary:
As the Data Analyst, you will provide insights regarding clients, competitors, and financial markets to support business decisions. Ideal candidates have experience organizing, manipulating, and interpreting data with the ability to draw actionable conclusions to benefit end-users from different business units within the firm (investment, client service, operations, and marketing/sales professionals). Some of our practices include: \xe2\x80\xa2 Program/Project Management and "PMO as a Service" \xe2\x80\xa2 IT Assessments \xe2\x80\xa2 Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery \xe2\x80\xa2 Optimized Infrastructure \xe2\x80\xa2 Concierge Managed Services \xe2\x80\xa2 Data Center Strategy, Transformation, and Migration \xe2\x80\xa2 Cloud Management Programs \xe2\x80\xa2 Security Assessments and Remediation \xe2\x80\xa2 Staffing, technical & tactical Working with the client\xe2\x80\x99s staff, vendors, and consultants, we deliver supportive and collaborative engagements where direct dialog, simplified reporting, productive meetings, and clear responsibility and accountability encourage active participation resulting in consensus-based business outcomes.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

General Dynamics Information Technology (GDIT) delivers cost-effective, next-generation IT solutions and services to the Department of Defense, the intelligence community and federal civilian agencies as they modernize their information systems. GDIT is hiring a Data Analyst to provide data management, analytic, and visualization support for our program with Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC); the Center for Global Health. This position is located in Washington, DC. As part of the inter-agency collaboration established by the President\xe2\x80\x99s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR); CDC\xe2\x80\x99s Division of Global HIV and Tuberculosis (DGHT), the Health Informatics Data Management and Statistics Branch (HIDMSB) has been entrusted with stewardship of PEPFAR data and analytics to monitor the impact of HIV programs and services and inform future investment strategies. Global HIV/AIDS organizations such as the World Health Organization (WHO) and the United Nations also rely on these data for planning and decision-making. The Inter-agency Collaborative for Program Improvement (ICPI) operates in a continuous learning process, focusing not just on analytics, but also working to engage PEPFAR stakeholders in analysis and data use. ICPI is partnering with GDIT, to navigate multiple challenges that could impact the timeliness, completeness, and quality of PEPFAR data and analytics.

In this environment, team members support key processes in the development and functionality in PEPFAR data systems; provide support in data access, processing, and management from multiple data sources (e.g., programmatic, financial, and data from related surveys and surveillance activities); develop analytic data sets, create analytic and visualization tools including interactive dashboards; support training and capacity building; and provide technical assistance to PEPFAR US Government field staff. Those with prior experience working with CDC, PEPFAR, and/or global health NGOs are encouraged to apply as well as those with global health work set outside of the United States. Candidates must be comfortable and experienced with data management and data analysis of data from different sources and formats including the compilation of large amounts of data.

Position is for full time employment with GDIT and will work from the customer\xe2\x80\x99s office in downtown DC (metro accessible on the Orange or Blue line to Farragut West and then walk two blocks to the building).

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide technical assistance in data management, analysis, and visualizations to DGHT headquarters and field staff.
  • Develop and deploy tools in R and Shiny to enhance the use of program improvement in the field.
  • Develop dashboards in R Shiny and MS Excel
  • Produce technical reports/presentations and/or manuscripts using programmatic data.
  • Conduct training on ICPI developed tools.
  • Develop methods, processes, or checks to assess and improve the quality of PEPFAR data across the data life cycle from reporting, entry, access, extraction, and use
  • Improve the efficiency and fidelity with which data are accessed, managed and wrangled, from various data systems used by PEPFAR.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Required Skills and Experience -

  • Bachelors degree and 3+ years experience, MS and/or MPH degree preferred
  • Proficient /Expert in MS Excel
  • Experience with SAS, R, and SQL programming
  • Understanding of principles and applications in data management including development of data validation processes
  • Experience in data analysis including: quantitative analytics, expertise in all phases of statistical analysis, data visualizations, GIS mapping, and/or predictive modeling
  • Experience with all or some aspects of the development of technical guidance to improve use of analytic tools and step-wise procedures for reviewing data quality, access, and use of monitoring and evaluation data
  • Must be able to travel internationally if needed.

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Experience working with HIV/AIDs data (Global HIV/AIDS experience preferred)
  • Experience in Stata, R and/or Shiny is preferred
  • Experience using MicroStrategy, Socrata, and/or Tableau is preferred
  • Experience using GIS applications and basic knowledge of mapping principles is preferred
  • Experience with data visualization and/or Spatial Analysis
  • Hands on experience with developing and sharing data collection, management, and analysis techniques including best practices

ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:

  • Good oral and written communication skills to effectively communicate assignments and requests
  • Good interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively as a team member
  • Ability to multitask and effectively manage multiple priorities that are subject to change
  • Must be detail-oriented and possess critical thinking skills
  • Must be comfortable and effective working with diverse audiences including technical staff, international staff, and others
  • Collaborate with other analysts, statisticians and subject matter experts to develop joint analysis and communicate findings to different stakeholders
  • General knowledge of software and product development processes

As a trusted systems integrator for more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology provides information technology (IT), systems engineering, professional services and simulation and training to customers in the defense, federal civilian government, health, homeland security, intelligence, state and local government and commercial sectors. With approximately 32,000 professionals worldwide, the company delivers IT enterprise solutions, manages large-scale, mission-critical IT programs and provides mission support services. GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

'
title: Data Analyst - Global Health

description:
b'

Gateway Blend is a St. Louis based online publisher that maintains a portfolio of sites with millions of readers each month. We are looking for a Data Analyst to maintain data integrity within our MySQL databases, conduct analyses on web analytics data, and fulfill requests for report creation and ad hoc analysis. The ideal candidate needs to be extremely detail-oriented, organized, and is driven to continually learn about the internet industry and how each piece of our company works with the other.


This position is based out of our Clayton, Missouri office and has a standard 40 hour work schedule.

Responsibilities:

  • Interpreting data, creating well thought out analyses, and presenting findings to your peers and leadership

  • Maintaining the integrity of our databases and working with our developers to troubleshoot any issue/inconsistencies that arise

  • Developing processes to improve workflow efficiency internally (Data Analytics) and externally (other teams, acting as a shared resource)

  • Gathering requirements for analysis and report creation from project stakeholders


Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in an analytical field, or equitable experience in a data-focused role

  • Experience with spreadsheet software, such as Google Sheets/Excel

  • Interest in digital advertising, social media, and large amounts of data

  • Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment

  • Self starter, eager to learn new concepts, and an out-of-the-box thinker

  • Strong written and oral communications skills

  • Extremely well organized and high level of attention to detail


Preferred, But Not Required:

  • Knowledge of MySQL, Python/R, Google Analytics, or similar

  • Experience/education in statistical analysis concepts/strong problem solving skills

  • Some familiarity with JIRA and/or Trello

At Gateway Blend, we value diversity and the uniqueness of all people. We thrive in an inclusive environment, and we recruit, hire and promote without regard to race, gender, age, color, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, religion, sexual preference, military or veteran status, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability \xe2\x80\x93 or any other legally protected categories as set forth in the applicable state, federal or local laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment including training, compensation, benefits and all other privileges of employment.

title: Internship - Data Analyst - Summer 2019

description:
b'
This job involves a depth of understanding of all Lilly sales and marketing databases as well as an understanding of the available third party data sources needed for core analytic processes. This position will be responsible for analytic data processing, integration and maintenance and will support data needs of US internal analytics team, analytic vendors, and marketing brand teams. This position will liaison with internal functions (statisticians, IT, sales reporting, market research, operations, brand teams) and suppliers to ensure consistency in data definitions and data utilization for core analytic processes across the US affiliate. Additional responsibility includes ensuring supplier and Lilly Analytics team access and confidentiality to Lilly data and defining and applying standard business rules for consistent use in all internal and supplier analysis.

Key Objectives:
This position will oversee:

  • Stewardship and integration of data in Customer 360, serving as a liaison between business and analytics teams

  • Partner with IT, sales reporting, market research, and external data vendors to ensure quality in data availability and provide appropriate data access

Company Overview

At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 39,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

Basic Qualifications

  • Minimum of 2 years of strong experience with SAS and SQL
Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Lilly does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B or TN status) for this employment position.

Additional Information

Additional Skills/Preferences

  • Six Sigma (black or green belt) experience

title: Intern - Data Analyst Community Engagement

description:
b"
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let\xe2\x80\x99s move the world forward, together.
About the Role

The Data Analyst on the Community Operations (CommOps) Global Strategy & Planning (S&P) team is an analytical and technical problem solver, who is able to dive into unstructured environments to design solutions. You will drive analyses behind company-wide decisions related to our community's support experience; and build scalable processes and systems that enable internal and external stakeholders to leverage data and act upon insights. You will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of high-priority projects, and have exposure to multiple stakeholders within (Operations, Product and Engineering) and outside Uber (support agents, customers).
What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do

  • Drive analysis on global projects to improve the experience of our customers and support agents
  • Build and own periodic reporting - Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at our fingertips to help stakeholders all over the world manage and improve our operations
  • Problem solve. We\xe2\x80\x99re faced with new and interesting problems that need solved every single day. Identify and implement short-term solutions in a timely manner, while helping define the long-term solution.
  • Act as a global POC between CommOps analysts and Product / Data Engineering teams, to ensure CommOps data needs are met
  • Identify operational weaknesses and help improve or innovate new processes to keep local teams as efficient as possible
  • Analyze advanced A/B testing data (exposure to experimental design is a plus)

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Need
  • Minimum 2 year of professional experience with analytics, business intelligence, management consulting, investment banking

About the Team
The Global S&P Analytics & Insights (A&I) team is the central A&I team for CommOps at Uber. We have three broad purposes - (1) Own Uber's support data integrity and quality, and metrics definitions and reporting, (2) Inform CommOps leadership\xe2\x80\x99s priorities by generating high-value analytical insights, (3) Support other global teams' A&I needs. Our projects are typically broad in scope, which means there is tremendous opportunity to make a huge impact on the business.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Position Announcement


Data Analyst






About Second Harvest Food Bank
Based in Silicon Valley, Second Harvest Food Bank of Santa Clara and San Mateo Counties is one of the largest
food banks in the nation. Currently providing food to an average of 260,000 people every month, Second
Harvest is a trusted community-based organization that was founded in 1974. Despite the immense wealth in
Silicon Valley, and partly due to the high cost of living, hunger and malnutrition are pervasive. The Food Bank
distributes nutritious food, including more fresh produce than almost any other food bank in the country,
through a network of 309 nonprofit partners at 985 sites. Second Harvest is pursuing innovative efforts to
increase access to food resources as it seeks to feed more hungry people each month. To reach more people, it
advocates for anti-hunger policies and connects those in need to federal nutrition programs and other food
resources. To learn more about how Second Harvest is building a hunger-free community, visit SHFB.org.

About the Position
Second Harvest is looking for a highly motivated, energetic, and organized Data Analyst who is excited about
using their skills to help end hunger in our community. In this new role at the food bank, the Data Analyst will be
in on the ground floor on important food bank projects, helping to define research and data use to help us to
reach new clients and better serve existing clients. The person in this position will analyze data from many
different sources, using their expertise to work with the Client Marketing Manager and Evaluation Manager to
find actionable insights. The Data Analyst must have a growth mindset, enjoy problem solving, be willing to roll
up their sleeves and dig into the details, and be comfortable with ambiguity. The role requires a self-starter who
will enjoy being part of a dynamic team.

If selected for this position, you will be responsible for:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Translating ideas and questions into hypothesis or experiments
  • Gathering and mapping data which enables analysis
  • Creating reports that track performance and enable interpretation of data
  • Deriving meaningful insights from data that enable the team to understand the progress of specific
initiatives and drive program improvement.
  • Developing analytics that further our understanding of user segments and user needs.
  • Assisting with the evaluation and implementation of data collection and storage systems

Qualifications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or higher in Mathematics, Business Management, Economics, information or decision science,
public policy or related fields.
  • One-two years of data analyst experience, knowledge, or similar work experience preferred
  • Experience with Geographic Information Systems (GIS), SQL, Tableau, Salesforce preferred
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity preparing and analyzing data using open source solutions (SQL, R, Python, etc) to produce descriptive
and summary statistics for monitoring and reporting purposes. Some knowledge of predictive analytics preferred.
  • Ability to use visualization tools (Excel, GIS, Tableau, R, etc) to present data in clear and impactful ways
  • Must be willing/able to take on tasks with minimal supervision
  • Excellent organizational skills and detail oriented
  • Ability to collaborate with functionally diverse teams

  • Excellent communication skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate ideas clearly - orally and in writing.
  • Eagerness to learn


Reports To: Client Marketing Manager
Location: 750 Curtner Ave, San Jose, CA 95125
Hours: Full-Time, Exempt. Regular schedule with occasional weekends and

evenings.
Compensation: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Generous health

benefits, Flexible Time Off (FTO) starting at 200 hours/year, ten paid
holidays, and excellent retirement savings plan

EOE

UNDER-REPRESENTED GROUPS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
Description
Position Background:
You already know Staples for our stores. What you might not know is that we are the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest business products delivery company as well, serving everything from the 10-person office up to and including the Fortune 500 companies. As the B2B division of Staples, Staples Business Advantage works with companies to develop customized programs with specialized pricing, dedicated account management and a complete assortment of products and services at the lowest total delivered cost. Our commitment to serving customers is embodied in our brand promise: \xe2\x80\x9cWe help businesses succeed.\xe2\x80\x9d
The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for using internal data to develop reporting and provide actionable insights to leadership. They will analyze ROI on key initiatives/incentives and help provide guidance on impact and future initiatives. This role resides on the Pricing team Supporting Staples\xe2\x80\x99s Commercial and Enterprise portfolio.

We are looking for someone who is energized to make a difference and enjoys a role where they can be innovative and entrepreneurial. The Senior Data Analyst will be expected to connect information to compile recommendations. He/She will create new analyses that are proactive to drive more sales and efficiency.
The Senior Data Analyst will work independently with minimal direction/supervision while handling tight deadlines and rapid paced changing assignments.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of Pricing strategies
  • Develop applications to implement solutions in the areas of Forecasting, Pricing Operations/Optimization, and Customer Segmentation
  • Develop methodology and reporting that provide insight into the SBA C&E business
  • Coordinate strategic projects for the SBA C&E division driving major Corporate initiatives
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Recommend scalable solutions and potential system enhancements based on deep understanding of system functionality & limitations

Qualifications
Requirements:

Staples Inc. is a market-leading provider of products and services for the workplace enabling better work solutions that deliver industry-leading products, services and expertise across office supplies, facilities, breakroom, furniture, technology, promotional products, and print and marketing services. We support businesses of all sizes from solopreneurs to the Fortune 100 and everything in between providing exceptional quality and value across multiple channels, including direct sales, ecommerce, mobile, and retail.
Staples is a private company backed by Sycamore Partners composed of 3 standalone companies totaling $17B in revenue including: Staples North American Delivery, Staples Retail, and Staples Canada.



Staples is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Associate Data Scientist

description:
b'About the Job:
LiveIntent is looking for a Data Analyst to join our tightly knit Analytics team. The analytics team is responsible for all analytics, experimentation, and reporting within the organization. The primary focus of the team is on communicating business insights intra-company and assisting with business and product strategy development.

You will be working closely with stakeholders across the organization to help them align their product direction against measurable KPIs and assist them in communicating those results back to the entire company. This position will contain exposure to all levels of the business and the ability to manipulate true "big data" at all stages of our data pipeline.

Responsibilities:
  • Continually work with various teams to develop relevant KPIs and dashboards for them to monitor and explore relevant metrics.
  • Utilize SQL and possibly R to analyze data from our various DBs and sources. This includes Redshift, BigQuery, and Athena, along with others.
  • Interact daily with clean and raw datasets on the scale of KBs to TBs.
  • Perform ad-hoc analyses and data requests as relates to our European offices.
Qualifications:
  • You have 2+ years' experience in product or business analytics or relevant degree.
  • You possess a strong foundation in SQL with intermediate knowledge of statistical analytics (hypothesis testing, modeling)
  • You are comfortable communicating a business perspective to a technical environment and, inversely, translating technical requirements into terms business stakeholders can understand.
  • You prefer working independently and are comfortable with loosely defined problems.
  • You enjoy communicating and presenting findings to stakeholders at all levels.
  • You are familiar with Looker/LookML (familiarity with R a plus)
  • You are comfortable working in English.
We support employee health and wellness by providing:
  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage
  • Healthy daily snacks and beverages on tap
  • Family-friendly environment with work/life balance
  • Summer Fridays (head out early to enjoy the great weather!)
  • Weekly in-office Yoga and Pilates classes
  • Subsidized gym membership
  • LiveIntent sports teams (softball, flag football, soccer etc)
  • Paid Maternity and Paternity leave
We support diversity and growth within the company with programs and initiatives such as:

  • Bi-annual performance and compensation review process
  • Monthly "Women with Intent" meetings
  • Book Club focused on reading and discussing career development-focused content
  • Lunch and Learns with diverse speakers
  • Opportunities to attend industry conferences
  • Access to professional development courses through LinkedIn Learning and Coursera
  • Annual global offsite week focused on team-building, training and employee recognition
About LiveIntent:
LiveIntent is a people-based marketing technology platform changing the way +2000 of the world's largest Brands and Publishers think about email.

The LiveIntent platform transforms email from something you send and receive into the simplest, most powerful way to resolve identity and market to people in a mobile-first world. It becomes your superpower, generating a private customer graph that can augment everything from acquisition to attribution while driving incremental product sales and revenue.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
Part-time, Internship

Job Description

The Transwestern family of companies together comprise a privately held, diversified real estate services, investment and development organization.

A unique approach underlies our success. We do business differently by empowering our team members with the resources and independence to deliver extraordinary results to our clients. It\xe2\x80\x99s simple. We start with hiring hard-working, smart, genuinely good people, and organize them in collaborative cross-functional teams. We give them the support to outperform and the freedom to take ownership as they work to exceed our clients\xe2\x80\x99 expectations. We do business differently, and that makes us Transwestern.

The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Transwestern research team on collecting, maintaining, and analyzing data on the commercial real estate market in the Washington/Baltimore region.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collects, inputs, and manages data in company databases and spreadsheets.
  • Ensures data quality and accuracy.
  • Tracks and updates all changes to various data points on sales, leases, construction projects, proposed projects, vacancy, and tenant movement.
  • Assists in the quarterly market statistics process, including collection and verification of data.
  • Recommends and expands the research platform including changes in methodology and products.
  • Promotes data resources to local brokers and management.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s level coursework (business, economics, statistics, or related field not required, but is preferred).
  • Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
  • Knowledge of the following programs desired, but not required: InDesign, Access, and CoStar.
  • Strong attention to detail, analytical skills, problem solving skills, and ability to process and analyze data.
  • Solid written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to multi-task, succeed under pressure, manage time and workload, and complete projects independently and collaboratively with minimal supervision and guidance.

Paid internship for the 2019 calendar year. The weekly schedule is flexible and budgeted for 10 to 15 hours per week.

LOCATION

Washington, District of Columbia

APPLY TODAY to be a part of an energetic and motivated team of professionals!

Transwestern offers an exciting work environment, competitive salary and excellent benefits, which include medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as a 401(K) plan. Transwestern is an equal opportunity employer. No agencies or phone calls please.

title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b"

About Us:

Located in beautiful Santa Barbara, HG Insights is a growing data services company, delivering key insights to sales and marketing departments. We're powered by a group of highly intelligent developers and data scientists with a mandate of having the largest technology install database in the world.

We offer a competitive salary, 401K, growth potential, great benefits and a casual yet professional environment. Get your sweat on at one of our fitness classes or go for a run along the beach which is two blocks away. You can find employees riding bikes to lunch in the funk zone or hanging out in one of our collaboration spaces. We are passionate about our jobs with a get-it-done attitude, yet we don't take ourselves too seriously. While we work very hard, you may find the office empty on days when the surf is up.

What You'll Do:

The Data Analyst is responsible for furthering HG Insights capabilities within the Data Operations group to efficiently and effectively build and maintain the HG dataset through enhancements to the data curation efforts- leveraging insights gained via the application of data mining and data analysis, combined with a predictive approach to the most impactful solutions and achievement of the departmental objectives. The Data Analyst is an integral part of ensuring the integrity of the industry leading data products that enable the success of HG Insights clients.

What You'll Be Responsible For:

  • Experiment and develop new ways to extract actionable insights from big data.
  • Identify opportunities to comprehensively use the attributes and intelligence present in the data to improve processes and applications of rule sets.
  • Generate monthly communication to internal stakeholders identifying impactful changes as a result of operational efforts.
  • Understand client use cases and contribute to strategic planning within the team.
  • Apply a degree of predictive modeling to guide focus areas for improvement within the dataset.
  • Coordinate with internal HG Insights teams on initiatives including the automation of impact reporting, integration of systematic product validation logic, and support delivering files to our clients

Other Job Responsibilities may include:

  • Production Process: Assist with the daily tasks associated with the production process as dictated by current demand.
  • Pre-deployment: Become an expert on global/product level tokens and the way they affect the data. Perform the final stage of production which determines which products are ready for MRF, and which products require further human curation through another production QC cycle to ensure comprehensive coverage.
  • Data Quality: Perform general data quality control tasks.
  • Input Files for BPO Processing: Fulfill requests for new input files that go to outsource centers for processing by performing relational database queries.
  • Output Files: Append input and output data to master files along with maintaining file tracking and reporting.
  • Project Management: Working with other departments as necessary when cross-functional input is required.

What You'll Need:

  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite of Products
  • Experience with relational databases (MySQL, SQL Server, Athena).
  • Ability to analyze large amounts of data quickly, recognize complex patterns and anomalies.
  • Ability to translate and communicate complex data concepts to non-technical end users, including through dashboards created in Tableau or other BI tools.
  • Strong Individual and team work ethics.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow specific detailed instructions with the confidence to offer alternative solutions to the betterment of the project.
  • Strong English reading and written comprehension and communications skills.
  • Must be able to start immediately
  • Must be able to work legally in the United States

Nice-to-haves:

  • One to three years of data industry experience.
"

title: Data Analyst

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

At Mister Car Wash our formula is simple; we make people feel good by delivering a clean, dry and shiny car every time. Our customers come first, and we are dedicated to delivering exceptional quality and friendly service on every visit. We deliver on this promise through our exceptional team of employees.

Our people are the difference makers and we are committed to developing our teams for success both now and in the future.

In this role you will focus on driving the success and growth of the Mister Unlimited Wash Club (UWC). You will have a curious mind that uses data to tell stories, identify trends and develop strategy. title: Data Analyst - Subscription

description:
b'
$16.50 - $18.00 an hour

Data analysts are the link between our clients and the Hydromax USA field crews. Analysts are responsible for the processing and analysis of all field-collected data. Analysts use this data in conjunction with geographic information systems and a variety of other resources to make a number of qualitative decisions, primarily regarding risk assessment, data quality control and the direction of field work flow. Additionally, analysts oversee data input and database management, prepare field inspection work for billing and accurately assign billing rates, and provide support to field operations. Each day presents a new set of challenges for the data analyst to solve, requiring a high level of analytical thinking. Overcoming these challenges leads to a mentally-engaging and rewarding work experience.

Required
  • Excellent problem solving ability
  • High level of analytical thinking
  • Strong decision-making ability
  • Attention to detail
Desired
  • Technical education background (physics, engineering, mathematics, chemistry, biology, etc.)
  • Microsoft Access/ SQL
  • GIS (ESRI, ArcMap)

BENEFITS

Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Short Term Disability, 401K-company matching after year 1, Paid Time Off (PTO), 6 Paid Holidays, Profit Sharing.

WHO WE ARE

Established in 2003, Hydromax USA (HUSA) is a professional services firm specializing in data collection in support of locating and assessing the condition of the country\xe2\x80\x99s aging water, wastewater and natural gas conveyance systems. Hydromax\xe2\x80\x99s vast experience with new technologies and techniques empowers contractors, engineers and utility owners to make the best rehabilitation decisions regarding their buried infrastructure.

Based upon a strong record of performance, our customers have recognized that HUSA brings a unique ability to meet their needs for advanced data collection. We work from coast to coast covering the entire United States, without exception. Hydromax USA utilizes the largest array of technologies, within one company, to provide the broadest capability in the country to assess buried infrastructure.

Hydromax USA is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against otherwise qualified applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, ancestry, religion, orientation, age, sex, marital status, national origin, disability, genetic information, handicap or veteran status.

An Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

title: Data Analyst III

b'
Temporary, Internship

Our internship offers challenging work that gives you the chance to provide immediate value and is ideal for those pursuing a bachelor's degree.

The Business Data Analyst Intern will get exposure to multiple functional areas in the business and will be equipped with knowledge around a corporate BI tool.

Key Activities:
  • Learn Salesforce Analytics and assist corporate report work to assist Sales, Support, and other functional areas as needs arise.
  • Manage data alignment and create outputs from Salesforce Analytics which can be used by our management team to make informed decisions using data that already exists in the organization.
Job Requirements:
  • Currently in Jr. or Sr. year working toward a Bachelor's Degree
  • Must have completed at least one semester of business education classes
  • Detail oriented
  • Creative problem solver
  • Willingness to collaborate on a team
  • Interest in all functional areas of an organization
What's in it for you:
  • Gain valuable experience working on cutting edge technologies
  • Innovation is encouraged
  • The opportunity to make a difference, not just for yourself, but for millions of people around the globe by developing software that saves lives
Wellsky provides equal employment opportunities to all people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category.
