title: Summer 2019 Business Data Analyst Intern

description:
b'
$12 - $15 an hour
Part-time
Position Summary

The Department of Nutritional Sciences Evaluation Team has an opening for a qualified and highly motivated Data Entry Specialist. The person in this position will assist a team that performs the statewide evaluation for a federally-funded nutrition education and health disparities initiative (SNAP-Ed). As part of the team, the successful candidate will provide data entry and data management duties for the project.

The Data Entry Specialist will work directly with the Data Analyst to assist in data entry, reporting, survey tracking and other administrative tasks as necessary. The main job activities are data entry and management of incoming surveys and assessments, from intake to archive, including security of information at all stages. Working as an essential team member, the successful candidate will: (1) manage database-related procedures utilizing Qualtrics, Excel and Google Docs, (2) track and maintain complete and accurate system documentation for activities, (3) assist in preparing high quality project deliverables via data organization, data entry and monthly tracking reports, and (4) other duties as assigned, including similar tasks on other projects as funding allows.

As a .50 FTE, this position is eligible for outstanding UA benefits. These include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; state retirement plan; access to UA recreation, cultural activities and more!

The University of Arizona has been listed by Forbes as one of America\xe2\x80\x99s Best Employers in the United States and WorldatWork and the Arizona Department of Health Services have recognized us for our innovative work-life programs. For more information about working at the University of Arizona, please click here.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Performs timely and accurate data entry by entering and recording data from electronic and hard copy source materials.
  • Assists Data Analyst in developing summary data reports in Microsoft Excel.
  • Creates databases and tracks survey responses using UA Qualtrics.
  • Reviews and verifies source materials to determine accuracy and completeness of information; follows up to correct or complete data.
  • Compiles, sorts and counts data to be entered.
  • Codes and/or corrects codes of input data as needed.
  • Updates records by changing, merging or adding data to files.
  • Verifies entered data ensuring accuracy. Identifies and reconciles routine and complex data discrepancies. Identifies data entry errors and makes corrections.
  • Extracts and compiles information from databases to produce routine and specialized reports.
  • Develops and manages various tracking sheets in Google Docs and ensures accuracy of Monthly Trackers. Disseminates reports according to established procedures.
  • Maintains paper and digital survey management via intake logs, filing and organizational structures.
  • Logs and monitors physical location of source documents including archives of hardcopy and digital records.
  • Ensures the security of hard copy and digital information at all stages.
  • Recommends changes to procedures affecting assigned functions.
  • Updates documentation of protocols/procedures as needed.
  • Checks, reviews and prepares records, reports, forms or other documents of various kinds pertinent to assigned function(s); personally investigates complicated problems or errors.
  • Plans and prioritizes work load to meet set deadlines.
  • Assists staff with special projects as needed.
  • Demonstrates professionalism and presents a positive image of the project when interacting with stakeholders.
  • Demonstrates responsiveness and a sense of responsibility when managing duties.
  • Supports individual and team goals and initiatives; accepts ownership for individual results.
  • Attends monthly Evaluation Team Meetings.
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft Office including Excel and Google Docs.
  • Excellent attention to detail, organization and time management.
  • Skill in recording and compiling material for reports.
  • Ability to navigate within a computer systems-environment and learn new systems as needed with minimal oversight.
  • Skill in reviewing and verifying data.
  • Skill in extracting and compiling information from databases.
  • Good communication and creative problem solving skills.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.
  • Effective listening and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to absorb and apply new and changing information.
  • Works well in a team and office environment.
  • Ability to remain calm and flexible in stressful, unexpected situations.
  • Ability to maintain a consistent weekly schedule.
Minimum Qualifications

Please see Arizona Board of Regents Minimum Qualifications below.

Arizona Board of Regents Minimum Qualifications

One year of experience entering data using an alphanumeric keyboard and verifying/proofing entered data, including 6 months of experience reconciling complex data entry discrepancies; OR, any equivalent combination of experience, training and/or education.

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience working with data analysis tools (Qualtrics, SPSS, NVivo, etc.).
  • Demonstrated proficiency in the use of Microsoft PowerPoint, Access and Outlook.
  • Self-motivated to assume a leadership role in data management.
  • Superior analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
  • Able to take initiative and apply logical problem-solving and decision-making skills.
  • Skill in composition, grammar, spelling, and punctuation; strong editing abilities.
Full Time/Part Time Part Time Number of Hours Worked per Week 20 Job Category Administrative and Professional Benefits Eligible Yes - Full Benefits FLSA Non-Exempt Posted Rate of Pay $12.00 - 15.00 Per Hour DOE

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"
Job Description

Here\xe2\x80\x99s how we work:

The Boston, MA office is hiring a Transit Data Analyst to join their team.

IBI Group's Transit Data practice focuses on helping transit agencies manage their data, provide high-quality real-time information to passengers, and analyze service quality and measure performance. The Transit Data practice also has a special emphasis on open data, and open data standards like GTFS/GTFS-real-time.

The Transit Data team has been working closely with many agencies to plan for, design, procure, implement, and test their passenger information and analytics systems. This includes experience with Everett Community Transit, Vancouver TransLink, Denver RTD, Boston MBTA, Los Angeles Metro, amongst others.


Most of the things you\xe2\x80\x99ll work on:

  • Plan, design, implement, and test technology systems that
    • Provide high-quality real-time information to transit passengers. This includes systems that interface with vehicle tracking systems, generate predictions, generate service alerts, and provide them to passengers via a variety of channels and data feeds.
    • Analyze service and measure performance based on real-time and archival data. This includes assessing the quality of service provided to and experienced by transit passengers.
  • Analyze schedule, operational, real-time, and spatial data to identify issues, and improve transit service
  • Prepare technical memos, reports and proposals
  • Coordinate with clients, and other design disciplines, offices and staff

Qualifications

  • Strong interest in public transit
  • Experience with, or interest in, transit operations is preferred
  • Experience with, or interest in, transit data (e.g. GTFS and GTFS-real-time formatted data) is preferred
  • Experience with, or interest in, databases and SQL is preferred
  • One of the following educational qualifications:
    • Master's degree in Transportation, Transportation Engineering, Systems Engineering, Civil Engineering, City Planning, Urban Planning, Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
    • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Transportation, Transportation Engineering, Systems Engineering, Civil Engineering, City Planning, Urban Planning, Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field and at least two years of work experience in the transportation industry.
  • Problem solving skills and a practical thinker
  • Strong organizational skills and self-motivated
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Additional Information

Office Perks:

Professional fees are paid yearly and we provide a competitive benefits package.

Bagels on Monday and Friday, Happy Hour every Friday, Mini cupcakes the 1st, Thursday of every, month (celebrate birthdays), Holiday Party, Seasonal outings, Pumpkin Carving Contest, Office lunches plus more\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\xa6

Additional Information

Please add school transcripts and two writing samples with your resume submission.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver\xe2\x80\x99s license record.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
$50,000 a year
Job Description

The Junior Data Analyst is a role specifically working with the Lendio Analytics Team to develop reports and tools that enable more strategic decision-making. In this role, you will work with an established business intelligence team to analyze, report, and present on key performance & operational metrics. You will also work with the technical aspects of data preparation, modeling, implementation. This position will primarily work with our marketing and business development departments but will have plenty of opportunity to do ad hoc analysis in other departments. The ideal candidate will have internship or 1-2 years work experience in an analytics role and is comfortable proactively exploring data to find insights and can bring potential solutions to the table before questions are asked.


  • Maintain close contact with Marketing and Business Development teams to ensure that new features and changes to partners and marketing strategy are introduced into the data warehouse to maintain optimal data flow from operational systems (CRM), through the data warehouse, and into the end user reporting tool, Domo
  • Data-gathering and analysis efforts as part of the analytics team leveraging a variety of listening and analysis tools, always looking to extract actionable insights
  • Interpret data, analyze results and prepare daily, weekly, monthly and ongoing reports via Excel, Domo, SQL, and Python
  • Prepare scheduled and ad hoc reports as necessary and provide supporting analysis and recommendations
  • Continuously innovate; learn new skills, develop your talents, and exercise a passion and drive to deliver excellence

Qualifications

  • 1-2 years of experience in an Analyst role (Internships a plus)
  • SQL and Python experience required
  • Domo Certification a plus
  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to work independently and as a contributor on a larger project
  • Effective communication skills with technical team members as well as business partners.


Additional Information

  • All the tools you need to own your craft
  • People-centric work culture
  • A relaxed work environment
  • Bright colleagues to support you

http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/lendio

title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b"

DATA ANALYST STATISTICS

OUR STORY

LSG is an Industry Leader in providing Innovative, Client Focused, Logistics and, Information Technology Support. Our commitment to our customers, teammates, and personnel is to exceed expectations in everything we do. We take great pride in our responsiveness and in delivering this promise.

OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU!

Our employees are our biggest asset and we take pride in providing them with an environment that encourages growth, balance, and teamwork. LSG is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

BENEFITS OF WORKING WITH LSG (if applicable)

  • PTO & Holidays
  • Insurance
  • 401(k) Plan
  • Healthy Environment
  • FLSA Compliant

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF THE DATA ANALYST STATISTICS

As the Data Analyst Statistics you are responsible for the following objectives:

  • Identify and describe data elements and data files/tables required to complete assigned projects and make recommendations regarding the creation of analytical reports.
  • Ensure the reports and statistical data developed to achieve client organizational and/or business goals.
  • Monitor performance and managing parameters to provide fast query responses to front-end users.
  • Identify significant differences, relationships, and trends in data as well as factors that could affect the results of statistical research.
  • Perform data mining, analysis, and reporting to support client organizations and initiatives.
  • Perform various statistical analyses using data drawn from diverse sources to map and identify genuine trends and relationships.
  • Develop the conceptual design for a planned statistical database in outline; considering both back-end organization of data and front-end accessibility for end-users; refine the logical design so that it can be translated into a specific data model; maintain data standards, including adherence to the Data Protection Act; write database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions.
  • Support statistical analysis by leveraging cluster analysis, time series, multivariable regression, etc.

MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Ability to obtain a SECRET Clearance. (Active one preferred)
  • Bachelor's degree in Business/Computer Science/Software Engineering or related field. One year of job-related experience may be substituted for each year of college.
  • Minimum of one-year job-related experience with analyzing large datasets utilizing statistical software packages and the advanced analytical features of MS Excel or MS Access.
  • Ability to support statistical data interpretation as it relates to design/engineering, new construction, and/or software programming as required.
  • Knowledge of data processing, systems support background is required.

PRIMARY WORK LOCATION AND HOURS OF OPERATION

City: Norfolk

State: Virginia

title: Data Analyst Statistics (Contingent Hire)

description:
b'
Zendesk is seeking an Associate Marketing Data Analyst to join our AMER regional marketing team. You will be joining a group of field, campaign and sales driven marketers. We are data driven marketers, so every major decision starts with data analysis to find opportunity areas and to measure our efforts. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be diving into a wide scope of sales, marketing, and regional data to help us make the right decisions and achieve our groundbreaking goals.
Who we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for: You\xe2\x80\x99re an excellent teammate, a fun fact sharer, looking to support and influence, not needing sole credit for wins and able to support others selflessly. You are an eager learner and data digger who actually enjoys a challenge and sees it as an opportunity. Unafraid to admit failure and always eager to find solutions, you are inventive, self-motivated to learn and unafraid to ask questions in order to grow.

Responsibilities:

  • Join efforts with our regional team to influence and empower field marketers, and key partners, to demonstrate data to measure and prove success
  • Sift through our data warehouse and existing dashboards to scope, size, and fulfill ad hoc requests that support the greater Sales/Marketing Org
  • Assess quality of data and monitor and improve data quality Partner with internal Marketing teams to provide mentorship and analytical support from initial program brainstorms to post-launch analysis
  • Build and maintain reports and/or dashboards that provide clarity into business performance
  • Be rigorous about monitoring critical metrics related to Go-To Market performance and don\xe2\x80\x99t hesitate to point out new trends or flag potential issues

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • BS/BA degree in business engineering, economics, or related degree OR equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
  • 2+ years of experience in strategy consulting, data analytics, business intelligence, or a strong interest to learn marketing analytics
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. A knack for identifying and investigating anomalies in data and operations
  • Familiarity with BI tools (e.g. BIME, Tableau, GoodData) and Excel or SAS functions
  • Working knowledge of SQL and data warehouses (e.g. BigQuery, MySQL) Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry important metrics, such as website sessions, MQLs, pipeline, and ARR a plus
  • Experience analyzing CRM data (e.g., Salesforce) and web tracking (e.g., Google Analytics) a plus
The best customer experiences are built with Zendesk. Zendesk\xe2\x80\x99s powerful and flexible customer service and engagement platform scales to meet the needs of any business, from startups and small businesses to growth companies and enterprises. Headquartered in San Francisco, Zendesk operates worldwide with 15 offices in North America, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.

title: Associate Marketing Data Analyst

description:
b'
$92,093 - $118,670 a year

There is only one city in the country that can say it is the Nation\xe2\x80\x99s Capital \xe2\x80\x93 Washington, D.C. Given that distinction, the Metropolitan Police Department is the premiere law enforcement organization in the city. We receive over 19 million visitors a year, have almost 700,000 residents, and 21,000 private businesses. The Department consists of more than 4,500 members: approximately 3,850 sworn members and over 650 civilian employees. We are one of the most diverse and highly trained departments in the country. We have the honor of safeguarding and protecting not only our nation\xe2\x80\x99s residents, but also people from all over the world.

This position is located in the Metropolitan Police Department (MPD), Executive Office of the Chief, the Strategic Change Division. The Strategic Change Division is seeking a civic-minded, analytic Performance and Data Analyst to help propel performance management and analytic programs at the Metropolitan Police Department agency.

The Performance and Data Analyst will work as an expert advisor on a wide range of analytics and performance management initiatives related to the agency. The Performance and Data Analyst will use data, strategic planning, and innovation to continuously improve the programs and services of the agency.

The incumbent will be responsibility for:

  • Provide expert advice and services to MPD on strategic planning, data analysis, and development and execution of monitoring and accountability tools.
  • Develop, analyze reports on, and visualizes key performance metrics for the agency and its initiatives.
  • Conduct and interpret analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify areas of improvement and concern.
  • Evaluate the effectiveness of select programs and services, and coordinates with agencies to design on-going improvement plans for programs and services.
  • Provide guidance to agencies on the development of annual performance plans, including the development of strategic objectives and key performance metrics and helps determine agency success in meeting work plan targets.
  • Advise the supervisor on the effectiveness of existing MPD Performance Management initiatives, infrastructure, programs and policies.
  • Recommend improvement based on research of best practices and national standards.
  • Participate in the design, planning, preparation, implementation, and follow-up for CapSTAT meetings.
  • Coordinate and assists with the development of MPD\xe2\x80\x99s strategic planning. Reviews the performance plans of MPD to assure alignment with District\xe2\x80\x99s strategic plan.
  • Participate in the development and analysis of dashboards on a variety of topics to help analyze performance in priority areas.
  • Support and participate in the design of work plans, tools and templates to facilitate well-communicated, efficient, and productive performance management processes.
  • Keep abreast and knowledgeable of industry best in business intelligence, performance management, data visualization and systems analysis and design.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Expert knowledge and experience with performance management, strategic planning and change management for District government agencies and offices. Expert knowledge of, or familiarity with, business planning, reporting, measurement/monitoring, and policy analysis and formulation.
  • Analytical skills, such as statistical analysis, financial analysis, cost-benefit analysis, and/or GIS analysis. Coding experience, especially in R, is desirable and Microsoft Excel expertise is required.
  • Demonstrated experience in descriptive statistics and other analysis techniques using Microsoft Excel is required.
  • Proficiency in the use of business intelligence tools for querying and reporting data is required.
  • Experience in IBM COGNOS, Tableau, and ArcGIS preferred.
  • Ability to collect and analyze information and data on a wide variety of policy areas that affect MPD; and to make recommendations for improvements to processes, programs and/or laws or regulations.
  • Skilled in problem solving and project management to conduct in-depth research, analysis and evaluation. Excellent organizational skills, and strong attention to detail with the ability to coordinate multiple work streams, multi-task and work well under tight deadlines.
  • Understanding of the strategy and policy context of government and the department; and the ability to take a corporate perspective - having a strong awareness of the priorities and strategic objectives. Strong data analysis and critical thinking skills.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills; and the ability to interact effectively with a variety of contacts/relationships, from senior-level officials to agency analysts.

Licensures, Certifications and other requirements
N/A

Education
Bachelor's degree from an accredited four year-college or university in public and business administration, public policy, human resource management (HRM), financial management, or related field, plus five (5) years of work related experience; OR an equivalent combination of education and/or experience which exhibits the ability to perform satisfactorily in the position.

Master's degree and a minimum of three (3) years of work related experience preferred.

Experience
Applicants must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience, equivalent to a least the (CS-12) grade level, or its non-District equivalent, gained from the public or private sector. Specialized experience is defined as experience that equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform successfully the duties of the position directly related to the position.

OTHER SIGNIFICANT FACTORS
Incumbent is subject to shift work, weekend work and on-call status. Incumbent is required to travel around the Washington, DC area, to DC Courts, other District agencies, meetings, trainings and occasionally travels out of town to conferences/trainings. Incumbent is required to possess and maintain a valid motor vehicle operator\xe2\x80\x99s permit.

Positions with the Metropolitan Police Department require a criminal background, traffic record and consumer check.

The District of Columbia Government is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Data Analyst

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there! We invite you to join IQVIA\xe2\x84\xa2

title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b'
Temporary
Job ID: 3188439
Full/Part-Time: Full-time

Regular/Temporary: Regular
Listed: 2019-03-26

Location: New York, United States of America

Regulation, Compliance & Anti-Financial Crime

Regulation, Compliance and Anti-Financial Crime (AFC) protects the integrity and reputation of Deutsche Bank. It manages the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s risks and help to avert unintentional rule breaches and conflicts of interest. At the same time, we also advise the bank on ethical conduct and governance issues and keep the bank up to date on regulatory and political challenges.

Position Overview

Job Title: Know Your Client (KYC) Client Perimeter Data Analyst
Corporate Title: Assistant Vice President
Job Location: New York, NY

About Deutsche Bank

We are Germany\xe2\x80\x99s leading bank with strong positions in Europe and significant presence in the Americas and Asia Pacific. We are driving growth through our strong client franchise, investing heavily in digital technologies, prioritizing long-term success over short-term gains, and serving society with ambition and integrity. We serve our clients\xe2\x80\x99 real economic needs in commercial and investment banking, retail banking and transaction banking, and provide ground-breaking products and services in asset and wealth management. That means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients.

Overview

Deutsche Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Global Transaction Banking division (the \xe2\x80\x9cBank\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9cGTB\xe2\x80\x9d, respectively) is a market leader across Europe and rapidly growing business division in the Americas and Asia Pacific. Within GTB, there is a KYC Middle Office that includes a New Client Adoption (\xe2\x80\x9cNCA\xe2\x80\x9d), Periodic Review (\xe2\x80\x9cPR/RR\xe2\x80\x9d) Team and a Client Perimeter Team that manages the population of these entities and those being exited, for the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s multi-national clients and subsidiaries of foreign domiciled corporations who book transactions via accounts and products in the US.

This position is for an AVP to function as a Subject Matter Expert, responsible for the creation and maintenance (and utilizing the information therein) of a complete database of clients within the GTB_TFCCM_US businesses. This database will be used to track and report on New Client Adoptions (\xe2\x80\x9cNCA\xe2\x80\x9d), Periodic Reviews (\xe2\x80\x9cPR\xe2\x80\x9d), Event Driven Reviews (\xe2\x80\x9cEDR\xe2\x80\x9d) and the various stages of client exits, among other things. The Client Perimeter Team you will be working within an among the three distinct organizational groups in the TFCCM_US KYC Middle Office. Their primary responsibility is to manage the health of a client legal entity, and facilitate client exits where applicable. The function works hand-in-hand with the onboarding and periodic review team to ensure the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s compliance with all applicable regulations with respect to KYC.

You must have the appropriate level of skills to manage the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s data by accessing and extracting information from various proprietary and licensed software systems with pinpoint accuracy. Additionally, you must possess the appropriate level of soft skills and business acumen to face off with the front office sales team and group heads. Presentation of data is as important as managing the most complex data sets. You will also guide other team members through difficult and complex KYC related data issues. You are expected to recommend and change- manage process improvements, and implement new processes when necessary. You will be extremely detail oriented and analytical. You should be able to work both independently and as part of a team and switch gears quickly to adapt to business needs in a highly charged and challenging environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Create and maintain TFCCM_US Client Perimeter
  • Create and present data sets to internal and external partners in a clear and concise business language, realizing the audience requires concept and risk analysis in simple English terms, not data language
  • Identify and clearly present risks and issues against our pipeline and proces
  • Face-off with partner groups and divisions in Operations, Vendors, AFC, as well as the business sales and product Teams to ensure accurate depiction and delivery of data
  • Learn in great detail and apply expertly the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s changing Key Operating Procedures that account for the EUs Anti Money Laundering (AML) Directives and the US Federal Regulations
  • Understand, follow and submit recommendations for process improvements regarding data collection, flows, and presentations, working with the group VP to ensure adherence
  • Assisting with audits, escalations, and investigations on KYC issues as needed
  • Help develop and roll-out key process changes and work directly with key stakeholders

Required Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:

  • Appropriate level of Soft Skills necessary to manage and guide team members, partner groups and stakeholders through key process steps, implementation and changes
  • Knowledge of AML policies which govern banks; Know You Client policy guidelines; BSA, U.S.A. PATRIOT Act guidelines, etc
  • Ability to work independently and reach out with cross-functional team members in a matrix environment; working face-to-face, not solely over email
  • Excellent knowledge of Excel (Macros, Pivots, Lookups, etc.) and Power Point
  • Ability to work well under tight deadlines and time pressure for quick turnaround with a desire to go above and beyond to satisfy our clients with appropriate decision making skills

Required Education and/or Experience:

  • College education of data management, or equal work experience
  • Relevant experience working with large complex data sets and multiple competing with overlapping systems, both proprietary and licensed
  • Relevant Experience in Project Management, PMO or Change Management experience
  • Moderate understanding of cash and trade financial products is a plus
  • Compliance, audit or AML background is a plus

For candidates applying for positions in the US:

Deutsche Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories. Click these links to view the \xe2\x80\x9c EEO is the Law \xe2\x80\x9d poster and pay transparency statement.

title: Know Your Client (KYC) Client Perimeter Data Analyst- Assistant Vice President

description:
b'

Position: Data Analyst



Job Purpose: Na Ali\xe2\x80\x99i is looking to hire a Data Analyst to support the Naval Supply Systems Command (NAVSUP) Weapons System Support (WSS) Philadelphia. The successful candidate will analyze and develop data solutions, and visualizations used to support NAVSUP enterprise reform initiatives.



Job Duties Include: The following duties reflect management\xe2\x80\x99s definition of essential functions for this job but do not restrict the tasks that might be assigned. Management may assign additional duties and responsibilities at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.

  • Providing reform team(s) with data analysis and data visualization support to derive actionable insights using tools MS Excel, Visual Basic for Applications (to write and diagnose problems with macros), Alteryx models (to manipulate Excel files, i.e., join multiple files into one data set), and other MS Office suite applications.
  • Creating tables, charts, and graphs to transpose into Powerpoint to drive workable meetings for our client.
  • Identifying, documenting, and communicating issues within data and determining the root cause of the problem to recommend and execute corrective action.
  • Identifying and implementing process improvements in relation to data collection and processing for repeatability.
  • Creating data model documentation that describes the flow of data from any given data set to its final output format, in accordance with policies set forth by the Government client.
  • Assisting with the development, implementation, cleansing, validation, and maintenance of good and accurate data flowing from user inputs to reporting outputs.
  • Educating and providing technical support as needed or requested within the scope of specific assigned responsibilities.
  • Providing other related duties as required by the Project Manager.
Skills/Qualifications: Excellent technical skills, organizational and planning skills, communication, and problem-solving skills, problem analysis, attention to detail and accuracy, solid judgment and decision-making ability, takes initiative and is adaptable and customer service oriented. Specifically, the ideal candidate will be familiar with, and have experience with the following technical knowledge, skills, and abilities:
  • Experience working with large datasets or databases.
  • Strong quantitative ability and a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
  • Understanding of writing syntax and using statistics and data analysis tools.
  • Ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities with minimum direction and supervision.

Education and Experience: This position requires a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or higher in statistics, mathematics, social science, business or an equivalent related field from an accredited institution. A minimum of three (3) years of relevant professional experience is required. Familiarity with Alteryx models (to manipulate Excel files, i.e., join multiple files into one data set) is a requirement to advance. Experience working in or directly for the DoD is desired.

Clearance Requirements: This position requires a National Agency Check with Inquiries (NACI) background investigation and the ability to secure a government issued Common Access Card (CAC).

Work Location: Work is performed on government site at Naval Supply Systems Command Weapons System Support Philadelphia, unless directed. Employees will work in close proximity with Government personnel. Core work hours are 0730 to 1400 Monday through Friday except holidays.

Na Ali`i Is Proud to Be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

Responsible for data acquisition and ongoing data integrity in University Advancement systems. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Information Systems or equivalent combination of education and experience; two years of experience writing complex Microsoft T-SQL queries to extract data from multiple data systems, integrate and analyze data; two years of experience working with data warehouses and large data sets.

Desired Qualifications

Three years working with Microsoft T-SQL; experience researching, analyzing, and interpreting information; general knowledge of relational databases; experience with Microsoft SQL Management Studio.

title: Flight Data Services Analyst Level 2

description:
b'
$34.76 - $40.48 an hour

Mission
To connect people with resources and solutions in times of need so we can all live, learn, work and take part in strong, healthy communities

Vision
That all basic needs in our communities are met through innovative and collaborative approaches. Greater Seattle is a place where the richness of our diversity is valued, all of our communities thrive, and people grow up and grow old with opportunity and dignity.

What We Do
The Human Services Department is committed to race and social justice equity and principles in the approach to our work. Our department is organized into four divisions: Youth and Family Empowerment (YFE), Homeless Strategy Investment (HSI), Aging and Disability Services (ADS) and Leadership and Administration Division (LAD) that collectively provides services to the community in three ways:

  • Funder, grantor and steward of public investment dollars to community agencies;
  • Direct Service provider primarily through case management; and
  • Convener through community and stakeholder engagement activities.
About the Data, Performance, and Evaluation Team
This position is part of the HSD Data, Performance, and Evaluation (DPE) Team and reports to the DPE Manager. This team is a strong steward of race and social justice collaborating across all HSD divisions to work on 1) data; ensuring continuous improvement for alignment in data collection, storage, reporting, and evaluation 2) performance; serve as consultants to divisions ensuring the integrity of the Theory of Change using the Results Based Accountability framework, which provide HSD with clear performance measures to report, and 3) evaluation; ensure logic models are used in evaluations and neutral qualitative and qualitative analysis are included.

The DPE team is looking to fill two positions:
One position will support the Youth and Family Empowerment Division (YFE). The other will support the Aging and Disability Division (ADS). Both positions will work within their assigned division to identify data system issues and process improvement needs to ensure accurate and timely reporting on HSD investments. This includes analyzing data and completing comprehensive reports used to make decisions for HSD, Mayor's Office, and City Council.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Participate in and lead critical conversations about race and social justice, and use these principles to guide discussions around equity and access through data.
  • Extract, study, and analyze a variety of data sets using Microsoft Excel, Tableau, and other applications review data quality, create reports, and develop data-driven recommendations for HSD.
  • Use Microsoft Excel, Tableau, and/or other applications to develop performance management tools.
  • Communicate and present data-verbally and in writing-to different levels of staff who are non-technical and/or non-subject matter experts, including Executives, Mayor's Office, and Council.
  • Collaborate with staff to ensure that an RFP's framework follows current best practices and includes both qualitative and quantitative data.
  • Manage data projects-primarily with internal stakeholders-to meet the department's needs.
  • Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of data management and business processes, and collaborate with staff to implement improvements.
  • Document processes, develop guidelines, and create training materials to support the department.
  • Recommend, coordinate, and/or implement changes to department data systems in order to improve efficiency and enhance workflow.
  • Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's degree in business or public administration, finance, computer science, or a related field (or a combination of education, training, or experience that provides an equivalent background required to perform the work of the class).

Experience: 2 years of experience in systems, operations, procedures, research, or analysis

Additional Information:

You will be successful in this role if you have:

  • Have a strong understanding of and commitment to principles of race and social justice and their impacts on the community.
  • Passion for making a difference in the human services sector.
  • Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot issues quickly and find solutions independently in a timely manner.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and within a team.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively prioritize and manage multiple tasks while completing daily work.
  • High attention to detail.
  • Experience collating varied data sets into one system for reporting.
  • Experience using Microsoft Office Suite (PPT, Excel), Tableau, or similar tools to creating visualizations.
  • Experience analyzing, reporting, and evaluating data for continuous quality improvement.
  • Ability to collaborate, build relationships, and develop consensus to reach agreement on outcomes.
  • Ability to communicate with diverse groups, both internal and external.
  • Demonstrated success developing and implementing policies and procedures to improve data quality and performance accountability.
  • Ability to develop written documentation to support the team and department.
  • Experience using a range of different data systems and databases.

title: Data Analyst (Mgmt Systems Analyst)

description:
b"

About the Role

Babylist is looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing Operations and Strategy team. Partnering with our Data Scientist, you will be focused on empowering decision-making through data for both internal and external stakeholders. You will be responsible for delivering data-driven, actionable insights that contribute to our business. In this role, you will help scope, build, and maintain key dashboards, support stakeholders in using data to answer strategic questions, and deliver data-driven insights to drive the business forward. Your work will have immediate impact across the company and you will be in a uniquely cross-discipline role, working with nearly every team in the company.



Requirements

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do

  • You will own business intelligence and consumer insights at Babylist, both internally and externally. You will create and maintain our business dashboards and reports to track ongoing business metrics, performance of A/B tests, and special projects with brand partners.
  • You\xe2\x80\x99ll gather data from our own databases as well as third party sources, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll turn them into meaningful and actionable insights.You will dive into a broad range of data including transaction databases, relational databases, usage data, etc.
  • You will work closely with business stakeholders and engineering to make sure data definitions and technical logic specifications align with business requirements.
  • Perform ad hoc analyses to aid in data-driven decision-making across the team.
  • Spot trends and present them to an audience of executives and other stakeholders with different backgrounds.
  • You\xe2\x80\x99ll work with our PR team to establish Babylist as an expert in the larger Baby industry by sharing consumer insights on market trends through the lens of data.

Who You Are

  • You are passionate about the benefits that data driven decision-making can bring to organizations.
  • You\xe2\x80\x99re curious and obsessed with answering the WHY behind the data trends.
  • You\xe2\x80\x99re a data visualization wizard who can communicate complex insights in an easy-to-understand way for a wide range of audiences.
  • You're self-directed, proactive, and able to define and execute projects independently
  • You have strong business acumen, and excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are adept with SQL and more scientific reporting languages such as Python, R, MatLab, etc.
  • You can prioritize without being overwhelmed.

What You\xe2\x80\x99ve Done

  • BS/MS degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Information Technology or equivalent/related degree.
  • 3+ years of relevant professional work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence, market research or related field
  • Experience with business intelligence tools and the ability to create report mockups
  • High proficiency in SQL and the ability to navigate a relational database
  • Experience in a scripting language such as Python, R or another statistical language

Benefits

About Babylist

Babylist is a baby registry and e-commerce platform that helps expecting parents get exactly what they need. in 2019 over $300 million worth of gifts will be purchased off of the Babylist registries.


Why You Will Love Working at Babylist:

  • We get stuff done
  • We have a real impact on people\xe2\x80\x99s lives
  • We're passionate about our users and we genuinely appreciate them
  • We work at a sustainable pace for long-term success (yes, we\xe2\x80\x99re profitable)
  • We are growing and have meaningful opportunities for career advancement
  • We\xe2\x80\x99re a technological and data-driven business
  • We are doers, but also thinkers
  • We believe in autonomy and reward taking initiative
  • We have smart, experienced leadership that is always open to new ideas

Benefits:

  • Competitive pay
  • Competitive health benefits including company-funded HRA for vision and dental
  • 401(k), FSA plans and disability insurance
  • Flexible, paid parental leave policy
  • Easy access to BART including commuter assistance
  • We work at a sustainable pace. In general we don\xe2\x80\x99t work late or on weekends and most employees WFH every Wednesday.


If your experience is close to what we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for, please consider applying. Experience comes in many forms \xe2\x80\x93 skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we\xe2\x80\x99re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
Contract

Experience: Two to four years of hands on application development experience in an environment with large data sets, Cloud, or Big Data is required

Job Description:

The Unix Scripting and ETL Developer is focused on building the next generation of global financial data systems.

Our developers work on high profile projects with both business analysts and prospective application managers in order to gather requirements, perform implementations and guide production rollouts while creating highly optimized batch & real-time applications and ensure the overall success of their programs.

Job Duties include:

Develop, unit test and deploy Unix Script components and miscellaneous technical components.

Ensure Unix scripting is appropriately engineered to maintain current functionality and development adheres to performance optimization, interoperability standards and requirements, and compliance with client IT governance policies.

Conduct database programming, performance tuning, relational model analysis and data migration.

Make appropriate changes and recheck the program to ensure that the desired results are produced.

Prepare trial runs of programs and software applications to be sure they will produce the desired information and that the instructions are correct.

Contributes to the technical design documents, Use Cases, test cases and User Manuals for various projects. Conducts bug fixing, code reviews, and unit, functional and integration testing.

Write, analyze, review, and rewrite programs.

Perform or direct revision, repair, or expansion of existing programs to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements.

Consult with and assist engineering and technical personnel to clarify program intent, identify problems, and make changes.

Compile and write documentation of program development and subsequent revisions and insert comments in the coded instructions so others can understand the program.

Perform systems analysis and programming tasks to maintain and control the use of computer systems software as a systems programmer.

Prepare detailed workflow charts and diagrams that describe input, output, and logical operation, and convert them into a series of instructions coded in a computer language.

Position Requirements include a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering (all branches), math, or a related field. Must have strong communication skills with an interest in developing self, and a technical focus.

Technological Environment: Prefer knowledge of Unix/Linux Scripting, Ab Initio EME 3.0.4, Oracle, SQL Developer 3.0.05 Build Main 04.34, AutoSys 3.5.1, and Microsoft Office 2007-10.

For immediate consideration,email resume with home location, first and last name as well as contact information. This position is located in Chicago so we need people in the immediate area as this is an onsite position.

description:

  • Researches, trouble shoots, administers application administration, conducts application user training.

  • Executes and analyzes decision support processes and data to measure campaign efficiency, data accuracy, data integrity, operations performance, customer satisfaction and cost effectiveness.
  • Manage and execute multiple level complex campaigns of various types, which may include, but is not limited to, the review of campaign specifications, working with clients to validate and obtain sign-off of client deliverables and dynamic campaign execution.
  • Manage, execute and analyze decision support processes and data to measure campaign efficiency, data accuracy, data integrity, operations performance, customer satisfaction, and cost effectiveness.
  • Build and implement reporting solutions utilizing various reporting tools which may include ad hoc and/or automated delivery/distribution.
  • Develop and execute repeatable processes via SQL Server Stored Procedures and SSDT Package Flows.
  • Drive, develop, maintain and improve client relationship through increased client communications.


Desired Characteristics

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in computer science, Management Information Systems or 5-years\xe2\x80\x99 experience SDLC with an emphasis on a RDBMS discipline.

  • Ability to write, debug, and troubleshoot Stored Procedures, Packages, and functions.
  • FTP processing and best practices
  • Exposure with ETL processes and tools such as DMExpress and Talend.
  • Analytical mindset, solutions oriented, ability to think outside of the box and problem solve.
  • Ability to work independently but also able to contribute in a team setting.

#LI-MC1

Company Summary

Zeta is a data-driven marketing technology innovator whose SaaS-based marketing cloud helps 500+ Fortune 1000 and Middle Market brands acquire, retain and grow customer relationships through actionable data, advanced analytics and machine learning.

Founded by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley (former CEO of Apple and Pepsi-Cola) in 2007, the company's highly-rated ZetaHub technology platform has been recognized in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Digital Marketing Hubs (February 2017) and in its Magic Quadrant for Multichannel Campaign Management (April 2017), competing with offerings from Oracle, IBM, Salesforce and Adobe.

Operating on four continents with 1,300+ employees, the company is headquartered in New York City, with Centers of Excellence in Silicon Valley, Boston, London, and Hyderabad, India.

Zeta Global is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ancestry, color, religion, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, medical condition, disability, veteran\xe2\x80\x99s status, or any other basis protected by law.

Recent News

Zeta Global Recognized by The Relevancy Group as Industry Leader for the 4th Consecutive Year

Zeta Global is Recognized as a Visionary by Gartner for the First Time

b'

NEW YORK, NY

title: SQL Data Analyst

description:
b"

Date: Mar 26, 2019

Location: Lakewood, UM, US

Company: Terumo BCT, Inc.

Requisition ID: 23245

Will provide technical expertise on SAP ECC to meet global business objectives and translate business and end user requirements in the area of master data. Provide guidance in adhering to standard process and tool functionality. Will follow all phases of project life cycle including analysis, design, development, testing, training, deployment and post-production support/maintenance for assigned projects.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

  • Responsible for supporting and providing technical solutions for issues related to the SAP Global Master Data Management which involves data maintenance, collection, validation, reporting and analysis.
  • Evaluate new business requirements, issues and propose appropriate solutions.
  • Provide technical assistance to escalated issues identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures.
  • Work with business users on all master data management requests and research potential improvements to transaction, data handling and process developing job aids and procedures to enhance SAP usability and deliver value to users.
  • Participates, and may lead, in multiple projects and production support solutions for multiple business areas which may include communicating project status and resolving project roadblocks.
  • Update, edit and compile technical documentation including: unit, integration, and acceptance test plans, support documentation, end user documentation for delivered solutions and other tasks as assigned.
  • Develops and executes WINSHUTTLE scripts and LSMW templates for preparation of project load files or mass loads.
  • Verifies that all Global Master Data is setup completely and accurately in accordance with written and controlled procedures.
  • Develops, coordinates, and implements plans to test business and functional processes during system development.
  • Research of potential improvements to transaction, data handling and process
  • Identifies, recommends, and implements means to continuously improve department processes and Global Master Data.
  • Shares responsibility with team members for 24-hour on-call problem resolution (if required).

MINIMUM QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

Education

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science or, equivalent of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job may be considered, advanced degree preferred.

Experience

  • Minimum 5 years experience.
  • Minimum 1 year SAP full lifecycle implementation experience in a team environment.
  • Business background in supply chain planning, procurement, production, or operations is highly desired.
  • Advanced user of SAP transactions.

Skills

  • Must possess analytical skills to evaluate new business requirements, issues and propose appropriate solutions.
  • Demonstrates conceptual reasoning skills and discretionary judgment and an understanding of business area policies and processes.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with business analysts to understand business issues and provide solutions with the ability to articulate business process approaches.
  • Highly accountable and works well with the team to seek innovative solutions and can identify, design and configure the system to meet the company\xe2\x80\x99s objectives
  • Work closely with business member functions to facilitate effective solution implementations and provide knowledge transfer of system functionality to Super Users, Subject Matter Experts and end users.
  • Solid project management, facilitation and presentation skills
  • Basic knowledge of an SDLC process.
  • Ability to analyze and interpret incomplete or inconclusive information.
  • Solid working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and creating complex spreadsheets.

    -Or-

    An equivalent competency level acquired through a variation of these qualifications may be considered.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Typical Office Environment requirements include: reading, speaking, hearing, close vision, walking, bending, sitting, and occasional lifting up to 20 pounds.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential duties of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer. All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, order of protection status, national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, military status or an unfavorable discharge from military service.

Terumo BCT is committed to providing a safe and secure working environment. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing and detailed background verification checks. To this end, all employment offers for positions in the U.S. are conditional upon successful completion of Terumo BCT's pre-employment screening process. As of January 1, 2017 the Terumo BCT Lakewood, Colorado location will be a tobacco-free workplace. For more information about Terumo BCT, visit our website www.terumobct.com/careers .


Join Terumo BCT as we unlock the potential of blood. We are a global leader in blood component and cellular technologies, and the only company with the unique combination of apheresis collections, manual and automated whole blood processing, and pathogen reduction coupled with leading technologies in therapeutic apheresis and cell processing. We believe in the potential of blood to do even more for patients than it does today. This belief inspires our innovation and strengthens our collaboration with customers.

As the largest medical device manufacturing company headquartered in Colorado, we are home to more than 2,300 associates and our products are in use in more than 125 countries and territories. Our Global footprint includes more than 5,500 associates and partners with regional headquarters in Brussels, Buenos Aires, Singapore and Tokyo.

Our award-winning culture embraces:

title: Sr Enterprise Data Analyst

description:
b'
Goby is the leading cloud-based enterprise data platform for Accounts Payable Automation and ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) Solutions. We are seeking a bright, analytical, and highly motivated ESG Data Analyst to join Goby\xe2\x80\x99s ESG Consulting Team.
An ESG Data Analyst at Goby is responsible for:
  • Driving Portfolio Analytics of Environmental, Social, and Governance data (including energy, water, waste and GHG emissions) for disclosure frameworks such as GRESB, CDP, GRI, DJSI, SASB, and other public non-financial disclosures.
  • Performing quality assurance testing of data and reporting deliverables
  • Managing client and vendor communication on missing and incomplete data
  • Ensuring data is ready for project and client deadlines
  • Responsible for effectively completing tasks and managing projects in a timely and efficient manner
  • Managing the LEED data processing of purchasing invoices, waste tickets, maintenance records, submittal documentation and more
A strong candidate for the position will possess and/or be able to demonstrate the following skills and abilities:
  • Foundational knowledge of GRESB, CDP, GRI, DJSI, SASB and TCFD Frameworks (preferred, but not required)
  • 1-3 years of professional experience
  • Experience with and aptitude for technology and software
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Willingness to grow and learn
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and independent and adaptable worker
  • Creative thinker and problem-solver with a positive attitude
  • High level of proficiency in Microsoft software applications, particularly Excel is required
  • LEED Green Associate or Accredited Professional
  • Experience with large data sets and database management is a plus
  • Experience assessing GHG Inventories (specifically in the Real Estate Sector is a plus)
  • Experience using Salesforce.com is a plus
Benefits of working at Goby:
  • Dynamic, entrepreneurial company backed by venture capital
  • Casual dress code
  • Health care, 401(k), and employee stock option benefits
  • Office space in a classic Chicago Loop building. Office amenities include foosball & ping pong tables and a private outdoor patio; building amenities include 24-hour door staff, a health club, and a golf simulator.
This position is located in Chicago, Illinois.
This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship at this time.

description:
b'Job Introduction
FLEETCOR is seeking a Reporting Data Analyst that will support strategic business decisions through providing database querying, data analysis, and report/dashboard production.

Main Responsibilities

Primary duties and responsibilities will be to gather data, analyze data, and deliver accurate reports in a timely manner.
Must be proficient in MS Excel to analyze trends, check for anomalies, and provide management feedback.
This role will have exposure to senior managers and staff due to the nature of the work.

The Ideal Candidate

Bachelor Degree Required
Looking for a candidate who is 1-3 years out of school, preferably familiar with data analysis work.
The ideal candidate will have: the ability to independently develop, execute, and manage average to highly complex reports; strong problem-solving skills with some experience with database software/tools.
Not required, but preferred exposure to HR data and systems

About The Company
FLEETCOR Technologies (NYSE: FLT) is a leading global provider of commercial payment solutions. The Company helps businesses of all sizes better control, simplify and secure payment of their fuel, toll, lodging and other general payables. With its proprietary payment acceptance networks, FLEETCOR provides affiliated merchants with incremental sales and loyalty. FLEETCOR serves businesses, partners and merchants in North America, Latin America, Europe, and Australasia. For more information, please visit www.FLEETCOR.com.

Founded in 2000 and headquartered in Peachtree Corners, Georgia, FLEETCOR generates more than $2.25 billion in revenue through brands such as Fuelman and Comdata. We employ more than 8,000 valued associates worldwide.

FLEETCOR enjoys global recognition including:
Forbes Global Growth Champion \xe2\x80\x93 FLEETCOR is one of the 250 fastest growing companies in the world as determined by Forbes and Statista
Forbes World\xe2\x80\x99s Most innovative Companies \xe2\x80\x93 FLEETCOR has made this prestigious list of leading innovative companies 4 years in a row!
Fortune 1000 Company \xe2\x80\x93 FLEETCOR was one of the largest movers in the new rankings of the largest companies in America, rising 92 spots to #896
S&P 500 \xe2\x80\x93 In 2018, FLEETCOR joined the S&P stock index comprised of the 500 leading US stocks based on market cap (company value)

FLEETCOR has a culture founded on integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution and people. This offers each employee the opportunity to \xe2\x80\x98thrive & grow\xe2\x80\x99 thru career development, volunteer, community and wellness initiatives\xe2\x80\xa6allowing each individual to create a balance between professional goals and personal achievement.

Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact your local Human Resources Business Partner and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to.

For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links: EEO and Pay Transparency.

Package Description
If you are looking for a GREAT work environment with a GROWTH- ORIENTED company, look no further!

Benefits on the first of the month following your hire date- no matter when you are hired during the month!
Automatic enrollment into the 401k plan within your first thirty (30) days on the job: no more waiting until you\xe2\x80\x99ve been with the company for 1 year!
Projected company growth trajectory that shows double-digit year over year growth through both organic growth as well as acquisitions.
Fun environment with contests and prizes!
Inclusive environment that promotes career growth!
Monthly employee appreciation and wellness events!
An on-site gym and weekly discounted onsite car wash services
Robust PTO policy including: major holidays, vacation, sick days, and personal days
Discounts at major wireless providers, wholesale grocery stores, and gyms
Philanthropic support with both local and national organizations'
title: Reporting Data Analyst

description:
b'
Internship
Upper Hand is an end to end lifecycle software in sports and fitness designed to manage operations while using forward thinking innovation to drive growth. Upper Hand understands the people who work with our customers better than anyone else. Knowledge that helps our customers escape the administrative vortex of running a business so they can focus on developing clients with Upper Hand. From the front desk to the back office, we\xe2\x80\x99re delivering the tools needed to provide an industry leading experience to clients of sports organizations, an experience that simplifies life for parents while empowering staff to take their business up and to the right.

About the Position

As a Data Analyst you will play a key role in analyzing financial and user level data to improve the in-app experience for our software customers. You should be a sharp, curious, and analytic individual who has a passion for diving into data and building models to understand how businesses are performing relative to their peers. Your financial data insights will influence product design to drive improved acquisition, retention, and monetization.

What a Data Analyst Intern Does at UP?

  • Ability to look at data and form hypothesis and test methodologies to identify bad revenue models
  • Evaluate business questions and determine the data needed to answer them
  • Produces strategic insights to help business stakeholders make business decisions
  • Presents analysis conclusions to business stakeholders in a clear, understandable, and valuable way
  • Identifies and clearly articulates insights drawn from data to include both in person and web- based presentation of findings and recommendations
  • Queries data necessary to conduct analyses
  • Advises product teams about data capture needs
  • Documents financial analysis methodologies, conclusions, and business actions taken
  • Considers analysis transparency and reproducibility as best practices.
  • Communicates clearly (and as often as needed) with team members and business stakeholders
  • Supports senior team members with data identification and retrieval
Desired Skills and Experience

  • Pursuing undergraduate or graduate degree in in a quantitative related field, such as: Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field
  • Understanding for revenue modeling, budgeting, and cost analysis
  • Knowledge of probability, statistics, and descriptive and predictive modeling techniques preferred
  • Experience with or a strong desire to learn SQL to extract and clean data for analysis
  • Financial analysis, data mining, machine learning, or statistical modeling
  • Experience with a data visualization; Periscope Data is a plus
  • Ability to communicate insights using PowerPoint, Word and Excel to technical and non-technical audience
  • Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skills
'
title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
b"WHAT WE DO MATTERS:
Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 15 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, GigMasters, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life's milestones. From the proposal to creating a home, and starting a family together, we're there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE:
This Data Analyst will work with stakeholders within the marketing department of TKWW. They will help the client understand performance of our acquisition channels and conversion funnels.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Analyze TKWW user behavior and identify growth opportunities to drive acquisition and engagement
  • Create and manage dashboards in dashboarding tools like Qlik, Birst and Tableau, Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Excel and develop presentations to keep the team apprised of key trends
  • Communicate, collaborate and present results to clients within TKWW
  • Explore novel ways to look at our data
SUCCESSFUL DATA ANALYST CANDIDATES HAVE:
  • Background working within a marketing team in a data-driven environment
  • SQL and database experience
  • Experience with Google Analytics and BigQuery
  • Front-end Qlik, Birst or Tableau dashboard development
  • 2-3 years of hands-on web analytics or business intelligence
  • Commitment to timelines, accuracy, and professionalism
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment and shift gears quickly
  • Excellent communication and project management skills
  • You have a Bachelor or Master's Degree
  • Proficiency with R or Python a plus
WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:
  • You deeply understand our users and put them at the center of everything you do. You aim to serve and delight them every day.
  • You are respectful and act with the highest integrity. If you see something that isn't right, you say something.
  • You ask questions to understand a perspective and are comfortable respectfully challenging assumptions. You are not turned off by constructive conflict to get to the right answer.
  • You set clear ambitious goals. You anticipate obstacles, persevere, and are accountable for your commitments.
  • You aren't afraid to challenge the status quo and know that there's no such thing as failure if you learn from it.
  • You seek out feedback and never settle in your quest to grow and develop. By being here, you make our company stronger.
WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:
The Knot Worldwide offers a unique employee experience and we are deeply proud of our award-winning culture. From flexible vacation and generous parental leave benefits to promoting wellness and giving back to our community, we believe in happiness above all else\xe2\x80\x94in and out of the office.

----

The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, The Knot Worldwide complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. The Knot Worldwide expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

This position is not eligible for sponsorship."

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
$80,000 a year

GCC Technologies, founded in 1997 with headquarters in Oakland, Maryland, is a fast growing service-disabled Veteran owned Small Business and HUBZone company with an outstanding record of performance providing more effective and efficient acquisition, business process, administrative and security services to multiple federal agencies. GCC was recently ISO certified under ISO 9001:2015.

GCC is currently proposing on a Department of State BPA contracts that will be releasing Task Orders. To prepare for future positions that will be released, GCC would like to gather qualified and cleared applicants, preferably with Department of State experience, that are motivated and possess a "can-do" attitude. GCC is a company where your individual contribution is valued and recognized. With our rapid expansion the potential for growth is promising.

Job Description-General Responsibilities:

The Informational Technology Specialist works as a member of the recruitment marketing team and assist with statistical reporting for all aspects of the Department\xe2\x80\x99s national recruitment efforts.


Job Description-Essential Functions:

The Information Technology Specialist reports to the HR/REE Deputy Office Director. S/he works provides a wide variety of technical support services to the HR/REE staff. The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Provide reports derived for statistical analysis of hiring and onboarding data from the HR/REE Tracking Application (REETA).
  • S/he evaluates program functions and demographics, the implementation and effects of automated data processing, internet, and intranet procedures, and provides comprehensive reports to the Deputy Director and others in the office, as needed.
  • S/he coordinates with Bureau program and computer system managers in analysis of needs and management of data bases and automated systems for the Bureau of Human Resources.
  • S/he works closely with the Bureau\xe2\x80\x99s systems administrator to maintain the REE Tracking Application (REETA), including maintaining user-defined system tables; add, modifying or inactivating letter/email templates; creating data entry templates for new programs and updating the server with current status/standing for applicants/candidates.
  • S/he works closely with the Bureau\xe2\x80\x99s program and computer system managers to manage the office\xe2\x80\x99s online application system (Gateway to State), including providing support to applicants and to system users within HR/REE as well as other bureau\xe2\x80\x99s in the Department of State and serving as liaison between HR/REE and the system provider.
  • S/he prepare and presents reports of findings relevant to Recruitment program objectives, trends, demographic and results.
Preferred Experience:
  • S/he is experienced with Google Analytics, and works closely with the Marketing team to evaluate careers site data and prepares reports of findings relevant to audience, behavior, and acquisition.
  • S/he works closely with the Marketing team to evaluate the careers site customer satisfaction survey and develop recommendations to improve the user experience.

Clearance: Secret

Education: Bachelor's Degree, Additional years experience may be applied to Bachelor's Degree. A minimum of one (1) year of experience.

Company Description
GCC Technologies, LLC, is an equal opportunity employer regardless of race, color, religion, creed, sex, marital status, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, on-the-job injury, sexual orientation, political affiliation, or belief. Employment decisions are made without consideration of these or any other factors that employers are prohibited by law from considering. Any discriminatory action can be a cause for disciplinary action. GCC also prohibits discrimination against individuals with disabilities and will reasonable accommodate applicants with a disability, upon request, and will also ensure reasonable accommodation for employees with a disability. VETS encouraged to apply.
