title: Data Analyst I (Secret Clearance Req'd)

description:
b"

DATA ANALYST
JOB DESCRIPTION


ABOUT US

Amplion synthesizes the world\xe2\x80\x99s biomedical knowledge to accelerate Precision Medicine and enable confident strategic decisioning in drug and diagnostic development. The company's SaaS platform leverages machine learning to provide actionable intelligence across millions of disparate data sources, delivering the leading solution for pre-clinical and clinical evidence in the Life Sciences industry.

All of us at Amplion are extremely passionate about enabling the life science industry to deliver on the promise of precision medicine. No disruption of a major industry happens with an individual. It takes a great team, aligned around something meaningful and big. If you share in our passion and want to work for a growing company with the opportunity for professional growth with purpose, we\xe2\x80\x99d love to meet you.

THE ROLE

Amplion is focused on leveraging sophisticated machine learning to read sources of biological and scientific information and collect, analyze and categorize the world\xe2\x80\x99s biomarker knowledge. Amplion is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Business Intelligence and Analytics development team. You will work with our subject-matter experts to extract data from our proprietary databases to meet customer requirements.


RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE


  • Generate dashboards, reports and analytics from various Amplion databases, using Looker, SQL, python, and other software tools as necessary.
  • Develop new Looks for embedding in Amplion software products.
  • Develop familiarity with Amplion\xe2\x80\x99s data models to serve as the internal expert on what can be extracted from our systems.
  • Leverage external sources to enrich reports when necessary, with support from the Data Engineering team.


PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelors in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems or equivalent
  • 3-5 years experience in a Data Analyst role
  • Strong communication skills and a desire to join an exceptional team of Data Scientists and Technologists
  • Proficiency with SQL, Python and BI visualization experience (i.e. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
  • Relevant experience with Neo4j or general graph databases, Jupyter Notebook, Postgres, MySQL is preferred

  • Background in Life Sciences is preferred but not required


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


Amplion is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. At Amplion, we value diversity. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disabilities, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state and local law.
"
title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
Part-time, Contract
Are you interested in everything, always plugged into news and social trends, incredibly resourceful, and obsessed with getting details right? Great, stop reading and contact us.

We\xe2\x80\x99re Digital Third Coast. We create exciting visual narrative content for our clients and get that content placed on the most popular sites in the world, including Huffington Post, Forbes, Buzzfeed, Inc, Yahoo, Lifehacker, Mental Floss, the list goes on.

We have all kinds of clients, we tell all kinds of stories, and one of the foundations of our work is great research.

We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a someone with a wide range of interests, who\xe2\x80\x99s obsessed with news and trending topics, and who lives for finding great data. Oh, and you to be so meticulous you\xe2\x80\x99ll stand by your work\xe2\x80\x99s accuracy right before it\xe2\x80\x99s shared with 10 million people!

If you want to help create some of the most entertaining and educational content on the web, explore every subject imaginable, and have your work seen by millions of people around the world\xe2\x80\xa6 we\xe2\x80\x99re Digital Third Coast. Get at us.

As a freelance Research & Data Journalist, you\xe2\x80\x99ll work closely with our team to construct all kinds of stories for our clients to tell the outside world. You should be able to use a wide range of research tools and resources to deliver thorough, accurate research on deadline and you should be one of the most resourceful, curious people you know.

Commitment to delivering accurate, edited, organized, professional grade research on short deadlines is a must. The right candidate for this role has a strong analytical mind who can conduct thorough research and develop well-written research outlines that will eventually become online narratives. He/she should have an understanding of the digital media landscape and know how to mine popular publications and a wide variety of online resources, for the most up-to-date information available.

This is a freelance position with the possibility of in-office opportunities in Chicago.

Responsibilities:
  • Collect, analyze, record and organize research information/data
  • Follow research project guidelines
  • Provide feedback on research viability
  • Collaborate with creative teams to determine focus areas
  • Develop conceptual online narratives using research/data
  • Fact check and copy edit research documents and notify team when research is complete
Qualifications:
  • 3-5 years research and/or data analysis related experience
  • Demonstrated experience in research and data analysis
  • Excellent writing, grammar and communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and with minimal direct supervision
  • Excellent time management, organization, and attention to detail
  • Creative thinker with an analytical focus
  • Survey analysis and survey methodology experience a plus
  • Location in the Chicagoland area a plus, but not a requirement
'
title: Researcher/Data Analyst (Freelance)

description:
b'

Data Analyst

Who We Are and What We Value:

We are Innovative, Ethical, Collaborative, and Curious. These words don\xe2\x80\x99t just define us, but describe what it\xe2\x80\x99s like for our clients to work with us. We create loyalty and customer experiences through our innovative technology for major brands all over the world. We get to do fun, amazing, award-winning work for some of the biggest brands in entertainment, retail, banking, restaurant and telecommunications. If you love learning about the newest industry trends in an environment where exciting things happen every day, then you will love it here, as much as we do.

Who You Are and What You'll Do:

You are a Data Analyst with a strong desire to learn and become an integral part of our team. You will be responsible for delivering data-driven, actionable customer insights that directly contribute to increased sales/profit through our clients\xe2\x80\x99 customer loyalty programs. You will be using marketing techniques, working with large volumes of transactional data and using your keen understanding of advanced mathematics and statistical techniques. You excel at data visualization and communication. You also have a strong grasp on the latest trends in AI and Machine Learning. Most importantly, you will be helping shape the strategic direction of the loyalty programs for our clients.

What you\xe2\x80\x99ll do Day to Day:

  • Become the subject matter expert on your clients and discover key insights from their complex data
  • Provide actionable recommendations by drawing out key insights from in-depth, complex data sources based on a thorough understanding of the program objectives and developed using advanced mathematical analysis techniques
  • Explain insights to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Collaborate with other team members to provide actionable recommendations that drive customer success
  • Conduct or assist with analytic exercises, including customer segmentation strategies, acquisition modeling, retention modeling and more
  • Track and analyze program performance \xe2\x80\x93 from strategic initiatives to basic campaign execution
  • Provide ad-hoc data reporting for internal and external clients
  • Increase ROI of client direct marketing spend through data driven targeting recommendations
  • Develop or assist and report on campaign, customer, and program KPIs
  • Develop or assist loyalty customer acquisition, development, and retention programs


What's it Like to Work Here?

Kobie is a team. We challenge one another to design and engineer the world's best loyalty programs, supporting our clients from program design through rewards fulfillment. And we have a ton of fun along the way. We're extremely passionate about our clients, bringing fresh perspectives and diverse point of views. Together we embrace solutions and drive change. Every single one of us impacts our culture and has a real stake in the development of Kobie's rapidly growing business.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience that you will need to be successful in this role:

  • 4+ years relevant customer analytics and/or marketing/CRM experience
  • 4+ year of experience manipulating and analyzing complex data using Excel, SQL, SAS, SPSS, R, Python or similar tools
  • Strong analytical background (regression (ols and logistic ), clustering, decision trees\xe2\x80\xa6) and how they relate to marketing principles
  • Demonstrated success using customer segmentation techniques such as RFM, cluster analysis and regression modeling to drive targeted marketing
  • Ability to manage working on multiple projects at a time
  • Strong oral and written communication skills

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Experience that will help you stand out as a candidate:

  • SAS programming experience preferred, Macros, Enterprise Guide, Enterprise Miner or Viya
  • Retail, telecom and/or financial industry experience

Education:

  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Statistics, Marketing, Economics, or Computer/Data Science
  • Master\xe2\x80\x99s in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics or other quantitative field will make us look twice, ok more than twice.

'
title: Data Analyst

description:
b"

Data Analyst Boston (also running ad in PGH) Mar 2019

The Boston (Charlestown) office of MARC USA / Cogniscient Media is hiring a progressive Data Analytics pro, with a Digital Media focus. Our Data Analysts work with agency and client teams to plan, measure, and optimize digital media campaigns. Analysts help to develop strategic measurement and testing plans, design and manage performance reports and dashboards, and help clients translate raw data into meaningful insights and recommendations. This individual should have strong attention to detail, excellent communication and presentation skills, and experience analyzing and modeling data from a variety of sources.


Your Role \xe2\x80\x93 What You'll Be Doing:

  • Help develop campaign measurement strategies for clients across a wide range of industries
  • Extract, transform, load and blend data from multiple sources, while maintaining strict standards for data quality and accuracy
  • Utilize a variety of web analytics, data management and business intelligence tools (Google Analytics, DART, SQL, Power BI, Excel, etc.)
  • Design, develop and maintain client-facing reports and dashboards to visualize key patterns and trends
  • Collaborate with cross-agency teams to develop data-driven insights and recommendations, optimize media performance, and identify opportunities to deliver added value and enhance client relationships
  • Develop and execute test designs and ad hoc analyses
  • Develop and present findings to clients and senior-level stakeholders

To excel in this role, you should have the following:

  • Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Math, Statistics, Economics, Data Analytics or a related field
  • 1-2 years of data analytics experience required
  • Proven data manipulation and analysis skills in SQL and Excel (familiarity with Microsoft Power BI, DOMO, VBA a plus)

Please visit us at www.marcusa.com or https://cogniscientmedia.com/

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"
Provides subject matter expertise to departmental and corporate projects, by pulling data or creating scenarios needed for testing, validation, and root cause analysis on all types of claims, adjustments, for enhancements, updates, benefits and pricing as to impacts and resolutions. Ensure accuracy and understanding of operational processes to identify true end to end testing for optimal results.
Department: Ops-Provider Operations
Reports to: Manager, Operations
Location: W. Idlewild Ave, Tampa, FL 33634
Essential Functions:
  • Acts as Claims Department subject matter expert on departmental and corporate projects. Supports business definition and testing efforts, attends project meetings, and provides internal and external status reports.
  • Works with management and associates to document current business and workflow processes and collaborates in identifying, defining and documenting process improvement options and alternatives.
  • Prepares detail and summary level reports including written interpretation of analytic results for senior management.
  • Analyzes and trends claims issues, performs true root cause analysis and determines next steps for resolution and process improvement.
  • Researches issues, compiles feedback and drafts corresponding business requirements documents and business decision documents as needed.
  • Participates on conference calls with supervisor/manager/director other departments to provide project status, communicate changes in processes, and issue resolution.
  • Communicates test findings in a structured report format.
  • Build strong cross functional relationships that can be leveraged to understand issues that would not be in the sample size.
  • Escalate issues when on issue results in multiple discrepancies.
  • Assist supervisor, manager, and/or director with projects and problem resolution as required.
  • Runs and analyzes ad-hoc reports.
  • Formulates and applies analytical reports using the company\xe2\x80\x99s database to develop and interpret information that assists in developing test cases.
  • Tests validity of data using related software, service, manual calculations, or products. Frequently concentrates on collecting and analyzing data and developing test case scenarios both positive and negative.
  • Recommends processes or updates to current workflow as a result of research or analysis.
  • Provides assistance and support as needed to develop training material on new updates and enhancements.
  • Responsible for special projects that require analytical skills, forward-thinking whereby data is analyzed from different angles to think of the unknown, test the process.
  • Track and follow-up on all assigned high-level discrepancies, utilizing systems and procedures.
  • Maintain a high standard of data integrity, including systems and reports.
Additional Responsibilities:

  • Preferred A Bachelor's Degree in a related field or equivalent directly related experience
Candidate Experience:

  • Advanced Demonstrated problem solving skills
  • Advanced Demonstrated written communication skills
  • Advanced Demonstrated interpersonal/verbal communication skills
  • Advanced Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from peers and management Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Licenses and Certifications:
A license in one of the following is required:

Technical Skills:

  • Required Intermediate Microsoft Excel
  • Required Intermediate Microsoft Project
  • Required Intermediate Microsoft Visio
  • Preferred Intermediate Microsoft Access
  • Required Intermediate Other Knowledge of Perot / Peradigm system

title: Claims Data Analyst

description:
b"

Operational Data & Analytics plays an important role in Catasys' fundamental digital transformation. OD&A will transform the underlying technical data infrastructure, as well as create a culture of data enthusiasm and curiosity. We will develop a community of data storytellers supported by a common data layer, instrumentation and tools, and ongoing learning. Insights will support a culture of experimentation to drive value for members and customers.

Responsibilities & Education

As a newly-formed discipline, OD&A is seeking to build a foundational team. We require an experienced Data Analyst to support our vision of creating a company-wide culture of analytical rigor that prizes evidence. The role will evolve with the organization and initial responsibilities will include the following.

Business Analyst

  • Participate in analytics and reporting needs discovery, analytics & reporting design, and validation.
  • Collaborate with Product Manager on leading, growing, and moderating the Analytics community.
  • Capture and share learnings to drive continual improvements in products and process, and software design and development.

Data Detective

  • Deep dive into cross-functional source systems, interview domain experts to create and maintain a detailed Data Map and define additional Documentation Discovery.

Data Storytelling

  • Understand the business's analytics and reporting needs and collaborate to create insightful visualizations, initially in Power BI.

Skills and Experience

  • Analytical Skills: proficiency with large amounts of data from disparate sources, a demonstrated ability to plan and deliver complex analyses, and proven experience with statistical analysis.
  • Education: MS degree or equivalent experience using applied analytics.
  • Study Design: Fluency with exploratory analysis, developing hypotheses and methods to test them, and executing the research.
  • Communication: strong skills translating data into an actionable insight and communicating complex ideas via speaking, writing, and visuals.
  • Sharp Attention to Detail: precision and vigilance to ensure accuracy.
  • Curiosity: eagerness to experiment, learn, and grow.

title: Operational Data & Analytics Data Analyst

description:
b'
Internship
Samsara hardware products are plug and play, and core to the product portfolio. The hardware team is responsible for industrial design, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and supply chain. Everyone on the team has a large impact in bringing products to market. We focus on the key creative/design/problem-solving and bolster our development resources with top JDMs, toolmakers, and suppliers.

The Data Analytics Engineering Intern is will own and lead projects from end-to-end. You'll dive into complex datasets to analyze trends, identify opportunities and quantify the potential value of new products and initiatives. This role is dynamic in that you will be responsible for collecting, scoping, implementing and extracting learnings from large datasets for the engineering and operations team!

Responsibilities:
  • Use best practices to build data architecture and combine multiple data streams so that our business users can read results in SQL, Big Query and one-off reports.
  • Use a data-driven, user-centric approach to grow and optimize the business
  • Manage multiple projects with shifting priorities ensuring delivery of updates and releases by aggressive deadlines.
  • Identifying, analyzing and reporting on performance and KPIs such as device field performance metrics, manufacturing data, cohort analyses, demand planning, returns metrics etc.
  • Provide data to operations and engineering teams to size and quantify product changes.
  • Help optimize team efficiency by refining our supply/demand matching
  • Proactively identify areas for improvement in the business through data
  • Proliferate a data-driven culture
Qualifications:
  • Studying a major focused on analytics, data science or statistics
  • Strong applied analytics - you love data, gleaning insights from data, and making decisions based on data
  • Comfortable with both engineering data and business analytics
  • Experience with mySQL (or similar), R and Python
  • Experience with Google Analytics and Tableau
  • Quantitative analysis - you have experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets using SQL(or graphQL) and understand basic statistics; experience with advanced visualization tools is a plus
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills - effectively presenting insights is as important as the insights themselves
  • Can work cross-functionally, particularly with engineering, product and growth teams
  • Creative, scrappy
  • Excellent quantitative and data analytics skills
  • Team-player: we rely on each other to be candid, supportive, hardworking and genuine
At Samsara, we welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.'

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"Our mission at Suplari is to shine the light on waste so that companies can invest in growth, innovation and their people. Suplari\xe2\x80\x99s software leverages machine learning and AI technologies to deliver actionable insights from a company\xe2\x80\x99s spend and procurement data and easily visualizes these tailored recommendations and data trends in a clean, user-friendly interface. Customers realize hard dollar cost savings and effectively manage supplier risk that is often hidden within millions of data points and takes hours of manpower and clunky spreadsheets to uncover.

Suplari is truly making an impact for clients such as Nordstrom, 21st Century Fox, Tesla and Sonos, (just to name a few) and we\xe2\x80\x99re just getting started. We\xe2\x80\x99re aiming to \xe2\x80\x9cshare the wealth\xe2\x80\x9d by providing businesses with the tools to reduce spend, mitigate risk and increase compliance, and we need your help!

Job Description

Suplari is seeking a talented, entry-level Data Analyst to work on our customer success team at our downtown Seattle office HQ.

Do you like focusing on challenging problems and finding creative solutions? Would you like to help create something that makes a difference? Do you like to be part of a fast-growing company and be able to put your mark on something early? As an integral member of our customer success team, the data analyst will work with a variety of Fortune 2000 companies extracting, cleansing, and integrating their financial data into Suplari. Motivated by customer obsession, the data analyst will leverage their expertise working with large, complex sets of data to ensure that our enterprise partners are seeing value from Suplari.

What you'll be doing:
  • Ensuring the success of Suplari pilot customers by reviewing their data and making sure that it is correctly formatted and uploaded to Suplari; this involves normalization and categorization of large, unclean data sets
  • Using your technical skillset to improve and streamline internal processes on the customer success team, so that we can best serve our customers' needs
  • Serving as a data resource for customers, both internal and external
  • Be a go to person at Suplari to tackle challenging data problems
  • You will become an in-house expert on our Suplari platform, and have a hand in improving our product and features based on your product knowledge and customer feedback
What you bring:
  • ~1 year experience performing financial and ad hoc analysis using data reporting tools and experience with advanced Excel functions
  • Basic working knowledge of Python or other scripting language(s)
  • You can quickly establish credibility and good relationships with a variety of financial and procurement professionals
  • You have critical attention to detail and strong analytical thinking skills
  • You are great at wrangling enterprise data with existing tools but you are more excited by the opportunity to help build something better and streamline processes
  • You are hungry to learn and build a career in technology
  • You are willing to do what it takes to make a customer successful with Suplari
Education/Training:
  • BA/BS Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering, Business Informatics, Data and/or similar discipline with analytical bias
We\xe2\x80\x99d love to hear from you if:
  • You love being a part of a small, dynamic, and agile organization that encourages you to learn and grow
  • You love finding solutions to interesting problems
  • You welcome having autonomy with complex tasks
  • You are passionate about using your experience and expertise to inspire the team
Why Suplari?
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Ownership through equity and options
  • Comprehensive, company-paid medical, dental, and vision benefits
  • Been there, done that team: Our management team has a track record of success at companies such as HP, Amazon, Apptio, Skytap, iConclude, Trulia, and Zillow
  • Suplari is backed by top tier venture capital investors Madrona Venture Group, Shasta Ventures, Amplify Partners, Two Sigma Ventures and Workday Ventures
  • Ability to make a critical impact at an early stage company
Location and other information:
  • This is an entry-level position located in our downtown Seattle office HQ
  • We are not interviewing remote employees at this time
  • Suplari will not offer visa sponsorship for this position
Suplari is an equal opportunity employer!"
title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Junior Data Analyst

(Westlake Village, CA)

Founded in June 1996, VS Media is an industry leader specializing in highly interactive, high-traffic, live video chat websites. Spanning the globe with over 200 million visitors per month and 80 million ads per day, we provide a platform for people to discover new kinds of interactive content through live video and chat services. Our size and scale stretches across every continent, delivering powerful technology to enhance our clients\xe2\x80\x99 online presence. From streaming live video to billing solutions to gamification development, we leverage the latest technology to provide the best digital experience possible.


About the Job

VS Media is currently looking for an organized and thoughtful Junior Data Analyst to enhance our Media Buying team. Internally, the title will be referred to as \xe2\x80\x9cPPC Media Buyer\xe2\x80\x9d and will report to the Media Buying Manager. The team operates in-house, during regular business hours, and on many platforms. Platforms include Google AdWords and adult industry ad networks, though the team also works with direct publishers and brokers.

The individual that succeeds in this role is someone who is both analytical and decisive. He/She enjoys and thrives in a fast-paced, challenging environment. This candidate will need to be extremely resourceful and able to collaborate in a team environment. Previous experience in a Media Buying, Advertising or Marketing role is preferred. Proper training on the team\xe2\x80\x99s policies and procedures will be provided.


Areas of Training and Responsibilities

  • Learn VS Media\xe2\x80\x99s Media Buying processes.
  • Assess high-volume advertising spending to determine future buys.
  • Perform daily account management on various advertising accounts.
  • Assist in the maintenance and monitoring of ad placement, account daily and monthly budget caps, impression share, quality score and other important account metrics.
  • Generate weekly and monthly analytical reporting for all major metrics, goals tracking, revenue tracking and other initiatives.
  • Create and test new ad placements.

Qualities of an Ideal Candidate

  • Adaptive to changing and fast-paced, teamwork environment while maintaining composure and a positive attitude.
  • Analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills.
  • Able to think critically, and identify and resolve problems.
  • Strong ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline-driven atmosphere.
  • Ability to clearly and effectively articulate summaries.
  • Ability to learn new industries and new business types quickly and can apply this knowledge to internet advertising initiatives and achieve department goals.
  • High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation, but able to take direction and execute when given a task.

Helpful Experience

  • Dynamic, can-do attitude who seeks creative methods of problem solving.
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task job responsibilities.
  • Outstanding interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong knowledge in Microsoft Office with an emphasis on Microsoft Excel.
  • Has a background, work experience or education, in Statistical Analysis, Finance, Mathematics or Accounting.
  • Experience with Google Analytics or Google AdWords is appreciated, but not necessary for this role, as the education will be provided.

As we are an internet-focused tech company, please note that we do manage adult-oriented content. This position does not directly involve working around such explicit material on a regular basis, but employees will likely notice content on a colleague\xe2\x80\x99s screen or communicate with representatives in the adult entertainment industry. Therefore, it is imperative that the ideal candidate have no issue with this aspect of the business. Please take a look at https://www.flirt4free.com for an example. VS Media understands and respects that such content is not suitable for all applicants.

Compensation will include hourly pay and incentive bonus plan (after one year of employment). Full benefits package including health/dental/vision and an attractive 401k plan.

For consideration please send along your resume, cover letter and hourly requirements.

'
title: Junior Data Analyst (Media Buying)

description:
b'

Job Description:

Company description:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 125 years and today has one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest news gathering operations globally. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America\xe2\x80\x99s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barron\xe2\x80\x99s, MarketWatch, Financial News, DJX, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.

The Wall Street Journal is America\xe2\x80\x99s largest newspaper by paid circulation with more than 2.2 million customers. In recent years, the Journal has expanded its core content offering to include coverage of the arts, culture, lifestyle, sports, and personal health, building on its heritage as the leading source of business and financial news. Published by Dow Jones, one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest news gathering operations with nearly 2,000 journalists in more than 80 bureaus, The Wall Street Journal now spans 12 editions in nine languages, engaging readers across newspapers, websites, magazines, social media, and video. The Journal holds 35 Pulitzer Prizes for outstanding journalism.

Dow Jones Analytics Team

The Dow Jones Analytics team comprises of a central group of Reporting / Analysts and insight specialists that empower the Dow Jones businesses to make data led informed decisions. They are based out of three main locations (Princeton, NJ; New York, and London)

Position Statement: Working closely with internal clients to define, implement, monitor an analytics suite of reports and provide insight into the numbers to help improve business outcomes.

Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:

  • Overseeing daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboards and building new using Tableau off of the new Customer Data Lake
  • interpreting trends from the data and working closely with stakeholders to enable them to understand the dynamics behind the data.

Preferred Tools/Skills:

Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy

Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, please reach out to us at TalentResourceTeam@dowjones.com . Please put \xe2\x80\x9cReasonable Accommodation" in the subject line.

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 125 years and today has one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest news gathering operations globally. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America\xe2\x80\x99s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barron\xe2\x80\x99s, MarketWatch, Financial News, DJX, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (NASDAQ: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

title: Data Analyst

description:
b"iSolved HCM is an industry-leading Human Capital Management technology company that brings together the key workforce functions in one robust, easy-to-use platform, iSolved. Payroll, HR, Time & Attendance, Onboarding, ACA Compliance, and Benefits Enrollment are all delivered from one solution, in the cloud, specifically built for the small to mid-sized employer. We transform the way our customers manage their most import asset their people.
BRIEF STATEMENT OF THE PURPOSE OF THIS POSITION
The primary responsibility of this role is to extract, analyze, map and electronically convert data from various customer platforms into Infinisource's iSolved platform to ensure a smooth conversion of customer's data onto our HCM software. Experience with Microsoft Access, Advanced Excel, and Power BI/ Power Query is required. Quality and accuracy are extremely important.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THIS POSITION
Create programs, methodologies, and files for analyzing and importing data from customers' payroll, accounting and HRIS platforms as required by project plan.
Design and construct statements of work
Extract Data from legacy systems
Map and transform data from legacy systems
Use various tools such as PDF2Excel and Power Query to manipulate data into workable format
Convert PDF Data to Excel
Troubleshoot errors
Facilitate satisfactory communication and resolution of problems and works with various members of implementation and project team to ensure customer deadlines are met.
Examine data quality, applications, and functions
Provide accurate and appropriate interpretation of data, applying knowledge to evaluation, analysis, and importing of data.
Communicate regularly and effectively with team members and management, and communicates results effectively to management, project team and/or customers.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED FOR THIS POSITION
2 years' experience with Microsoft Access, Advanced Excel and Power BI/Power Query is required.
Superior analytical and problem-solving skills required
Bachelor's degree or 5 years equivalent work experience
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED FOR THIS POSITION
Required are strong technical aptitude and an understanding of the business and service and implementation procedures. The individual must be a motivated team player that is well organized and detail oriented with demonstrated problem solving and decision making abilities. Computer skills in Microsoft Access, Advanced Excel, and Power BI/ Power Query are required.
Familiarity with HCM solutions and/or the payroll industry is also desired.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT
Normal working conditions require normal to close concentration, visual attention and manual dexterity. Lifting requirements less than 10 pounds. Moderate noise.

DISCLAIMER:
The lists under Essential Functions and Additional Responsibilities are not exhaustive, but are merely the most accurate lists for the current job. Management reserves the right to revise the job description and to require that other tasks be performed when the circumstances of the job change."
title: HCM Data Analyst

description:
b"At some point everyone ends up lost and uninformed in the healthcare system, eventually paying too much for care they may not have needed. We've all been there.

That's why we created Vim \xe2\x80\x94 to save healthcare.

Patients need a trusted guide for their healthcare journey and doctors need tools to help reduce their administrative burden and focus them on delivering the best quality care at a cost their patients can afford. At Vim, we are using technology to create a value-based healthcare marketplace to increase the quality of care and reduce costs.

We need people who believe that healthcare can change. Come join us!

Your role as a Data Analyst at Vim:
Vim has unique access to health insurance and electronic health record data. Our goal is to use our unique access to this information to help our members and their providers improve the health of the populations we serve. You will be part of the team responsible to organize and transform this data into actionable insights that will help Vim members and providers. In doing so, you will:

  • Create dashboards and reports that measure KPIs for enterprise customers and partners on Vim's progress and results
  • Respond to and work with customers to process external reporting requests
  • Train internal teams in simple SQL using dashboards and data visualization tools
  • Work with customers on data transfer processes including SFTP, API including documenting these processes
  • Respond to and define data and reporting requests and coordinate with internal teams to solve and execute
  • Research trends in key business metrics for internal and external stakeholders
  • Work with our CMO (Chief Medical Officer) to write data requests and data use cases to justify acquisition of highly sensitive data from large enterprise health plan clients
  • Work with our engineering team to ingest, analyze, map, and document various data sets and troubleshoot data integrity and data quality issues
  • Work with our product team to build consumer and provider facing tools that help them make better healthcare decisions
  • Work with our clinical team to build analytical systems and visualizations that enrich the care experience for our consumers and providers
  • Develop expertise in healthcare and population health
Requirements needed so you can be successful:
  • Bachelor's degree in quantitative discipline (Applied Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, etc.) or 2+ years of quantitative professional experience.
  • At least 2 years of professional work experience performing the majority of the duties above. If you have not, unfortunately we can't consider you for this role at this time.
  • Strong knowledge of SQL is required. If you are not at least an intermediate in SQL, then this opportunity will not be right for you.
  • Experience identifying data and executing complex data queries using multiple relational databases and data sources
  • Experience with data visualization and crafting narratives from data
  • Excellent communication skills including distilling results of complex analysis for a non-technical audience
  • Resiliency and creativity in the face of data access barriers, incomplete and insufficient data. Attention to details while prioritizing what is important
  • Self starter, proactive, enthusiastic learner
  • Keen attention to details and timelines
  • Strong communicator with teams
Nice to have, but certainly not necessary:
  • Project Management background
  • Healthcare experience, working with claims and EMR data a big plus
  • Python, Git, knowledge of R preferred but not required
About us: We are headquartered in San Francisco, with R&D in Tel Aviv, and are backed by GreatPoint Ventures, Optum, Sequoia Israel and large BCBS payers. Our customers include health plans and at-risk healthcare systems."

At Brightree, we believe in building innovative technology solutions and providing services that improve clinical and business performance to the post-acute healthcare industry. We serve home medical equipment (HME), home health and hospice providers with robust solutions that follow their natural workflows to automate and improve how they manage their businesses, serve patients and protect reimbursements. title: Data Analyst and Reporting Manager

description:
b'
Internship

Position:

Reporting/Data Analyst Intern

Job Description:

Reporting/ Data Analyst Intern - Full-time - Summer 2019

Job Description:

Interviews: October 2018 - March 2019

Internship: Approximately 11 weeks; mid-May/mid-June to August/September. Candidates must be available to be in Denver, CO on June 17th, 2019 and through at least August 16, 2019

Based on your experience and interests, you will interview with and work on a team for approximately 11 weeks during the summer. Interns may be considered for potential full-time opportunities on based on their internship performance.

Who is Arrow Electronics?

Arrow Electronics is a global provider of products, services and solutions to industrial and commercial users of electronic components and enterprise computing solutions. Arrow serves as a supply channel partner for more than 150,000 original equipment manufacturers, value-added resellers, contract manufacturers, and commercial customers through a global network. The company maintains over 300 sales facilities and 45 distribution and value-added centers, serving over 80 countries.

A Fortune 113 company with 18,800 employees worldwide, Arrow brings technology solutions to a breadth of markets, including telecommunications, information systems, transportation, medical, industrial and consumer electronics.

Arrow provides specialized services and expertise across the entire product lifecycle. Arrow does this by connecting customers to the right technology at the right place, right time and right price

Arrow provides extraordinary value to customers and suppliers - the best technology companies in the world - and connects them through the company's industry-leading services.

Why Be an Intern?

  • Hands-on approach to learning and applying your degree
  • Chance to network with 125 interns across the U.S.
  • Small forums with our Executives and past interns
  • Stretch your presentation skills in front of our VP\xe2\x80\x99s and Directors

Functional Area

We have an exciting opportunity for Reporting/Data Analyst Intern to work full time over the summer. The IT/ Computer Information Systems Intern will develop applications that are used by Arrow\xe2\x80\x99s core businesses, as well as external customers, to deliver data and performance reports. The intern will provide data analysis focusing on the business needs and drivers. They will focus on the definition, construction, and deployment of reports, dashboards, metrics and analytic components within a dynamic and high profile business intelligence environment.

Requirements & Skills

  • Currently enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Equivalent with a graduation date no earlier than December 2019
  • Available to work full-time (40 hours/week) during the summer (May or June through Mid-August)
  • 3.0 GPA or Higher
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize based on opportunities and effectively multitask
  • Experience using Microsoft Office
  • Detail oriented mindset

Compensation

This is a paid position.

Location:

Denver (Panorama)

Time Type:

Full time

Job Category:

Non-Customer Facing/Supplier Facing

title: Data Analyst (Intern)

description:
b'
Part-time, Temporary, Internship

We are looking for Data Analyst Intern to join our Summer 2019 Intern Program. Our Interns don\xe2\x80\x99t make coffee or sit around bored. Instead, you will play an integral role in our success by conducting data acquisition, management, and visualization, improving transparency for investigative journalists, law enforcement bodies, and civil society organizations worldwide. Read more about the role and requirements below. Applications for this position will be open until March 1, 2019.

WHAT YOU\xe2\x80\x99LL DO:

The Data Analyst Intern will develop expertise in manipulating and analyzing open-source data in a variety of different languages and formats.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Data Parsing

  • Data Scraping

  • Data Visualization

  • Data Processing

  • Data Cleaning

  • Dashboard Maintenance

WHAT WE\xe2\x80\x99RE LOOKING FOR:

An ideal candidate should have some working knowledge of Python or R, although R is strongly preferred. The candidate should have some experience working with ggplot2, dplyr, and other tidyverse libraries. The candidate should also have some working knowledge of regular expression. This is an opportunity to learn on the job, work directly with the Data team in a fast-paced environment, and build a portfolio. Familiarity with javascript, node.js, d3.js, react, or sql a definite plus, but not necessary.

HOW TO APPLY

Please send us your cover letter, resume, and a sample project or product. Incomplete applications will not be considered. Applicants must be eligible to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Please include the position name in the subject of your email and direct all inquiries and applications to internships@c4ads.org. Applications will be considered on a rolling basis.

Interns receive a monthly stipend of $1,000 for full-time positions, which is prorated for part-time positions.

If you don\xe2\x80\x99t think you\xe2\x80\x99re qualified but love what we\xe2\x80\x99re doing, please apply anyway! We\xe2\x80\x99d love to hear from you.

We are committed to creating an exciting and rewarding work environment for our staff by providing equal opportunity for all positions of employment to qualified employees without regard to gender, race, color, sexual orientation, ethnic or national origin, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, military status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local laws. We are fully committed to the objective of furthering equality of opportunity in recruiting, hiring, training, educating, and recognizing all personnel.

Due to the high volume of applications, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Data Analysis - Data Analyst

description:
b'
We are:

The Wix Business Analysis (BA) group, 90 business analysts and data scientists who strongly believe in using analytics to understand how our users interact with our products. With over 130 million users, we collect over a billion events a day \xe2\x80\x93 that\xe2\x80\x99s 1TB of data added daily! We do it all using cutting edge technology to process, store, & query our data, including tools we develop ourselves as well as tools like Hadoop and Presto.

You are:

An SQL expert who\xe2\x80\x99s also highly skilled in data analysis and visualization (Excel/Tableau/similar). You have 2+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in quantitative analysis, preferably for an internet company. You\xe2\x80\x99re an excellent communicator with the ability to deliver results of analyses clearly and effectively. You also have a strong sense of curiosity and a desire to learn & be part of a high-tech, internet-based industry. You know how to harness complex organizational interfaces, and initiate and drive projects from beginning to end with minimal guidance.

Bonus points if you have a BSc/BA in a highly quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics or engineering; are familiar and experienced with product experiments (A/B tests); know Python, R or any other scripting language; have experience working with Big Data, especially Hadoop environment and have experience working with BI tools.

As a Business/Data Analyst, you will:
  • Analyze and optimize products and activities, take part in design and implementation, and be a key part of strategic product decisions.
  • Build and maintain reports, dashboards and metrics, in addition to monitoring the integrity and validity of the data reported.
  • See beyond numbers and help to inform, influence, support and execute our business decisions.
  • Conduct customer analysis\xe2\x80\x93churn, behavior, segmentation, trends, customer value and more.
  • Work with large amounts of data and build tools to streamline the process.
  • Work as part of a company-wide department that supports Product Managers, Marketing, Finance & Management.

title: Business/Data Analyst - DeviantArt

description:
b'

Responsible for data acquisition and ongoing data integrity in University Advancement systems. Works independently to analyze, compare, manipulate, and transform data sets in preparation for upload into an SQL environment using appropriate technical functionality. Assesses software and resource needs based on project; selects and adapts software to meet specific needs. Identifies problems, anticipates needs, and resolves data issues. Creates and maintains documentation for processes, exceptions, and decision making criteria for projects and ongoing processes.

The data analyst will manage multiple small and large-scale data projects in a high-volume and complex environment. Serves as business analyst to gather requirements, create and facilitate test cases and work with business users and application developers. Develops queries to monitor and maintain data quality and troubleshoot data issues. Exercises independent decision making while being responsible for analyzing data for accuracy, completeness and consistency.

This position will require a strong attention to detail, critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills; excellent interpersonal and organizational skills and advanced proficiency in MS office. All members of Advancement are part of creating an inclusive culture that inspires an exceptionally diverse and talented team and are measured on their adherence to the following core competencies: leadership, continuous improvement, teamwork and collaboration, and communication/interpersonal effectiveness.


Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Information Systems or equivalent combination of education and experience; two years of experience writing complex Microsoft T-SQL queries to extract data from multiple data systems, integrate and analyze data; two years of experience working with data warehouses and large data sets.

Desired Qualifications

Three years working with Microsoft T-SQL; experience researching, analyzing, and interpreting information; general knowledge of relational databases; experience with Microsoft SQL Management Studio.

title: Contract Data Analyst

description:
b"

The Chicago office of Milliman Inc. is looking for enthusiastic and qualified candidates to join its Cyber Risk Solutions practice.

We are a focused, multi-disciplinary team of actuaries, data analysts, and risk management professionals working together to develop data-driven solutions for a diverse array of corporate clients, including insurance companies, professional licensing organizations, and stock exchanges. Our work includes cyber risk quantification, lapse and mortality modeling, stock index automation, and predictive modeling research.

About Milliman:

Milliman is among the world's largest providers of actuarial and related products and services. Founded in 1947, Milliman is an independent firm with offices in major cities around the globe. We are owned and managed by our principals\xe2\x80\x94senior consultants whose selection is based on their technical, professional and business achievements. With more than 70 years of consulting experience, Milliman is well-positioned to help clients analyze, understand, and mitigate risk in an era of regulatory change and financial uncertainty.

Job Responsibilities:

Full-time role:

Cyber risk (10%)

  • Conduct and improve cyber breach case studies
  • Assist with cyber model research and development

Data analysis (50%)

  • Assist with data acquisition efforts
  • Code reviews and documentation
  • Assist with the administration and maintenance of back end systems
  • Other client support, if applicable

Risk advisory & internal support (40%)

  • Assist with risk model enhancement
  • Create and review sales decks
  • Assist with marketing efforts
  • Other client support, if applicable

Required Skills:

The ideal candidate should have the following experience and attributes:

  • GPA: 3.2 +
  • Up to 3 years of experience
  • Either: Major in a STEM subject, or have a substantial amount of STEM-related coursework
  • Strong quantitative background with data analysis experience
  • Proficiency in Excel
  • Knowledge of at least one programming language (preferably R or Python)
  • Familiarity with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Azure/AWS)
  • Basic knowledge of Cybersecurity, IT infrastructure
  • Understanding of financial statements and accounting concepts
  • Ability to analyze and apply creative problem solving both independently and within a team
  • Passionate about topics in cyber risk, risk management, and have business sense
  • Self-motivated individual with a sense of intellectual curiosity and a results-oriented work ethic
  • Ability to work within a fast-paced, diverse working environment
  • Detail-oriented, collaborative, eager to learn, and proactive

Qualifications

Behaviors

Required

Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor\xe2\x80\x99s legal duty to furnish information.

title: Volunteer-Data Analyst

description:
b"

Do you want to work for an organization that Makes a Lasting Impact on Kids?

AMIkids has served over 136,000 kids and their families since 1969.Being part of the AMIkids team means that you are helping youth to realize their full potential and become a valuable part of their community.

OUR MISSION \xe2\x80\x94 AMIkids is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping youth develop into responsible and productive citizens. AMIkids' mission is to protect public safety and positively impact as many youth as possible through the efforts of a diverse and innovative staff. AMIkids works in partnership with youth agencies, local communities and families.

OUR VISION \xe2\x80\x94 Separating a troubled past from a bright future.

Our Guiding Principles: Kids First, Family and Safety.
Our Core Values: Respect, Creativity, Honesty, Enthusiasm, Loyalty, Integrity, Leadership, Diversity, Goal Orientation, Excellence and Dedication.

Now, you can be a part of this outstanding organization and help guide the way. Take the step. Make a difference.

We are currently seeking a Research Data Analyst

Position Summary

The role of the Research Data Analyst is to serve and support the data related aggregation, use and reporting needs of AMIkids, Inc., along with external customers and affiliate Institutes of the mission. The Research Data Analyst is responsible for the validation of data held within the AMIkids internal database system, and the use of data in communicating with other stakeholders in the data collecting, distributing and sharing processes. The Research Data Analyst is responsible to ensure the accuracy of state billing via comparison of SIS data and monthly billing and attendance reports.

Essential Job Duties
  • Create and distribute reoccurring data reports (KID Count, Key Performance Indicator Reports, monthly Operations Report, etc.)
  • Develop and frequently examine Program data collection processes, data submissions and related information to ensure data integrity,
  • Work with the Director of Research and Data to assist in the conduction research; assist in the preparation of charts, graphs, tables, papers and related documents and materials as needed
  • Effectively collect relevant data using industry standard research methods,
  • Create and disseminate descriptive data reports, literature reviews, and/or queries in response to request for data,
  • Assist in providing training, guidance and technical assistance to AMIkids, Inc. and Program team members in the areas of data collection, data entry, and overall function of the internal data system as needed,
  • Work closely with Regional Directors and/or Program Executive Directors to ensure information system codes comply with current policy and make changes and/or updates as needed,
  • Ensure accuracy of state billing by comparing billing against internal data,
  • Work with Information Technology to ensure maintenance, updates and overall reliability of data systems,
  • Identify and help resolve database system problems,
  • Assist in providing training, guidance and technical assistance to AMIkids, Inc. and Program team members in the areas of data collection, data entry, and overall function of the internal data systems as needed,
  • Assist with special projects and other duties as assigned.

Minimum Education, Training and Experience
  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree required, Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree preferred
  • High level proficiency in Microsoft Excel required; strong competency in SQL preferred
  • Introductory statistical, data analysis and social science coursework required,
  • Knowledge and experience with database software, and Microsoft Office programs,
  • Working knowledge of statistical analyses and database management practices related to data and research in the field of juvenile justice, criminology or related field
  • Ability to effectively express ideas verbally and non-verbally and actively listen to individuals and groups,
  • Must possess and maintain valid driver\xe2\x80\x99s license in the state of employment and have a driving record that meets the standards of the AMIkids Transportation Policy (CDL may be required based on role).

As well as gain an opportunity to make an exceptional difference in kids' lives, AMIKids offers a comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and STD Insurance, Retirement Opportunities, Holidays & PTO, Education Assistance, EAP, Disability Programs and Credit Union Membership.

AMIkids Inc., Equal Employment Opportunity Employer \xe2\x80\xa2 Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled \xe2\x80\xa2 Drug-Free Workplace

title: Data Analyst Scheduling Fulltime Days

description:
b"
We are presently seeking a full-time Data Analyst to work with an internationally recognized multidisciplinary health policy and clinical outcomes research team at the Orthopaedic and Arthritis Center for Outcomes Research as well as the Policy and Innovation eValuation in Orthopaedic Treatments (PIVOT) Center, both in the Department of Orthopaedic Surgery at Brigham and Women\xe2\x80\x99s Hospital and Harvard Medical School.
The incumbent will have a Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in biostatistics/statistics or a related field. This position will include both data analysis and data management responsibilities. Primary job functions will include developing and implementing SAS programs including the creation of SAS macros to facilitate the processing and manipulation of datasets, preparation of study reports, and providing data programming and analytic support on a range of research projects. There will be the opportunity for career development with respect to authorship opportunities for journal manuscripts and abstracts/posters for professional scientific meetings. The incumbent will be essential to the research operations of OrACORe/PIVOT and will be an integral member of the centers.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
This position will incorporate both data analyst and data management responsibilities:
Data Analyst
  • Develop statistical analysis programs in SAS to create exploratory data tables and listings
  • Create and run recurring analytic and tracking reports, and create and disseminate high-level summary reports on study progress
  • Develop computer programs for importing data to central databases
  • Perform statistical analyses for specific projects and document results in study reports
  • Assist in the preparation of journal manuscripts and abstracts/posters for professional scientific meetings
Data Management
  • Develop of data collection forms
  • Design and implement data collection/capture systems
  • Creating and maintaining databases for a variety of research studies
  • Responsible for monitoring clinical site study recruitment, retention, and data quality
  • Data cleaning and evaluation of data quality
  • Identifies, investigates, and resolves data anomalies and discrepancies
  • Interface with study staff to develop standardized data cleaning and data reporting processes, and to perform preliminary analyses of the data
  • Responsible for creating and maintaining clean analysis datasets and accompanying codebooks/data documentation
Qualifications
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Masters degree in biostatistics, statistics, epidemiology or related field
  • High proficiency in statistical computing; SAS programming skills desired
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Detail and process oriented
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, including both long-term and term and short-term projects
  • Ability to learn to use new software programs
SKILLS/ ABILITIES/ COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:
  • Must be flexible to accommodate a diverse work-flow
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Intellectual independence and initiative
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Ability to work as a team member and independently
  • Proficient with standard office software (Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint as well as Internet applications) and the ability to learn new computer applications
  • Interest in public health, biostatistics, epidemiology, health policy, medicine, and/or computer science
Working Conditions: Normal office environment. Work will be hectic at times, diverse and very interesting.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'

Position Summary

Our Birmingham office has an opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the firm\xe2\x80\x99s expanding Affirmative Action & OFCCP Compliance Practice Group. The Data Analyst will prepare governmental compliance reports and be responsible, with attorney oversight, for preparing statistical analyses using Microsoft Excel or related database software. The Data Analyst typically assists with gathering, validating and synthesizing workforce/people and compensation-related data. This includes data entry, data validation/reconciliation, and data management/organization, researching publically-available data sources, document review, and operation of software for data analysis. The nature of the law firm environment can be unpredictable at times, and the Data Analyst should be able to deal with a heavy workload and tight deadlines.

Successful job applicants will be able to perform these essential functions with or without reasonable accommodations:

  • Compiling, validating, and synthesizing employment and compensation-related data from multiple sources, workbooks, and/or spreadsheets
  • Working efficiently with data sets (varying sizes from small to very large) in Microsoft Excel, including generating pivot tables and using formulas
  • Researching data sources as applicable to project needs (e.g., Bureau of Labor Statistics, U.S. Census, etc.)
  • Creating and preparing compliance reports under the supervision of an attorney
  • Assisting in development of HRIS-related metrics, analysis, and presentations
  • Ability to communicate effectively with colleagues and clients

Requirements

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent
  • Strong analytical and mathematical skills
  • Experience in analyzing and reconciling large data sets
  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong organizational and problem solving skills
  • Ability to prioritize multiple assignments, use initiative and judgment to accomplish timely results, and work under tight deadlines
  • Willingness to work a flexible schedule, including overtime as necessary

Preferred Requirements:

  • Human resources, HRIS, or compensation analytics experience
  • Knowledge of EEO/affirmative action compliance-related laws and regulations

Benefits

Ogletree Deakins offers a robust suite of benefits for our Staff including: Paid Time Off, Sick Time, a 401(k) matching program, Profit Sharing, Paid Holidays, Paid Parental Leave, affordable Health and Life Insurance including Dental & Vision coverage, Health Savings Account /Flexible Spending Accounts to help offset the cost of dependent care and/or health care expenses, Teladoc (24/7 access to a doctor by phone or online video), Tuition Reimbursement and an Employee Assistance Program

Firm Overview

Ogletree Deakins is one of the largest labor and employment law firms representing management in all types of employment-related legal matters. The firm has 850 lawyers located in 53 offices across the United States, Canada, Europe and Mexico. Ogletree Deakins has been named a \xe2\x80\x9cLaw Firm of the Year\xe2\x80\x9d for eight consecutive years by U.S. News \xe2\x80\x93 Best Lawyers\xc2\xae \xe2\x80\x9cBest Law Firms\xe2\x80\x9d. In 2019, the publication named Ogletree Deakins its \xe2\x80\x9cLaw Firm of the Year\xe2\x80\x9d in the Employment Law category. In addition to handling labor and employment law matters, the firm has thriving practices focused on business immigration, employee benefits, and workplace safety and health law. Ogletree Deakins represents a diverse range of clients, from small businesses to Fortune 50 companies.

We are fully committed to the importance of diversity within the legal profession, as well as all workplace environments and strongly encourage the interest of diverse candidates in the firm.

Equal Opportunity Employer.

#LI-MH1

title: Compliance Data Analyst

description:
b"

Data Analyst

The Role: Platts Analytics is seeking a Data Analyst Data Quality team. This entry level position has the daily responsibility of analyzing commodity data and creation of market relevant analysis. The analyst will be responsible for supporting and working with the Analytics team in the creation of actionable intelligence for our clients to make informed trading/risk management and investment decisions.

The Impact: The analyst will collect economic, fundamental and financial information specific to a commodity market or organization, will conduct market sector or statistical analysis and will interpret key market data elements into useful business information. They will look to leverage their educational knowledge when performing analysis on data sets that will require knowledge of Excel and basic SQL.

The Career Opportunity: This person would be placed on a challenging, steep learning curve in terms of not only becoming a subject matter expert in power, but also in competing/complementary markets, such as Natural gas, LNG natural gas liquids and petrochemicals. This position could lead to continued growth within the organization by demonstrating strong analysis and presentation abilities.

The Team / The Business: You are part of a global team. Fast paced, with ever expanding new ways of delivering important content and analytics to our readers.

Your Skills: Energy, Power, Natural Gas, Crude Oil, and/or Natural Gas Liquids, Engineering, Financial and/or financial modeling, strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)

Our Hiring Manager says: I'm looking for someone who is naturally curious about energy markets. If you're right for this role, you'll be inquisitive, conscientious, an effective problem solver and communicator. You'll love this job because you'll be in a dynamic environment where market-moving changes occur every day, surrounded by high-energy individuals who are enthusiastic about covering markets, spotting key trends and reporting about those trends to our curious customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Collects and maintains economic and financial information specific to a commodity market or organization, conducts market sector or statistical analysis and interprets key market data elements into useful business information.
  • Leverages broad scope of knowledge when performing analysis on data sets.
  • Performs high level analysis and modeling. May develop quantitative/analytic models. Supports data needs as well as quality assurance of accurate data in outgoing products.
  • Conducts research including identifying data, data input, and statistical analysis of results and creates and maintains data, rate of return analysis and reports.
  • Prepares presentations and engages directly with clients to present or demonstrate products related to data.
  • Responds to client requests/inquiries for data and analysis.
  • Trains and mentors other individuals and teams to ensure accuracy and timeliness of information to clients.

Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Business, and/or related field of study preferred. Equivalent experience within their discipline also considered.
  • 0-2 years' of experience in natural gas/oil/energy industry
  • Persistent with a natural curiosity about energy market fundamentals and technical details. Good grasp of the natural gas pipeline grid and its dynamics.
  • Displays well-rounded communication skills that implement good listening techniques, clear and good verbal skills. The ability to communicate across a wide range of groups and personalities internally and externally.
  • Works well in a team environment, focusing on collaboration and adapting to the needs of a diverse team. Has subject matter expertise in one market
  • Displays good numeracy including ability to conceptualize proportional relationships; understand the basic principles of algebra and statistics; as well as a basic understanding of how to apply basic math functions in Excel. A basic understanding of economics principles is also required.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and the use of pivot tables. SQL,Python Power Bi, R and Matlab experience.
  • Adept at managing multiple tasks and adhering to regular deadlines. Able to adjust priorities.

About S&P Global Platts

At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We\xe2\x80\x99re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.

S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. Careers.spglobal.com For more information, visit www.platts.com

To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes.

title: Data Analyst

description:
b'
The goal of the Feed the Future Innovation Lab for Nutrition Research is to provide support in Asia and Africa devoted to implementing effective interventions that integrate agriculture and nutrition activities to achieve a significant reduction in stunting among children less than 24 months of age and under nutrition in mothers. Our specific goals include: to generate i) empirical evidence of what works at scale (through applied research), and ii) to support enhanced institutional and human capacity in Bangladesh to conduct research and implement effective nutrition activities at scale in future years.
This Data Analyst position will be based in Boston at the Friedman School. The responsibilities include supporting the Principal Investigators with the analysis of two large scale studies in Asia and Africa. Assists with producing statistical and evaluation reports, including tables and charts. Provides technical assistance for data analysis, statistical analysis, and development of data collection instruments. Performs other duties as required.
Qualifications
Basic Requirements:
Graduate level training MPH/MBBS required and experience in data analysis a must. Working with complex data sets and a variety of software packages. Experience in developing countries a must understanding of research, surveillance and program evaluation methodologies. Knowledge of instrument design and development and data coding procedures. Good writing skills and expertise in international public health issues necessary. Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a diverse team. Ability to meet deadlines and to manage workload independently.

An employee in this position must complete all appropriate background checks at the time of hire, promotion, or transfer.

title: Systems Data Analyst

Overview

Zywave provides unique, industry-leading solutions for insurance brokers, and is hiring an Associate Database Analyst to manage the data conversion process for use in proprietary web applications and interpret/consult on data format and use with broker clients. As a Zywave Associate Database Analyst, you will assist clients in formatting and loading critical business data to Zywave databases for use in insurance applications. What You Should Have

  • Ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner.

  • Detail-orientation, strong customer service skills, the ability to work both collaboratively and independently.
  • Solid business writing and verbal communication skills.

title: Associate Data Analyst

description:
b'
Location: El Segundo, California, United States
Job Summary:

AT&T is seeking a Data Analyst to partner with Entertainment Operations, Product and Engineering teams to build better data capabilities and dig into analysis around the usage and performance of our linear and streaming video experience.
In this role, your objective is to drive understanding and insight by analyzing our current product and user experience. You will work closely with our leadership team to understand analytic needs and communicate insights to the broader organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Solve challenging problems regarding our video platforms by transforming raw data into action driven analysis.
  • Report these insights by building rich, high-visibility reports/dashboards/tools used by our direct stakeholders, senior management and a diverse set of teams across the organization.
  • Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, requirements/KPI specifications, processing, statistical analysis, ongoing deliverables and presentations.
  • Build statistical models to understand our customers network experience and predict/prevent failures at our broadcast centers to reduce outages.
  • Make business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, forecasting, hypothesis testing, optimization) with actionable findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.

In this role, your objective is to drive understanding and insight by analyzing our current product and user experience. You will work closely with our leadership team to understand analytic needs and communicate insights to the broader organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Solve challenging problems regarding our video platforms by transforming raw data into action driven analysis.
  • Report these insights by building rich, high-visibility reports/dashboards/tools used by our direct stakeholders, senior management and a diverse set of teams across the organization.
  • Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, requirements/KPI specifications, processing, statistical analysis, ongoing deliverables and presentations.
  • Build statistical models to understand our customers network experience and predict/prevent failures at our broadcast centers to reduce outages.
  • Make business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, forecasting, hypothesis testing, optimization) with actionable findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.

Key Qualifications:
  • BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or other quantitative field.
  • 1-3 years related experience in advanced analytics, big data, relational database structures, research methods, sampling techniques, and system testing.
  • You have excellent communication skills to present findings to both a technical and non-technical audience, and can manage stakeholder priorities directly.
  • You have a thorough understanding of statistics, customer segmentation, machine learning, and implementing models in a production environment.
  • You have experience in a data-driven environment designing and building metrics-focused deliverables, in a technical, consumer-facing and/or mobile technology business
  • Strong understanding of SQL to manipulate data and/or other big data querying languages
  • You have experience with analytical packages such as R or Python and at least one analytic reporting platform (Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc.) or data visualization libraries (ggplot, Highcharts, D3.js, etc.)
  • You have working knowledge of ETL and data warehousing concepts, or have experience with ETL tools like (Matillion, Alteryx, Knime, etc..)
Bonus Points For:
  • Experience with distributed analytic processing technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Presto, MapReduce, Kafka, Spark, etc.)
  • Understanding of media domain, content, and/or streaming business model
